2473 if (!thesaurus && curwin->w_p_spellw_onebuf_opt.wo_spell)
2474 dict = (char_u *)"spell";
2475 else
2476 return;
2477 }
2478
2479 buf = xmalloc(LSIZE512);
2480 regmatch.regprog = NULL((void*)0); /* so that we can goto theend */
2481
2482 /* If 'infercase' is set, don't use 'smartcase' here */
2483 save_p_scs = p_scs;
2484 if (curbuf->b_p_inf)
2485 p_scs = FALSE0;
2486
2487 /* When invoked to match whole lines for CTRL-X CTRL-L adjust the pattern
2488 * to only match at the start of a line. Otherwise just match the
2489 * pattern. Also need to double backslashes. */
2490 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3) {
2491 char_u *pat_esc = vim_strsave_escaped(pat, (char_u *)"\\");
2492
2493 size_t len = STRLEN(pat_esc)strlen((char *)(pat_esc)) + 10;
2494 ptr = xmalloc(len);
2495 vim_snprintf((char *)ptr, len, "^\\s*\\zs\\V%s", pat_esc);
2496 regmatch.regprog = vim_regcomp(ptr, RE_MAGIC1);
2497 free(pat_esc);
2498 free(ptr);
2499 } else {
2500 regmatch.regprog = vim_regcomp(pat, p_magic ? RE_MAGIC1 : 0);
2501 if (regmatch.regprog == NULL((void*)0))
2502 goto theend;
2503 }
2504
2505 /* ignore case depends on 'ignorecase', 'smartcase' and "pat" */
2506 regmatch.rm_ic = ignorecase(pat);
2507 while (*dict != NUL'\000' && !got_int && !compl_interrupted) {
2508 /* copy one dictionary file name into buf */
2509 if (flags == DICT_EXACT(2)) {
2510 count = 1;
2511 files = &dict;
2512 } else {
2513 /* Expand wildcards in the dictionary name, but do not allow
2514 * backticks (for security, the 'dict' option may have been set in
2515 * a modeline). */
2516 copy_option_part(&dict, buf, LSIZE512, ",");
2517 if (!thesaurus && STRCMP(buf, "spell")strcmp((char *)(buf), (char *)("spell")) == 0)
2518 count = -1;
2519 else if (vim_strchr(buf, '`') != NULL((void*)0)
2520 || expand_wildcards(1, &buf, &count, &files,
2521 EW_FILE0x02|EW_SILENT0x20) != OK1)
2522 count = 0;
2523 }
2524
2525 if (count == -1) {
2526 /* Complete from active spelling. Skip "\<" in the pattern, we
2527 * don't use it as a RE. */
2528 if (pat[0] == '\\' && pat[1] == '<')
2529 ptr = pat + 2;
2530 else
2531 ptr = pat;
2532 spell_dump_compl(ptr, regmatch.rm_ic, &dir, 0);
2533 } else if (count > 0) { /* avoid warning for using "files" uninit */
2534 ins_compl_files(count, files, thesaurus, flags,
2535 &regmatch, buf, &dir);
2536 if (flags != DICT_EXACT(2))
2537 FreeWild(count, files);
2538 }
2539 if (flags != 0)
2540 break;
2541 }
2542
2543theend:
2544 p_scs = save_p_scs;
2545 vim_regfree(regmatch.regprog);
2546 free(buf);
2547}
2548
2549static void ins_compl_files(int count, char_u **files, int thesaurus, int flags, regmatch_T *regmatch, char_u *buf, int *dir)
2550{
2551 char_u *ptr;
2552 int i;
2553 FILE *fp;
2554 int add_r;
2555
2556 for (i = 0; i < count && !got_int && !compl_interrupted; i++) {
2557 fp = mch_fopen((char *)files[i], "r")fopen(((char *)files[i]), ("r")); /* open dictionary file */
2558 if (flags != DICT_EXACT(2)) {
2559 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1),
2560 _("Scanning dictionary: %s")gettext((char *)("Scanning dictionary: %s")), (char *)files[i]);
2561 (void)msg_trunc_attr(IObuff, TRUE1, hl_attr(HLF_R)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_R)]);
2562 }
2563
2564 if (fp != NULL((void*)0)) {
2565 /*
2566 * Read dictionary file line by line.
2567 * Check each line for a match.
2568 */
2569 while (!got_int && !compl_interrupted
2570 && !vim_fgets(buf, LSIZE512, fp)) {
2571 ptr = buf;
2572 while (vim_regexec(regmatch, buf, (colnr_T)(ptr - buf))) {
2573 ptr = regmatch->startp[0];
2574 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3)
2575 ptr = find_line_end(ptr);
2576 else
2577 ptr = find_word_end(ptr);
2578 add_r = ins_compl_add_infercase(regmatch->startp[0],
2579 (int)(ptr - regmatch->startp[0]),
2580 p_ic, files[i], *dir, 0);
2581 if (thesaurus) {
2582 char_u *wstart;
2583
2584 /*
2585 * Add the other matches on the line
2586 */
2587 ptr = buf;
2588 while (!got_int) {
2589 /* Find start of the next word. Skip white
2590 * space and punctuation. */
2591 ptr = find_word_start(ptr);
2592 if (*ptr == NUL'\000' || *ptr == NL'\012')
2593 break;
2594 wstart = ptr;
2595
2596 /* Find end of the word. */
2597 if (has_mbyte)
2598 /* Japanese words may have characters in
2599 * different classes, only separate words
2600 * with single-byte non-word characters. */
2601 while (*ptr != NUL'\000') {
2602 int l = (*mb_ptr2len)(ptr);
2603
2604 if (l < 2 && !vim_iswordc(*ptr))
2605 break;
2606 ptr += l;
2607 }
2608 else
2609 ptr = find_word_end(ptr);
2610
2611 /* Add the word. Skip the regexp match. */
2612 if (wstart != regmatch->startp[0])
2613 add_r = ins_compl_add_infercase(wstart,
2614 (int)(ptr - wstart),
2615 p_ic, files[i], *dir, 0);
2616 }
2617 }
2618 if (add_r == OK1)
2619 /* if dir was BACKWARD then honor it just once */
2620 *dir = FORWARD1;
2621 else if (add_r == FAIL0)
2622 break;
2623 /* avoid expensive call to vim_regexec() when at end
2624 * of line */
2625 if (*ptr == '\n' || got_int)
2626 break;
2627 }
2628 line_breakcheck();
2629 ins_compl_check_keys(50);
2630 }
2631 fclose(fp);
2632 }
2633 }
2634}
2635
2636/*
2637 * Find the start of the next word.
2638 * Returns a pointer to the first char of the word. Also stops at a NUL.
2639 */
2640char_u *find_word_start(char_u *ptr)
2641{
2642 if (has_mbyte)
2643 while (*ptr != NUL'\000' && *ptr != '\n' && mb_get_class(ptr) <= 1)
2644 ptr += (*mb_ptr2len)(ptr);
2645 else
2646 while (*ptr != NUL'\000' && *ptr != '\n' && !vim_iswordc(*ptr))
2647 ++ptr;
2648 return ptr;
2649}
2650
2651/*
2652 * Find the end of the word. Assumes it starts inside a word.
2653 * Returns a pointer to just after the word.
2654 */
2655char_u *find_word_end(char_u *ptr)
2656{
2657 int start_class;
2658
2659 if (has_mbyte) {
2660 start_class = mb_get_class(ptr);
2661 if (start_class > 1)
2662 while (*ptr != NUL'\000') {
2663 ptr += (*mb_ptr2len)(ptr);
2664 if (mb_get_class(ptr) != start_class)
2665 break;
2666 }
2667 } else
2668 while (vim_iswordc(*ptr))
2669 ++ptr;
2670 return ptr;
2671}
2672
2673/*
2674 * Find the end of the line, omitting CR and NL at the end.
2675 * Returns a pointer to just after the line.
2676 */
2677static char_u *find_line_end(char_u *ptr)
2678{
2679 char_u *s;
2680
2681 s = ptr + STRLEN(ptr)strlen((char *)(ptr));
2682 while (s > ptr && (s[-1] == CAR'\015' || s[-1] == NL'\012'))
2683 --s;
2684 return s;
2685}
2686
2687/*
2688 * Free the list of completions
2689 */
2690static void ins_compl_free(void)
2691{
2692 compl_T *match;
2693 int i;
2694
2695 free(compl_pattern);
2696 compl_pattern = NULL((void*)0);
2697 free(compl_leader);
2698 compl_leader = NULL((void*)0);
2699
2700 if (compl_first_match == NULL((void*)0))
2701 return;
2702
2703 ins_compl_del_pum();
2704 pum_clear();
2705
2706 compl_curr_match = compl_first_match;
2707 do {
2708 match = compl_curr_match;
2709 compl_curr_match = compl_curr_match->cp_next;
2710 free(match->cp_str);
2711 /* several entries may use the same fname, free it just once. */
2712 if (match->cp_flags & FREE_FNAME(2))
2713 free(match->cp_fname);
2714 for (i = 0; i < CPT_COUNT4; ++i)
2715 free(match->cp_text[i]);
2716 free(match);
2717 } while (compl_curr_match != NULL((void*)0) && compl_curr_match != compl_first_match);
2718 compl_first_match = compl_curr_match = NULL((void*)0);
2719 compl_shown_match = NULL((void*)0);
2720}
2721
2722static void ins_compl_clear(void)
2723{
2724 compl_cont_status = 0;
2725 compl_started = FALSE0;
2726 compl_matches = 0;
2727 free(compl_pattern);
2728 compl_pattern = NULL((void*)0);
2729 free(compl_leader);
2730 compl_leader = NULL((void*)0);
2731 edit_submode_extra = NULL((void*)0);
2732 free(compl_orig_text);
2733 compl_orig_text = NULL((void*)0);
2734 compl_enter_selects = FALSE0;
2735}
2736
2737/*
2738 * Return TRUE when Insert completion is active.
2739 */
2740int ins_compl_active(void)
2741{
2742 return compl_started;
2743}
2744
2745/*
2746 * Delete one character before the cursor and show the subset of the matches
2747 * that match the word that is now before the cursor.
2748 * Returns the character to be used, NUL if the work is done and another char
2749 * to be got from the user.
2750 */
2751static int ins_compl_bs(void)
2752{
2753 char_u *line;
2754 char_u *p;
2755
2756 line = get_cursor_line_ptr();
2757 p = line + curwin->w_cursor.col;
2758 mb_ptr_back(line, p)p -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(line, p - 1) + 1) : 1;
2759
2760 /* Stop completion when the whole word was deleted. For Omni completion
2761 * allow the word to be deleted, we won't match everything. */
2762 if ((int)(p - line) - (int)compl_col < 0
2763 || ((int)(p - line) - (int)compl_col == 0
2764 && (ctrl_x_mode & CTRL_X_OMNI13) == 0))
2765 return K_BS(-(('k') + ((int)('b') << 8)));
2766
2767 /* Deleted more than what was used to find matches or didn't finish
2768 * finding all matches: need to look for matches all over again. */
2769 if (curwin->w_cursor.col <= compl_col + compl_length
2770 || ins_compl_need_restart())
2771 ins_compl_restart();
2772
2773 free(compl_leader);
2774 compl_leader = vim_strnsave(line + compl_col, (int)(p - line) - compl_col);
2775 ins_compl_new_leader();
2776 if (compl_shown_match != NULL((void*)0))
2777 /* Make sure current match is not a hidden item. */
2778 compl_curr_match = compl_shown_match;
2779
2780 return NUL'\000';
2781}
2782
2783/*
2784 * Return TRUE when we need to find matches again, ins_compl_restart() is to
2785 * be called.
2786 */
2787static int ins_compl_need_restart(void)
2788{
2789 /* Return TRUE if we didn't complete finding matches or when the
2790 * 'completefunc' returned "always" in the "refresh" dictionary item. */
2791 return compl_was_interrupted
2792 || ((ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_FUNCTION12 || ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_OMNI13)
2793 && compl_opt_refresh_always);
2794}
2795
2796/*
2797 * Called after changing "compl_leader".
2798 * Show the popup menu with a different set of matches.
2799 * May also search for matches again if the previous search was interrupted.
2800 */
2801static void ins_compl_new_leader(void)
2802{
2803 ins_compl_del_pum();
2804 ins_compl_delete();
2805 ins_bytes(compl_leader + ins_compl_len());
2806 compl_used_match = FALSE0;
2807
2808 if (compl_started)
2809 ins_compl_set_original_text(compl_leader);
2810 else {
2811 spell_bad_len = 0; /* need to redetect bad word */
2812 /*
2813 * Matches were cleared, need to search for them now. First display
2814 * the changed text before the cursor. Set "compl_restarting" to
2815 * avoid that the first match is inserted.
2816 */
2817 update_screen(0);
2818 compl_restarting = TRUE1;
2819 if (ins_complete(Ctrl_N14) == FAIL0)
2820 compl_cont_status = 0;
2821 compl_restarting = FALSE0;
2822 }
2823
2824 compl_enter_selects = !compl_used_match;
2825
2826 /* Show the popup menu with a different set of matches. */
2827 ins_compl_show_pum();
2828
2829 /* Don't let Enter select the original text when there is no popup menu. */
2830 if (compl_match_array == NULL((void*)0))
2831 compl_enter_selects = FALSE0;
2832}
2833
2834/*
2835 * Return the length of the completion, from the completion start column to
2836 * the cursor column. Making sure it never goes below zero.
2837 */
2838static int ins_compl_len(void)
2839{
2840 int off = (int)curwin->w_cursor.col - (int)compl_col;
2841
2842 if (off < 0)
2843 return 0;
2844 return off;
2845}
2846
2847/*
2848 * Append one character to the match leader. May reduce the number of
2849 * matches.
2850 */
2851static void ins_compl_addleader(int c)
2852{
2853 int cc;
2854
2855 if (has_mbyte && (cc = (*mb_char2len)(c)) > 1) {
2856 char_u buf[MB_MAXBYTES21 + 1];
2857
2858 (*mb_char2bytes)(c, buf);
2859 buf[cc] = NUL'\000';
2860 ins_char_bytes(buf, cc);
2861 if (compl_opt_refresh_always)
2862 AppendToRedobuff(buf);
2863 } else {
2864 ins_char(c);
2865 if (compl_opt_refresh_always)
2866 AppendCharToRedobuff(c);
2867 }
2868
2869 /* If we didn't complete finding matches we must search again. */
2870 if (ins_compl_need_restart())
2871 ins_compl_restart();
2872
2873 /* When 'always' is set, don't reset compl_leader. While completing,
2874 * cursor doesn't point original position, changing compl_leader would
2875 * break redo. */
2876 if (!compl_opt_refresh_always) {
2877 free(compl_leader);
2878 compl_leader = vim_strnsave(get_cursor_line_ptr() + compl_col,
2879 (int)(curwin->w_cursor.col - compl_col));
2880 ins_compl_new_leader();
2881 }
2882}
2883
2884/*
2885 * Setup for finding completions again without leaving CTRL-X mode. Used when
2886 * BS or a key was typed while still searching for matches.
2887 */
2888static void ins_compl_restart(void)
2889{
2890 ins_compl_free();
2891 compl_started = FALSE0;
2892 compl_matches = 0;
2893 compl_cont_status = 0;
2894 compl_cont_mode = 0;
2895}
2896
2897/*
2898 * Set the first match, the original text.
2899 */
2900static void ins_compl_set_original_text(char_u *str)
2901{
2902 /* Replace the original text entry. */
2903 if (compl_first_match->cp_flags & ORIGINAL_TEXT(1)) { /* safety check */
2904 free(compl_first_match->cp_str);
2905 compl_first_match->cp_str = vim_strsave(str);
2906 }
2907}
2908
2909/*
2910 * Append one character to the match leader. May reduce the number of
2911 * matches.
2912 */
2913static void ins_compl_addfrommatch(void)
2914{
2915 char_u *p;
2916 int len = (int)curwin->w_cursor.col - (int)compl_col;
2917 int c;
2918 compl_T *cp;
2919
2920 p = compl_shown_match->cp_str;
2921 if ((int)STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p)) <= len) { /* the match is too short */
2922 /* When still at the original match use the first entry that matches
2923 * the leader. */
2924 if (compl_shown_match->cp_flags & ORIGINAL_TEXT(1)) {
2925 p = NULL((void*)0);
2926 for (cp = compl_shown_match->cp_next; cp != NULL((void*)0)
2927 && cp != compl_first_match; cp = cp->cp_next) {
2928 if (compl_leader == NULL((void*)0)
2929 || ins_compl_equal(cp, compl_leader,
2930 (int)STRLEN(compl_leader)strlen((char *)(compl_leader)))) {
2931 p = cp->cp_str;
2932 break;
2933 }
2934 }
2935 if (p == NULL((void*)0) || (int)STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p)) <= len)
2936 return;
2937 } else
2938 return;
2939 }
2940 p += len;
2941 c = PTR2CHAR(p)(has_mbyte ? mb_ptr2char(p) : (int)*(p));
2942 ins_compl_addleader(c);
2943}
2944
2945/*
2946 * Prepare for Insert mode completion, or stop it.
2947 * Called just after typing a character in Insert mode.
2948 * Returns TRUE when the character is not to be inserted;
2949 */
2950static int ins_compl_prep(int c)
2951{
2952 char_u *ptr;
2953 int want_cindent;
2954 int retval = FALSE0;
2955
2956 /* Forget any previous 'special' messages if this is actually
2957 * a ^X mode key - bar ^R, in which case we wait to see what it gives us.
2958 */
2959 if (c != Ctrl_R18 && vim_is_ctrl_x_key(c))
2960 edit_submode_extra = NULL((void*)0);
2961
2962 /* Ignore end of Select mode mapping and mouse scroll buttons. */
2963 if (c == K_SELECT(-((245) + ((int)(('X')) << 8))) || c == K_MOUSEDOWN(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSEDOWN) << 8))) || c == K_MOUSEUP(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSEUP) << 8)))
2964 || c == K_MOUSELEFT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSELEFT) << 8))) || c == K_MOUSERIGHT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSERIGHT) << 8))))
2965 return retval;
2966
2967 /* Set "compl_get_longest" when finding the first matches. */
2968 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_NOT_DEFINED_YET1
2969 || (ctrl_x_mode == 0 && !compl_started)) {
2970 compl_get_longest = (vim_strchr(p_cot, 'l') != NULL((void*)0));
2971 compl_used_match = TRUE1;
2972 }
2973
2974 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_NOT_DEFINED_YET1) {
2975 /*
2976 * We have just typed CTRL-X and aren't quite sure which CTRL-X mode
2977 * it will be yet. Now we decide.
2978 */
2979 switch (c) {
2980 case Ctrl_E5:
2981 case Ctrl_Y25:
2982 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_SCROLL2;
2983 if (!(State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40))
2984 edit_submode = (char_u *)_(" (insert) Scroll (^E/^Y)")gettext((char *)(" (insert) Scroll (^E/^Y)"));
2985 else
2986 edit_submode = (char_u *)_(" (replace) Scroll (^E/^Y)")gettext((char *)(" (replace) Scroll (^E/^Y)"));
2987 edit_submode_pre = NULL((void*)0);
2988 showmode();
2989 break;
2990 case Ctrl_L12:
2991 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3;
2992 break;
2993 case Ctrl_F6:
2994 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_FILES4;
2995 break;
2996 case Ctrl_K11:
2997 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_DICTIONARY(9 + 0x100);
2998 break;
2999 case Ctrl_R18:
3000 /* Simply allow ^R to happen without affecting ^X mode */
3001 break;
3002 case Ctrl_T20:
3003 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_THESAURUS(10 + 0x100);
3004 break;
3005 case Ctrl_U21:
3006 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_FUNCTION12;
3007 break;
3008 case Ctrl_O15:
3009 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_OMNI13;
3010 break;
3011 case 's':
3012 case Ctrl_S19:
3013 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_SPELL14;
3014 ++emsg_off; /* Avoid getting the E756 error twice. */
3015 spell_back_to_badword();
3016 --emsg_off;
3017 break;
3018 case Ctrl_RSB29:
3019 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_TAGS(5 + 0x100);
3020 break;
3021 case Ctrl_I9:
3022 case K_S_TAB(-(('k') + ((int)('B') << 8))):
3023 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_PATH_PATTERNS(6 + 0x100);
3024 break;
3025 case Ctrl_D4:
3026 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_PATH_DEFINES(7 + 0x100);
3027 break;
3028 case Ctrl_V22:
3029 case Ctrl_Q17:
3030 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_CMDLINE11;
3031 break;
3032 case Ctrl_P16:
3033 case Ctrl_N14:
3034 /* ^X^P means LOCAL expansion if nothing interrupted (eg we
3035 * just started ^X mode, or there were enough ^X's to cancel
3036 * the previous mode, say ^X^F^X^X^P or ^P^X^X^X^P, see below)
3037 * do normal expansion when interrupting a different mode (say
3038 * ^X^F^X^P or ^P^X^X^P, see below)
3039 * nothing changes if interrupting mode 0, (eg, the flag
3040 * doesn't change when going to ADDING mode -- Acevedo */
3041 if (!(compl_cont_status & CONT_INTRPT(2 + 4)))
3042 compl_cont_status |= CONT_LOCAL32;
3043 else if (compl_cont_mode != 0)
3044 compl_cont_status &= ~CONT_LOCAL32;
3045 /* FALLTHROUGH */
3046 default:
3047 /* If we have typed at least 2 ^X's... for modes != 0, we set
3048 * compl_cont_status = 0 (eg, as if we had just started ^X
3049 * mode).
3050 * For mode 0, we set "compl_cont_mode" to an impossible
3051 * value, in both cases ^X^X can be used to restart the same
3052 * mode (avoiding ADDING mode).
3053 * Undocumented feature: In a mode != 0 ^X^P and ^X^X^P start
3054 * 'complete' and local ^P expansions respectively.
3055 * In mode 0 an extra ^X is needed since ^X^P goes to ADDING
3056 * mode -- Acevedo */
3057 if (c == Ctrl_X24) {
3058 if (compl_cont_mode != 0)
3059 compl_cont_status = 0;
3060 else
3061 compl_cont_mode = CTRL_X_NOT_DEFINED_YET1;
3062 }
3063 ctrl_x_mode = 0;
3064 edit_submode = NULL((void*)0);
3065 showmode();
3066 break;
3067 }
3068 } else if (ctrl_x_mode != 0) {
3069 /* We're already in CTRL-X mode, do we stay in it? */
3070 if (!vim_is_ctrl_x_key(c)) {
3071 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_SCROLL2)
3072 ctrl_x_mode = 0;
3073 else
3074 ctrl_x_mode = CTRL_X_FINISHED8;
3075 edit_submode = NULL((void*)0);
3076 }
3077 showmode();
3078 }
3079
3080 if (compl_started || ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_FINISHED8) {
3081 /* Show error message from attempted keyword completion (probably
3082 * 'Pattern not found') until another key is hit, then go back to
3083 * showing what mode we are in. */
3084 showmode();
3085 if ((ctrl_x_mode == 0 && c != Ctrl_N14 && c != Ctrl_P16 && c != Ctrl_R18
3086 && !ins_compl_pum_key(c))
3087 || ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_FINISHED8) {
3088 /* Get here when we have finished typing a sequence of ^N and
3089 * ^P or other completion characters in CTRL-X mode. Free up
3090 * memory that was used, and make sure we can redo the insert. */
3091 if (compl_curr_match != NULL((void*)0) || compl_leader != NULL((void*)0) || c == Ctrl_E5) {
3092 /*
3093 * If any of the original typed text has been changed, eg when
3094 * ignorecase is set, we must add back-spaces to the redo
3095 * buffer. We add as few as necessary to delete just the part
3096 * of the original text that has changed.
3097 * When using the longest match, edited the match or used
3098 * CTRL-E then don't use the current match.
3099 */
3100 if (compl_curr_match != NULL((void*)0) && compl_used_match && c != Ctrl_E5)
3101 ptr = compl_curr_match->cp_str;
3102 else
3103 ptr = NULL((void*)0);
3104 ins_compl_fixRedoBufForLeader(ptr);
3105 }
3106
3107 want_cindent = (can_cindent && cindent_on());
3108 /*
3109 * When completing whole lines: fix indent for 'cindent'.
3110 * Otherwise, break line if it's too long.
3111 */
3112 if (compl_cont_mode == CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3) {
3113 /* re-indent the current line */
3114 if (want_cindent) {
3115 do_c_expr_indent();
3116 want_cindent = FALSE0; /* don't do it again */
3117 }
3118 } else {
3119 int prev_col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
3120
3121 /* put the cursor on the last char, for 'tw' formatting */
3122 if (prev_col > 0)
3123 dec_cursor();
3124 if (stop_arrow() == OK1)
3125 insertchar(NUL'\000', 0, -1);
3126 if (prev_col > 0
3127 && get_cursor_line_ptr()[curwin->w_cursor.col] != NUL'\000')
3128 inc_cursor();
3129 }
3130
3131 /* If the popup menu is displayed pressing CTRL-Y means accepting
3132 * the selection without inserting anything. When
3133 * compl_enter_selects is set the Enter key does the same. */
3134 if ((c == Ctrl_Y25 || (compl_enter_selects
3135 && (c == CAR'\015' || c == K_KENTER(-(('K') + ((int)('A') << 8))) || c == NL'\012')))
3136 && pum_visible())
3137 retval = TRUE1;
3138
3139 /* CTRL-E means completion is Ended, go back to the typed text. */
3140 if (c == Ctrl_E5) {
3141 ins_compl_delete();
3142 if (compl_leader != NULL((void*)0))
3143 ins_bytes(compl_leader + ins_compl_len());
3144 else if (compl_first_match != NULL((void*)0))
3145 ins_bytes(compl_orig_text + ins_compl_len());
3146 retval = TRUE1;
3147 }
3148
3149 auto_format(FALSE0, TRUE1);
3150
3151 ins_compl_free();
3152 compl_started = FALSE0;
3153 compl_matches = 0;
3154 if (!shortmess(SHM_COMPLETIONMENU'c')) {
3155 msg_clr_cmdline(); // necessary for "noshowmode"
3156 }
3157 ctrl_x_mode = 0;
3158 compl_enter_selects = FALSE0;
3159 if (edit_submode != NULL((void*)0)) {
3160 edit_submode = NULL((void*)0);
3161 showmode();
3162 }
3163
3164 /*
3165 * Indent now if a key was typed that is in 'cinkeys'.
3166 */
3167 if (want_cindent && in_cinkeys(KEY_COMPLETE0x103, ' ', inindent(0)))
3168 do_c_expr_indent();
3169 /* Trigger the CompleteDone event to give scripts a chance to act
3170 * upon the completion. */
3171 apply_autocmds(EVENT_COMPLETEDONE, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FALSE0, curbuf);
3172 }
3173 } else if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_LOCAL_MSG15)
3174 /* Trigger the CompleteDone event to give scripts a chance to act
3175 * upon the (possibly failed) completion. */
3176 apply_autocmds(EVENT_COMPLETEDONE, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FALSE0, curbuf);
3177
3178 /* reset continue_* if we left expansion-mode, if we stay they'll be
3179 * (re)set properly in ins_complete() */
3180 if (!vim_is_ctrl_x_key(c)) {
3181 compl_cont_status = 0;
3182 compl_cont_mode = 0;
3183 }
3184
3185 return retval;
3186}
3187
3188/*
3189 * Fix the redo buffer for the completion leader replacing some of the typed
3190 * text. This inserts backspaces and appends the changed text.
3191 * "ptr" is the known leader text or NUL.
3192 */
3193static void ins_compl_fixRedoBufForLeader(char_u *ptr_arg)
3194{
3195 int len;
3196 char_u *p;
3197 char_u *ptr = ptr_arg;
3198
3199 if (ptr == NULL((void*)0)) {
3200 if (compl_leader != NULL((void*)0))
3201 ptr = compl_leader;
3202 else
3203 return; /* nothing to do */
3204 }
3205 if (compl_orig_text != NULL((void*)0)) {
3206 p = compl_orig_text;
3207 for (len = 0; p[len] != NUL'\000' && p[len] == ptr[len]; ++len)
3208 ;
3209 if (len > 0)
3210 len -= (*mb_head_off)(p, p + len);
3211 for (p += len; *p != NUL'\000'; mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1)
3212 AppendCharToRedobuff(K_BS(-(('k') + ((int)('b') << 8))));
3213 } else
3214 len = 0;
3215 if (ptr != NULL((void*)0))
3216 AppendToRedobuffLit(ptr + len, -1);
3217}
3218
3219/*
3220 * Loops through the list of windows, loaded-buffers or non-loaded-buffers
3221 * (depending on flag) starting from buf and looking for a non-scanned
3222 * buffer (other than curbuf). curbuf is special, if it is called with
3223 * buf=curbuf then it has to be the first call for a given flag/expansion.
3224 *
3225 * Returns the buffer to scan, if any, otherwise returns curbuf -- Acevedo
3226 */
3227static buf_T *ins_compl_next_buf(buf_T *buf, int flag)
3228{
3229 static win_T *wp;
3230
3231 if (flag == 'w') { /* just windows */
3232 if (buf == curbuf) /* first call for this flag/expansion */
3233 wp = curwin;
3234 while ((wp = (wp->w_next != NULL((void*)0) ? wp->w_next : firstwin)) != curwin
3235 && wp->w_buffer->b_scanned)
3236 ;
3237 buf = wp->w_buffer;
3238 } else
3239 /* 'b' (just loaded buffers), 'u' (just non-loaded buffers) or 'U'
3240 * (unlisted buffers)
3241 * When completing whole lines skip unloaded buffers. */
3242 while ((buf = (buf->b_next != NULL((void*)0) ? buf->b_next : firstbuf)) != curbuf
3243 && ((flag == 'U'
3244 ? buf->b_p_bl
3245 : (!buf->b_p_bl
3246 || (buf->b_ml.ml_mfp == NULL((void*)0)) != (flag == 'u')))
3247 || buf->b_scanned))
3248 ;
3249 return buf;
3250}
3251
3252
3253/*
3254 * Execute user defined complete function 'completefunc' or 'omnifunc', and
3255 * get matches in "matches".
3256 */
3257static void
3258expand_by_function (
3259 int type, /* CTRL_X_OMNI or CTRL_X_FUNCTION */
3260 char_u *base
3261)
3262{
3263 list_T *matchlist = NULL((void*)0);
3264 dict_T *matchdict = NULL((void*)0);
3265 char_u *args[2];
3266 char_u *funcname;
3267 pos_T pos;
3268 win_T *curwin_save;
3269 buf_T *curbuf_save;
3270 typval_T rettv;
3271
3272 funcname = (type == CTRL_X_FUNCTION12) ? curbuf->b_p_cfu : curbuf->b_p_ofu;
3273 if (*funcname == NUL'\000')
3274 return;
3275
3276 /* Call 'completefunc' to obtain the list of matches. */
3277 args[0] = (char_u *)"0";
3278 args[1] = base;
3279
3280 pos = curwin->w_cursor;
3281 curwin_save = curwin;
3282 curbuf_save = curbuf;
3283
3284 /* Call a function, which returns a list or dict. */
3285 if (call_vim_function(funcname, 2, args, FALSE0, FALSE0, &rettv) == OK1) {
3286 switch (rettv.v_type) {
3287 case VAR_LIST4:
3288 matchlist = rettv.vval.v_list;
3289 break;
3290 case VAR_DICT5:
3291 matchdict = rettv.vval.v_dict;
3292 break;
3293 default:
3294 /* TODO: Give error message? */
3295 clear_tv(&rettv);
3296 break;
3297 }
3298 }
3299
3300 if (curwin_save != curwin || curbuf_save != curbuf) {
3301 EMSG(_(e_complwin))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_complwin))));
3302 goto theend;
3303 }
3304 curwin->w_cursor = pos; /* restore the cursor position */
3305 check_cursor();
3306 if (!equalpos(curwin->w_cursor, pos)(((curwin->w_cursor).lnum == (pos).lnum) && ((curwin
->w_cursor).col == (pos).col) && ((curwin->w_cursor
).coladd == (pos).coladd))) {
3307 EMSG(_(e_compldel))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_compldel))));
3308 goto theend;
3309 }
3310
3311 if (matchlist != NULL((void*)0))
3312 ins_compl_add_list(matchlist);
3313 else if (matchdict != NULL((void*)0))
3314 ins_compl_add_dict(matchdict);
3315
3316theend:
3317 if (matchdict != NULL((void*)0))
3318 dict_unref(matchdict);
3319 if (matchlist != NULL((void*)0))
3320 list_unref(matchlist);
3321}
3322
3323/*
3324 * Add completions from a list.
3325 */
3326static void ins_compl_add_list(list_T *list)
3327{
3328 listitem_T *li;
3329 int dir = compl_direction;
3330
3331 /* Go through the List with matches and add each of them. */
3332 for (li = list->lv_first; li != NULL((void*)0); li = li->li_next) {
3333 if (ins_compl_add_tv(&li->li_tv, dir) == OK1)
3334 /* if dir was BACKWARD then honor it just once */
3335 dir = FORWARD1;
3336 else if (did_emsg)
3337 break;
3338 }
3339}
3340
3341/*
3342 * Add completions from a dict.
3343 */
3344static void ins_compl_add_dict(dict_T *dict)
3345{
3346 dictitem_T *di_refresh;
3347 dictitem_T *di_words;
3348
3349 /* Check for optional "refresh" item. */
3350 compl_opt_refresh_always = FALSE0;
3351 di_refresh = dict_find(dict, (char_u *)"refresh", 7);
3352 if (di_refresh != NULL((void*)0) && di_refresh->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING2) {
3353 char_u *v = di_refresh->di_tv.vval.v_string;
3354
3355 if (v != NULL((void*)0) && STRCMP(v, (char_u *)"always")strcmp((char *)(v), (char *)((char_u *)"always")) == 0)
3356 compl_opt_refresh_always = TRUE1;
3357 }
3358
3359 /* Add completions from a "words" list. */
3360 di_words = dict_find(dict, (char_u *)"words", 5);
3361 if (di_words != NULL((void*)0) && di_words->di_tv.v_type == VAR_LIST4)
3362 ins_compl_add_list(di_words->di_tv.vval.v_list);
3363}
3364
3365/*
3366 * Add a match to the list of matches from a typeval_T.
3367 * If the given string is already in the list of completions, then return
3368 * NOTDONE, otherwise add it to the list and return OK. If there is an error
3369 * then FAIL is returned.
3370 */
3371int ins_compl_add_tv(typval_T *tv, int dir)
3372{
3373 char_u *word;
3374 int icase = FALSE0;
3375 int adup = FALSE0;
3376 int aempty = FALSE0;
3377 char_u *(cptext[CPT_COUNT4]);
3378
3379 if (tv->v_type == VAR_DICT5 && tv->vval.v_dict != NULL((void*)0)) {
3380 word = get_dict_string(tv->vval.v_dict, (char_u *)"word", FALSE0);
3381 cptext[CPT_ABBR0] = get_dict_string(tv->vval.v_dict,
3382 (char_u *)"abbr", FALSE0);
3383 cptext[CPT_MENU1] = get_dict_string(tv->vval.v_dict,
3384 (char_u *)"menu", FALSE0);
3385 cptext[CPT_KIND2] = get_dict_string(tv->vval.v_dict,
3386 (char_u *)"kind", FALSE0);
3387 cptext[CPT_INFO3] = get_dict_string(tv->vval.v_dict,
3388 (char_u *)"info", FALSE0);
3389 if (get_dict_string(tv->vval.v_dict, (char_u *)"icase", FALSE0) != NULL((void*)0))
3390 icase = get_dict_number(tv->vval.v_dict, (char_u *)"icase");
3391 if (get_dict_string(tv->vval.v_dict, (char_u *)"dup", FALSE0) != NULL((void*)0))
3392 adup = get_dict_number(tv->vval.v_dict, (char_u *)"dup");
3393 if (get_dict_string(tv->vval.v_dict, (char_u *)"empty", FALSE0) != NULL((void*)0))
3394 aempty = get_dict_number(tv->vval.v_dict, (char_u *)"empty");
3395 } else {
3396 word = get_tv_string_chk(tv);
3397 memset(cptext, 0, sizeof(cptext));
3398 }
3399 if (word == NULL((void*)0) || (!aempty && *word == NUL'\000'))
3400 return FAIL0;
3401 return ins_compl_add(word, -1, icase, NULL((void*)0), cptext, dir, 0, adup);
3402}
3403
3404/*
3405 * Get the next expansion(s), using "compl_pattern".
3406 * The search starts at position "ini" in curbuf and in the direction
3407 * compl_direction.
3408 * When "compl_started" is FALSE start at that position, otherwise continue
3409 * where we stopped searching before.
3410 * This may return before finding all the matches.
3411 * Return the total number of matches or -1 if still unknown -- Acevedo
3412 */
3413static int ins_compl_get_exp(pos_T *ini)
3414{
3415 static pos_T first_match_pos;
3416 static pos_T last_match_pos;
3417 static char_u *e_cpt = (char_u *)""; /* curr. entry in 'complete' */
3418 static int found_all = FALSE0; /* Found all matches of a
3419 certain type. */
3420 static buf_T *ins_buf = NULL((void*)0); /* buffer being scanned */
3421
3422 pos_T *pos;
3423 char_u **matches;
3424 int save_p_scs;
3425 bool_Bool save_p_ws;
3426 int save_p_ic;
3427 int i;
3428 int num_matches;
3429 int len;
3430 int found_new_match;
3431 int type = ctrl_x_mode;
3432 char_u *ptr;
3433 char_u *dict = NULL((void*)0);
3434 int dict_f = 0;
3435 compl_T *old_match;
3436 int set_match_pos;
3437
3438 if (!compl_started) {
3439 FOR_ALL_BUFFERS(buf)for (buf_T *buf = firstbuf; buf != ((void*)0); buf = buf->
b_next) {
3440 buf->b_scanned = 0;
3441 }
3442 found_all = FALSE0;
3443 ins_buf = curbuf;
3444 e_cpt = (compl_cont_status & CONT_LOCAL32)
3445 ? (char_u *)"." : curbuf->b_p_cpt;
3446 last_match_pos = first_match_pos = *ini;
3447 }
3448
3449 old_match = compl_curr_match; /* remember the last current match */
3450 pos = (compl_direction == FORWARD1) ? &last_match_pos : &first_match_pos;
3451 /* For ^N/^P loop over all the flags/windows/buffers in 'complete' */
3452 for (;; ) {
3453 found_new_match = FAIL0;
3454 set_match_pos = FALSE0;
3455
3456 /* For ^N/^P pick a new entry from e_cpt if compl_started is off,
3457 * or if found_all says this entry is done. For ^X^L only use the
3458 * entries from 'complete' that look in loaded buffers. */
3459 if ((ctrl_x_mode == 0 || ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3)
3460 && (!compl_started || found_all)) {
3461 found_all = FALSE0;
3462 while (*e_cpt == ',' || *e_cpt == ' ')
3463 e_cpt++;
3464 if (*e_cpt == '.' && !curbuf->b_scanned) {
3465 ins_buf = curbuf;
3466 first_match_pos = *ini;
3467 /* So that ^N can match word immediately after cursor */
3468 if (ctrl_x_mode == 0)
3469 dec(&first_match_pos);
3470 last_match_pos = first_match_pos;
3471 type = 0;
3472
3473 /* Remember the first match so that the loop stops when we
3474 * wrap and come back there a second time. */
3475 set_match_pos = TRUE1;
3476 } else if (vim_strchr((char_u *)"buwU", *e_cpt) != NULL((void*)0)
3477 && (ins_buf =
3478 ins_compl_next_buf(ins_buf, *e_cpt)) != curbuf) {
3479 /* Scan a buffer, but not the current one. */
3480 if (ins_buf->b_ml.ml_mfp != NULL((void*)0)) { /* loaded buffer */
3481 compl_started = TRUE1;
3482 first_match_pos.col = last_match_pos.col = 0;
3483 first_match_pos.lnum = ins_buf->b_ml.ml_line_count + 1;
3484 last_match_pos.lnum = 0;
3485 type = 0;
3486 } else { /* unloaded buffer, scan like dictionary */
3487 found_all = TRUE1;
3488 if (ins_buf->b_fname == NULL((void*)0))
3489 continue;
3490 type = CTRL_X_DICTIONARY(9 + 0x100);
3491 dict = ins_buf->b_fname;
3492 dict_f = DICT_EXACT(2);
3493 }
3494 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1), _("Scanning: %s")gettext((char *)("Scanning: %s")),
3495 ins_buf->b_fname == NULL((void*)0)
3496 ? buf_spname(ins_buf)
3497 : ins_buf->b_sfname == NULL((void*)0)
3498 ? ins_buf->b_fname
3499 : ins_buf->b_sfname);
3500 (void)msg_trunc_attr(IObuff, TRUE1, hl_attr(HLF_R)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_R)]);
3501 } else if (*e_cpt == NUL'\000')
3502 break;
3503 else {
3504 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3)
3505 type = -1;
3506 else if (*e_cpt == 'k' || *e_cpt == 's') {
3507 if (*e_cpt == 'k')
3508 type = CTRL_X_DICTIONARY(9 + 0x100);
3509 else
3510 type = CTRL_X_THESAURUS(10 + 0x100);
3511 if (*++e_cpt != ',' && *e_cpt != NUL'\000') {
3512 dict = e_cpt;
3513 dict_f = DICT_FIRST(1);
3514 }
3515 } else if (*e_cpt == 'i')
3516 type = CTRL_X_PATH_PATTERNS(6 + 0x100);
3517 else if (*e_cpt == 'd')
3518 type = CTRL_X_PATH_DEFINES(7 + 0x100);
3519 else if (*e_cpt == ']' || *e_cpt == 't') {
3520 type = CTRL_X_TAGS(5 + 0x100);
3521 vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1), _("Scanning tags.")gettext((char *)("Scanning tags.")));
3522 (void)msg_trunc_attr(IObuff, TRUE1, hl_attr(HLF_R)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_R)]);
3523 } else
3524 type = -1;
3525
3526 /* in any case e_cpt is advanced to the next entry */
3527 (void)copy_option_part(&e_cpt, IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1), ",");
3528
3529 found_all = TRUE1;
3530 if (type == -1)
3531 continue;
3532 }
3533 }
3534
3535 switch (type) {
3536 case -1:
3537 break;
3538 case CTRL_X_PATH_PATTERNS(6 + 0x100):
3539 case CTRL_X_PATH_DEFINES(7 + 0x100):
3540 find_pattern_in_path(compl_pattern, compl_direction,
3541 (int)STRLEN(compl_pattern)strlen((char *)(compl_pattern)), FALSE0, FALSE0,
3542 (type == CTRL_X_PATH_DEFINES(7 + 0x100)
3543 && !(compl_cont_status & CONT_SOL16))
3544 ? FIND_DEFINE2 : FIND_ANY1, 1L, ACTION_EXPAND5,
3545 (linenr_T)1, (linenr_T)MAXLNUM(0x7fffffffL));
3546 break;
3547
3548 case CTRL_X_DICTIONARY(9 + 0x100):
3549 case CTRL_X_THESAURUS(10 + 0x100):
3550 ins_compl_dictionaries(
3551 dict != NULL((void*)0) ? dict
3552 : (type == CTRL_X_THESAURUS(10 + 0x100)
3553 ? (*curbuf->b_p_tsr == NUL'\000'
3554 ? p_tsr
3555 : curbuf->b_p_tsr)
3556 : (*curbuf->b_p_dict == NUL'\000'
3557 ? p_dict
3558 : curbuf->b_p_dict)),
3559 compl_pattern,
3560 dict != NULL((void*)0) ? dict_f
3561 : 0, type == CTRL_X_THESAURUS(10 + 0x100));
3562 dict = NULL((void*)0);
3563 break;
3564
3565 case CTRL_X_TAGS(5 + 0x100):
3566 /* set p_ic according to p_ic, p_scs and pat for find_tags(). */
3567 save_p_ic = p_ic;
3568 p_ic = ignorecase(compl_pattern);
3569
3570 /* Find up to TAG_MANY matches. Avoids that an enormous number
3571 * of matches is found when compl_pattern is empty */
3572 if (find_tags(compl_pattern, &num_matches, &matches,
3573 TAG_REGEXP4 | TAG_NAMES2 | TAG_NOIC8 |
3574 TAG_INS_COMP64 | (ctrl_x_mode ? TAG_VERBOSE32 : 0),
3575 TAG_MANY300, curbuf->b_ffname) == OK1 && num_matches > 0) {
3576 ins_compl_add_matches(num_matches, matches, p_ic);
3577 }
3578 p_ic = save_p_ic;
3579 break;
3580
3581 case CTRL_X_FILES4:
3582 if (expand_wildcards(1, &compl_pattern, &num_matches, &matches,
3583 EW_FILE0x02|EW_DIR0x01|EW_ADDSLASH0x08|EW_SILENT0x20) == OK1) {
3584
3585 /* May change home directory back to "~". */
3586 tilde_replace(compl_pattern, num_matches, matches);
3587 ins_compl_add_matches(num_matches, matches, p_fic || p_wic);
3588 }
3589 break;
3590
3591 case CTRL_X_CMDLINE11:
3592 if (expand_cmdline(&compl_xp, compl_pattern,
3593 (int)STRLEN(compl_pattern)strlen((char *)(compl_pattern)),
3594 &num_matches, &matches) == EXPAND_OK)
3595 ins_compl_add_matches(num_matches, matches, FALSE0);
3596 break;
3597
3598 case CTRL_X_FUNCTION12:
3599 case CTRL_X_OMNI13:
3600 expand_by_function(type, compl_pattern);
3601 break;
3602
3603 case CTRL_X_SPELL14:
3604 num_matches = expand_spelling(first_match_pos.lnum,
3605 compl_pattern, &matches);
3606 if (num_matches > 0)
3607 ins_compl_add_matches(num_matches, matches, p_ic);
3608 break;
3609
3610 default: /* normal ^P/^N and ^X^L */
3611 /*
3612 * If 'infercase' is set, don't use 'smartcase' here
3613 */
3614 save_p_scs = p_scs;
3615 if (ins_buf->b_p_inf)
3616 p_scs = FALSE0;
3617
3618 /* Buffers other than curbuf are scanned from the beginning or the
3619 * end but never from the middle, thus setting nowrapscan in this
3620 * buffers is a good idea, on the other hand, we always set
3621 * wrapscan for curbuf to avoid missing matches -- Acevedo,Webb */
3622 save_p_ws = p_ws;
3623 if (ins_buf != curbuf)
3624 p_ws = false0;
3625 else if (*e_cpt == '.')
3626 p_ws = true1;
3627 for (;; ) {
3628 int flags = 0;
3629
3630 ++msg_silent; /* Don't want messages for wrapscan. */
3631
3632 /* ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE || word-wise search that
3633 * has added a word that was at the beginning of the line */
3634 if ( ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3
3635 || (compl_cont_status & CONT_SOL16))
3636 found_new_match = search_for_exact_line(ins_buf, pos,
3637 compl_direction, compl_pattern);
3638 else
3639 found_new_match = searchit(NULL((void*)0), ins_buf, pos,
3640 compl_direction,
3641 compl_pattern, 1L, SEARCH_KEEP0x400 + SEARCH_NFMSG0x08,
3642 RE_LAST2, (linenr_T)0, NULL((void*)0));
3643 --msg_silent;
3644 if (!compl_started || set_match_pos) {
3645 /* set "compl_started" even on fail */
3646 compl_started = TRUE1;
3647 first_match_pos = *pos;
3648 last_match_pos = *pos;
3649 set_match_pos = FALSE0;
3650 } else if (first_match_pos.lnum == last_match_pos.lnum
3651 && first_match_pos.col == last_match_pos.col)
3652 found_new_match = FAIL0;
3653 if (found_new_match == FAIL0) {
3654 if (ins_buf == curbuf)
3655 found_all = TRUE1;
3656 break;
3657 }
3658
3659 /* when ADDING, the text before the cursor matches, skip it */
3660 if ( (compl_cont_status & CONT_ADDING1) && ins_buf == curbuf
3661 && ini->lnum == pos->lnum
3662 && ini->col == pos->col)
3663 continue;
3664 ptr = ml_get_buf(ins_buf, pos->lnum, FALSE0) + pos->col;
3665 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3) {
3666 if (compl_cont_status & CONT_ADDING1) {
3667 if (pos->lnum >= ins_buf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
3668 continue;
3669 ptr = ml_get_buf(ins_buf, pos->lnum + 1, FALSE0);
3670 if (!p_paste)
3671 ptr = skipwhite(ptr);
3672 }
3673 len = (int)STRLEN(ptr)strlen((char *)(ptr));
3674 } else {
3675 char_u *tmp_ptr = ptr;
3676
3677 if (compl_cont_status & CONT_ADDING1) {
3678 tmp_ptr += compl_length;
3679 /* Skip if already inside a word. */
3680 if (vim_iswordp(tmp_ptr))
3681 continue;
3682 /* Find start of next word. */
3683 tmp_ptr = find_word_start(tmp_ptr);
3684 }
3685 /* Find end of this word. */
3686 tmp_ptr = find_word_end(tmp_ptr);
3687 len = (int)(tmp_ptr - ptr);
3688
3689 if ((compl_cont_status & CONT_ADDING1)
3690 && len == compl_length) {
3691 if (pos->lnum < ins_buf->b_ml.ml_line_count) {
3692 /* Try next line, if any. the new word will be
3693 * "join" as if the normal command "J" was used.
3694 * IOSIZE is always greater than
3695 * compl_length, so the next STRNCPY always
3696 * works -- Acevedo */
3697 STRNCPY(IObuff, ptr, len)strncpy((char *)(IObuff), (char *)(ptr), (size_t)(len));
3698 ptr = ml_get_buf(ins_buf, pos->lnum + 1, FALSE0);
3699 tmp_ptr = ptr = skipwhite(ptr);
3700 /* Find start of next word. */
3701 tmp_ptr = find_word_start(tmp_ptr);
3702 /* Find end of next word. */
3703 tmp_ptr = find_word_end(tmp_ptr);
3704 if (tmp_ptr > ptr) {
3705 if (*ptr != ')' && IObuff[len - 1] != TAB'\011') {
3706 if (IObuff[len - 1] != ' ')
3707 IObuff[len++] = ' ';
3708 /* IObuf =~ "\k.* ", thus len >= 2 */
3709 if (p_js
3710 && (IObuff[len - 2] == '.'
3711 || (vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_JOINSP'j')
3712 == NULL((void*)0)
3713 && (IObuff[len - 2] == '?'
3714 || IObuff[len - 2] == '!'))))
3715 IObuff[len++] = ' ';
3716 }
3717 /* copy as much as possible of the new word */
3718 if (tmp_ptr - ptr >= IOSIZE(1024+1) - len)
3719 tmp_ptr = ptr + IOSIZE(1024+1) - len - 1;
3720 STRNCPY(IObuff + len, ptr, tmp_ptr - ptr)strncpy((char *)(IObuff + len), (char *)(ptr), (size_t)(tmp_ptr
- ptr));
3721 len += (int)(tmp_ptr - ptr);
3722 flags |= CONT_S_IPOS8;
3723 }
3724 IObuff[len] = NUL'\000';
3725 ptr = IObuff;
3726 }
3727 if (len == compl_length)
3728 continue;
3729 }
3730 }
3731 if (ins_compl_add_infercase(ptr, len, p_ic,
3732 ins_buf == curbuf ? NULL((void*)0) : ins_buf->b_sfname,
3733 0, flags) != NOTDONE2) {
3734 found_new_match = OK1;
3735 break;
3736 }
3737 }
3738 p_scs = save_p_scs;
3739 p_ws = save_p_ws;
3740 }
3741
3742 /* check if compl_curr_match has changed, (e.g. other type of
3743 * expansion added something) */
3744 if (type != 0 && compl_curr_match != old_match)
3745 found_new_match = OK1;
3746
3747 /* break the loop for specialized modes (use 'complete' just for the
3748 * generic ctrl_x_mode == 0) or when we've found a new match */
3749 if ((ctrl_x_mode != 0 && ctrl_x_mode != CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3)
3750 || found_new_match != FAIL0) {
3751 if (got_int)
3752 break;
3753 /* Fill the popup menu as soon as possible. */
3754 if (type != -1)
3755 ins_compl_check_keys(0);
3756
3757 if ((ctrl_x_mode != 0 && ctrl_x_mode != CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3)
3758 || compl_interrupted)
3759 break;
3760 compl_started = TRUE1;
3761 } else {
3762 /* Mark a buffer scanned when it has been scanned completely */
3763 if (type == 0 || type == CTRL_X_PATH_PATTERNS(6 + 0x100))
3764 ins_buf->b_scanned = TRUE1;
3765
3766 compl_started = FALSE0;
3767 }
3768 }
3769 compl_started = TRUE1;
3770
3771 if ((ctrl_x_mode == 0 || ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3)
3772 && *e_cpt == NUL'\000') /* Got to end of 'complete' */
3773 found_new_match = FAIL0;
3774
3775 i = -1; /* total of matches, unknown */
3776 if (found_new_match == FAIL0
3777 || (ctrl_x_mode != 0 && ctrl_x_mode != CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3))
3778 i = ins_compl_make_cyclic();
3779
3780 /* If several matches were added (FORWARD) or the search failed and has
3781 * just been made cyclic then we have to move compl_curr_match to the next
3782 * or previous entry (if any) -- Acevedo */
3783 compl_curr_match = compl_direction == FORWARD1 ? old_match->cp_next
3784 : old_match->cp_prev;
3785 if (compl_curr_match == NULL((void*)0))
3786 compl_curr_match = old_match;
3787 return i;
3788}
3789
3790/* Delete the old text being completed. */
3791static void ins_compl_delete(void)
3792{
3793 int i;
3794
3795 /*
3796 * In insert mode: Delete the typed part.
3797 * In replace mode: Put the old characters back, if any.
3798 */
3799 i = compl_col + (compl_cont_status & CONT_ADDING1 ? compl_length : 0);
3800 backspace_until_column(i);
3801 changed_cline_bef_curs();
3802}
3803
3804/* Insert the new text being completed. */
3805static void ins_compl_insert(void)
3806{
3807 ins_bytes(compl_shown_match->cp_str + ins_compl_len());
3808 if (compl_shown_match->cp_flags & ORIGINAL_TEXT(1))
3809 compl_used_match = FALSE0;
3810 else
3811 compl_used_match = TRUE1;
3812}
3813
3814/*
3815 * Fill in the next completion in the current direction.
3816 * If "allow_get_expansion" is TRUE, then we may call ins_compl_get_exp() to
3817 * get more completions. If it is FALSE, then we just do nothing when there
3818 * are no more completions in a given direction. The latter case is used when
3819 * we are still in the middle of finding completions, to allow browsing
3820 * through the ones found so far.
3821 * Return the total number of matches, or -1 if still unknown -- webb.
3822 *
3823 * compl_curr_match is currently being used by ins_compl_get_exp(), so we use
3824 * compl_shown_match here.
3825 *
3826 * Note that this function may be called recursively once only. First with
3827 * "allow_get_expansion" TRUE, which calls ins_compl_get_exp(), which in turn
3828 * calls this function with "allow_get_expansion" FALSE.
3829 */
3830static int
3831ins_compl_next (
3832 int allow_get_expansion,
3833 int count, /* repeat completion this many times; should
3834 be at least 1 */
3835 int insert_match /* Insert the newly selected match */
3836)
3837{
3838 int num_matches = -1;
3839 int i;
3840 int todo = count;
3841 compl_T *found_compl = NULL((void*)0);
3842 int found_end = FALSE0;
3843 int advance;
3844
3845 /* When user complete function return -1 for findstart which is next
3846 * time of 'always', compl_shown_match become NULL. */
3847 if (compl_shown_match == NULL((void*)0))
3848 return -1;
3849
3850 if (compl_leader != NULL((void*)0)
3851 && (compl_shown_match->cp_flags & ORIGINAL_TEXT(1)) == 0) {
3852 /* Set "compl_shown_match" to the actually shown match, it may differ
3853 * when "compl_leader" is used to omit some of the matches. */
3854 while (!ins_compl_equal(compl_shown_match,
3855 compl_leader, (int)STRLEN(compl_leader)strlen((char *)(compl_leader)))
3856 && compl_shown_match->cp_next != NULL((void*)0)
3857 && compl_shown_match->cp_next != compl_first_match)
3858 compl_shown_match = compl_shown_match->cp_next;
3859
3860 /* If we didn't find it searching forward, and compl_shows_dir is
3861 * backward, find the last match. */
3862 if (compl_shows_dir == BACKWARD(-1)
3863 && !ins_compl_equal(compl_shown_match,
3864 compl_leader, (int)STRLEN(compl_leader)strlen((char *)(compl_leader)))
3865 && (compl_shown_match->cp_next == NULL((void*)0)
3866 || compl_shown_match->cp_next == compl_first_match)) {
3867 while (!ins_compl_equal(compl_shown_match,
3868 compl_leader, (int)STRLEN(compl_leader)strlen((char *)(compl_leader)))
3869 && compl_shown_match->cp_prev != NULL((void*)0)
3870 && compl_shown_match->cp_prev != compl_first_match)
3871 compl_shown_match = compl_shown_match->cp_prev;
3872 }
3873 }
3874
3875 if (allow_get_expansion && insert_match
3876 && (!(compl_get_longest || compl_restarting) || compl_used_match))
3877 /* Delete old text to be replaced */
3878 ins_compl_delete();
3879
3880 /* When finding the longest common text we stick at the original text,
3881 * don't let CTRL-N or CTRL-P move to the first match. */
3882 advance = count != 1 || !allow_get_expansion || !compl_get_longest;
3883
3884 /* When restarting the search don't insert the first match either. */
3885 if (compl_restarting) {
3886 advance = FALSE0;
3887 compl_restarting = FALSE0;
3888 }
3889
3890 /* Repeat this for when <PageUp> or <PageDown> is typed. But don't wrap
3891 * around. */
3892 while (--todo >= 0) {
3893 if (compl_shows_dir == FORWARD1 && compl_shown_match->cp_next != NULL((void*)0)) {
3894 compl_shown_match = compl_shown_match->cp_next;
3895 found_end = (compl_first_match != NULL((void*)0)
3896 && (compl_shown_match->cp_next == compl_first_match
3897 || compl_shown_match == compl_first_match));
3898 } else if (compl_shows_dir == BACKWARD(-1)
3899 && compl_shown_match->cp_prev != NULL((void*)0)) {
3900 found_end = (compl_shown_match == compl_first_match);
3901 compl_shown_match = compl_shown_match->cp_prev;
3902 found_end |= (compl_shown_match == compl_first_match);
3903 } else {
3904 if (!allow_get_expansion) {
3905 if (advance) {
3906 if (compl_shows_dir == BACKWARD(-1))
3907 compl_pending -= todo + 1;
3908 else
3909 compl_pending += todo + 1;
3910 }
3911 return -1;
3912 }
3913
3914 if (advance) {
3915 if (compl_shows_dir == BACKWARD(-1))
3916 --compl_pending;
3917 else
3918 ++compl_pending;
3919 }
3920
3921 /* Find matches. */
3922 num_matches = ins_compl_get_exp(&compl_startpos);
3923
3924 /* handle any pending completions */
3925 while (compl_pending != 0 && compl_direction == compl_shows_dir
3926 && advance) {
3927 if (compl_pending > 0 && compl_shown_match->cp_next != NULL((void*)0)) {
3928 compl_shown_match = compl_shown_match->cp_next;
3929 --compl_pending;
3930 }
3931 if (compl_pending < 0 && compl_shown_match->cp_prev != NULL((void*)0)) {
3932 compl_shown_match = compl_shown_match->cp_prev;
3933 ++compl_pending;
3934 } else
3935 break;
3936 }
3937 found_end = FALSE0;
3938 }
3939 if ((compl_shown_match->cp_flags & ORIGINAL_TEXT(1)) == 0
3940 && compl_leader != NULL((void*)0)
3941 && !ins_compl_equal(compl_shown_match,
3942 compl_leader, (int)STRLEN(compl_leader)strlen((char *)(compl_leader))))
3943 ++todo;
3944 else
3945 /* Remember a matching item. */
3946 found_compl = compl_shown_match;
3947
3948 /* Stop at the end of the list when we found a usable match. */
3949 if (found_end) {
3950 if (found_compl != NULL((void*)0)) {
3951 compl_shown_match = found_compl;
3952 break;
3953 }
3954 todo = 1; /* use first usable match after wrapping around */
3955 }
3956 }
3957
3958 /* Insert the text of the new completion, or the compl_leader. */
3959 if (insert_match) {
3960 if (!compl_get_longest || compl_used_match)
3961 ins_compl_insert();
3962 else
3963 ins_bytes(compl_leader + ins_compl_len());
3964 } else
3965 compl_used_match = FALSE0;
3966
3967 if (!allow_get_expansion) {
3968 /* may undisplay the popup menu first */
3969 ins_compl_upd_pum();
3970
3971 /* redraw to show the user what was inserted */
3972 update_screen(0);
3973
3974 /* display the updated popup menu */
3975 ins_compl_show_pum();
3976
3977 /* Delete old text to be replaced, since we're still searching and
3978 * don't want to match ourselves! */
3979 ins_compl_delete();
3980 }
3981
3982 /* Enter will select a match when the match wasn't inserted and the popup
3983 * menu is visible. */
3984 compl_enter_selects = !insert_match && compl_match_array != NULL((void*)0);
3985
3986 /*
3987 * Show the file name for the match (if any)
3988 * Truncate the file name to avoid a wait for return.
3989 */
3990 if (compl_shown_match->cp_fname != NULL((void*)0)) {
3991 STRCPY(IObuff, "match in file ")strcpy((char *)(IObuff), (char *)("match in file "));
3992 i = (vim_strsize(compl_shown_match->cp_fname) + 16) - sc_col;
3993 if (i <= 0)
3994 i = 0;
3995 else
3996 STRCAT(IObuff, "<")strcat((char *)(IObuff), (char *)("<"));
3997 STRCAT(IObuff, compl_shown_match->cp_fname + i)strcat((char *)(IObuff), (char *)(compl_shown_match->cp_fname
+ i));
3998 msg(IObuff);
3999 redraw_cmdline = FALSE0; /* don't overwrite! */
4000 }
4001
4002 return num_matches;
4003}
4004
4005/*
4006 * Call this while finding completions, to check whether the user has hit a key
4007 * that should change the currently displayed completion, or exit completion
4008 * mode. Also, when compl_pending is not zero, show a completion as soon as
4009 * possible. -- webb
4010 * "frequency" specifies out of how many calls we actually check.
4011 */
4012void ins_compl_check_keys(int frequency)
4013{
4014 static int count = 0;
4015
4016 int c;
4017
4018 /* Don't check when reading keys from a script. That would break the test
4019 * scripts */
4020 if (using_script())
4021 return;
4022
4023 /* Only do this at regular intervals */
4024 if (++count < frequency)
4025 return;
4026 count = 0;
4027
4028 /* Check for a typed key. Do use mappings, otherwise vim_is_ctrl_x_key()
4029 * can't do its work correctly. */
4030 c = vpeekc_any();
4031 if (c != NUL'\000') {
4032 if (vim_is_ctrl_x_key(c) && c != Ctrl_X24 && c != Ctrl_R18) {
4033 c = safe_vgetc(); /* Eat the character */
4034 compl_shows_dir = ins_compl_key2dir(c);
4035 (void)ins_compl_next(FALSE0, ins_compl_key2count(c),
4036 c != K_UP(-(('k') + ((int)('u') << 8))) && c != K_DOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('d') << 8))));
4037 } else {
4038 /* Need to get the character to have KeyTyped set. We'll put it
4039 * back with vungetc() below. But skip K_IGNORE. */
4040 c = safe_vgetc();
4041 if (c != K_IGNORE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_IGNORE) << 8)))) {
4042 /* Don't interrupt completion when the character wasn't typed,
4043 * e.g., when doing @q to replay keys. */
4044 if (c != Ctrl_R18 && KeyTyped)
4045 compl_interrupted = TRUE1;
4046
4047 vungetc(c);
4048 }
4049 }
4050 }
4051 if (compl_pending != 0 && !got_int) {
4052 int todo = compl_pending > 0 ? compl_pending : -compl_pending;
4053
4054 compl_pending = 0;
4055 (void)ins_compl_next(FALSE0, todo, TRUE1);
4056 }
4057}
4058
4059/*
4060 * Decide the direction of Insert mode complete from the key typed.
4061 * Returns BACKWARD or FORWARD.
4062 */
4063static int ins_compl_key2dir(int c)
4064{
4065 if (c == Ctrl_P16 || c == Ctrl_L12
4066 || (pum_visible() && (c == K_PAGEUP(-(('k') + ((int)('P') << 8))) || c == K_KPAGEUP(-(('K') + ((int)('3') << 8)))
4067 || c == K_S_UP(-((253) + ((int)(KE_S_UP) << 8))) || c == K_UP(-(('k') + ((int)('u') << 8))))))
4068 return BACKWARD(-1);
4069 return FORWARD1;
4070}
4071
4072/*
4073 * Return TRUE for keys that are used for completion only when the popup menu
4074 * is visible.
4075 */
4076static int ins_compl_pum_key(int c)
4077{
4078 return pum_visible() && (c == K_PAGEUP(-(('k') + ((int)('P') << 8))) || c == K_KPAGEUP(-(('K') + ((int)('3') << 8))) || c == K_S_UP(-((253) + ((int)(KE_S_UP) << 8)))
4079 || c == K_PAGEDOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('N') << 8))) || c == K_KPAGEDOWN(-(('K') + ((int)('5') << 8))) || c ==
4080 K_S_DOWN(-((253) + ((int)(KE_S_DOWN) << 8)))
4081 || c == K_UP(-(('k') + ((int)('u') << 8))) || c == K_DOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('d') << 8))));
4082}
4083
4084/*
4085 * Decide the number of completions to move forward.
4086 * Returns 1 for most keys, height of the popup menu for page-up/down keys.
4087 */
4088static int ins_compl_key2count(int c)
4089{
4090 int h;
4091
4092 if (ins_compl_pum_key(c) && c != K_UP(-(('k') + ((int)('u') << 8))) && c != K_DOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('d') << 8)))) {
4093 h = pum_get_height();
4094 if (h > 3)
4095 h -= 2; /* keep some context */
4096 return h;
4097 }
4098 return 1;
4099}
4100
4101/*
4102 * Return TRUE if completion with "c" should insert the match, FALSE if only
4103 * to change the currently selected completion.
4104 */
4105static int ins_compl_use_match(int c)
4106{
4107 switch (c) {
4108 case K_UP(-(('k') + ((int)('u') << 8))):
4109 case K_DOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('d') << 8))):
4110 case K_PAGEDOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('N') << 8))):
4111 case K_KPAGEDOWN(-(('K') + ((int)('5') << 8))):
4112 case K_S_DOWN(-((253) + ((int)(KE_S_DOWN) << 8))):
4113 case K_PAGEUP(-(('k') + ((int)('P') << 8))):
4114 case K_KPAGEUP(-(('K') + ((int)('3') << 8))):
4115 case K_S_UP(-((253) + ((int)(KE_S_UP) << 8))):
4116 return FALSE0;
4117 }
4118 return TRUE1;
4119}
4120
4121/*
4122 * Do Insert mode completion.
4123 * Called when character "c" was typed, which has a meaning for completion.
4124 * Returns OK if completion was done, FAIL if something failed (out of mem).
4125 */
4126static int ins_complete(int c)
4127{
4128 char_u *line;
4129 int startcol = 0; /* column where searched text starts */
4130 colnr_T curs_col; /* cursor column */
4131 int n;
4132 int save_w_wrow;
4133
4134 compl_direction = ins_compl_key2dir(c);
4135 if (!compl_started) {
4136 /* First time we hit ^N or ^P (in a row, I mean) */
4137
4138 did_ai = FALSE0;
4139 did_si = FALSE0;
4140 can_si = FALSE0;
4141 can_si_back = FALSE0;
4142 if (stop_arrow() == FAIL0)
4143 return FAIL0;
4144
4145 line = ml_get(curwin->w_cursor.lnum);
4146 curs_col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
4147 compl_pending = 0;
4148
4149 /* If this same ctrl_x_mode has been interrupted use the text from
4150 * "compl_startpos" to the cursor as a pattern to add a new word
4151 * instead of expand the one before the cursor, in word-wise if
4152 * "compl_startpos" is not in the same line as the cursor then fix it
4153 * (the line has been split because it was longer than 'tw'). if SOL
4154 * is set then skip the previous pattern, a word at the beginning of
4155 * the line has been inserted, we'll look for that -- Acevedo. */
4156 if ((compl_cont_status & CONT_INTRPT(2 + 4)) == CONT_INTRPT(2 + 4)
4157 && compl_cont_mode == ctrl_x_mode) {
4158 /*
4159 * it is a continued search
4160 */
4161 compl_cont_status &= ~CONT_INTRPT(2 + 4); /* remove INTRPT */
4162 if (ctrl_x_mode == 0 || ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_PATH_PATTERNS(6 + 0x100)
4163 || ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_PATH_DEFINES(7 + 0x100)) {
4164 if (compl_startpos.lnum != curwin->w_cursor.lnum) {
4165 /* line (probably) wrapped, set compl_startpos to the
4166 * first non_blank in the line, if it is not a wordchar
4167 * include it to get a better pattern, but then we don't
4168 * want the "\\<" prefix, check it bellow */
4169 compl_col = (colnr_T)(skipwhite(line) - line);
4170 compl_startpos.col = compl_col;
4171 compl_startpos.lnum = curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
4172 compl_cont_status &= ~CONT_SOL16; /* clear SOL if present */
4173 } else {
4174 /* S_IPOS was set when we inserted a word that was at the
4175 * beginning of the line, which means that we'll go to SOL
4176 * mode but first we need to redefine compl_startpos */
4177 if (compl_cont_status & CONT_S_IPOS8) {
4178 compl_cont_status |= CONT_SOL16;
4179 compl_startpos.col = (colnr_T)(skipwhite(
4180 line + compl_length
4181 + compl_startpos.col) - line);
4182 }
4183 compl_col = compl_startpos.col;
4184 }
4185 compl_length = curwin->w_cursor.col - (int)compl_col;
4186 /* IObuff is used to add a "word from the next line" would we
4187 * have enough space? just being paranoid */
4188#define MIN_SPACE75 75
4189 if (compl_length > (IOSIZE(1024+1) - MIN_SPACE75)) {
4190 compl_cont_status &= ~CONT_SOL16;
4191 compl_length = (IOSIZE(1024+1) - MIN_SPACE75);
4192 compl_col = curwin->w_cursor.col - compl_length;
4193 }
4194 compl_cont_status |= CONT_ADDING1 | CONT_N_ADDS4;
4195 if (compl_length < 1)
4196 compl_cont_status &= CONT_LOCAL32;
4197 } else if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3)
4198 compl_cont_status = CONT_ADDING1 | CONT_N_ADDS4;
4199 else
4200 compl_cont_status = 0;
4201 } else
4202 compl_cont_status &= CONT_LOCAL32;
4203
4204 if (!(compl_cont_status & CONT_ADDING1)) { /* normal expansion */
4205 compl_cont_mode = ctrl_x_mode;
4206 if (ctrl_x_mode != 0) /* Remove LOCAL if ctrl_x_mode != 0 */
4207 compl_cont_status = 0;
4208 compl_cont_status |= CONT_N_ADDS4;
4209 compl_startpos = curwin->w_cursor;
4210 startcol = (int)curs_col;
4211 compl_col = 0;
4212 }
4213
4214 /* Work out completion pattern and original text -- webb */
4215 if (ctrl_x_mode == 0 || (ctrl_x_mode & CTRL_X_WANT_IDENT0x100)) {
4216 if ((compl_cont_status & CONT_SOL16)
4217 || ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_PATH_DEFINES(7 + 0x100)) {
4218 if (!(compl_cont_status & CONT_ADDING1)) {
4219 while (--startcol >= 0 && vim_isIDc(line[startcol]))
4220 ;
4221 compl_col += ++startcol;
4222 compl_length = curs_col - startcol;
4223 }
4224 if (p_ic)
4225 compl_pattern = str_foldcase(line + compl_col,
4226 compl_length, NULL((void*)0), 0);
4227 else
4228 compl_pattern = vim_strnsave(line + compl_col,
4229 compl_length);
4230 if (compl_pattern == NULL((void*)0))
4231 return FAIL0;
4232 } else if (compl_cont_status & CONT_ADDING1) {
4233 char_u *prefix = (char_u *)"\\<";
4234
4235 /* we need up to 2 extra chars for the prefix */
4236 compl_pattern = xmalloc(quote_meta(NULL((void*)0), line + compl_col,
4237 compl_length) + 2);
4238 if (!vim_iswordp(line + compl_col)
4239 || (compl_col > 0
4240 && (
4241 vim_iswordp(mb_prevptr(line, line + compl_col))
4242 )))
4243 prefix = (char_u *)"";
4244 STRCPY((char *)compl_pattern, prefix)strcpy((char *)((char *)compl_pattern), (char *)(prefix));
4245 (void)quote_meta(compl_pattern + STRLEN(prefix)strlen((char *)(prefix)),
4246 line + compl_col, compl_length);
4247 } else if (--startcol < 0 ||
4248 !vim_iswordp(mb_prevptr(line, line + startcol + 1))
4249 ) {
4250 /* Match any word of at least two chars */
4251 compl_pattern = vim_strsave((char_u *)"\\<\\k\\k");
4252 compl_col += curs_col;
4253 compl_length = 0;
4254 } else {
4255 /* Search the point of change class of multibyte character
4256 * or not a word single byte character backward. */
4257 if (has_mbyte) {
4258 int base_class;
4259 int head_off;
4260
4261 startcol -= (*mb_head_off)(line, line + startcol);
4262 base_class = mb_get_class(line + startcol);
4263 while (--startcol >= 0) {
4264 head_off = (*mb_head_off)(line, line + startcol);
4265 if (base_class != mb_get_class(line + startcol
4266 - head_off))
4267 break;
4268 startcol -= head_off;
4269 }
4270 } else
4271 while (--startcol >= 0 && vim_iswordc(line[startcol]))
4272 ;
4273 compl_col += ++startcol;
4274 compl_length = (int)curs_col - startcol;
4275 if (compl_length == 1) {
4276 /* Only match word with at least two chars -- webb
4277 * there's no need to call quote_meta,
4278 * xmalloc(7) is enough -- Acevedo
4279 */
4280 compl_pattern = xmalloc(7);
4281 STRCPY((char *)compl_pattern, "\\<")strcpy((char *)((char *)compl_pattern), (char *)("\\<"));
4282 (void)quote_meta(compl_pattern + 2, line + compl_col, 1);
4283 STRCAT((char *)compl_pattern, "\\k")strcat((char *)((char *)compl_pattern), (char *)("\\k"));
4284 } else {
4285 compl_pattern = xmalloc(quote_meta(NULL((void*)0), line + compl_col,
4286 compl_length) + 2);
4287 STRCPY((char *)compl_pattern, "\\<")strcpy((char *)((char *)compl_pattern), (char *)("\\<"));
4288 (void)quote_meta(compl_pattern + 2, line + compl_col,
4289 compl_length);
4290 }
4291 }
4292 } else if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3) {
4293 compl_col = (colnr_T)(skipwhite(line) - line);
4294 compl_length = (int)curs_col - (int)compl_col;
4295 if (compl_length < 0) /* cursor in indent: empty pattern */
4296 compl_length = 0;
4297 if (p_ic)
4298 compl_pattern = str_foldcase(line + compl_col, compl_length,
4299 NULL((void*)0), 0);
4300 else
4301 compl_pattern = vim_strnsave(line + compl_col, compl_length);
4302 if (compl_pattern == NULL((void*)0))
4303 return FAIL0;
4304 } else if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_FILES4) {
4305 /* Go back to just before the first filename character. */
4306 if (startcol > 0) {
4307 char_u *p = line + startcol;
4308
4309 mb_ptr_back(line, p)p -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(line, p - 1) + 1) : 1;
4310 while (p > line && vim_isfilec(PTR2CHAR(p)(has_mbyte ? mb_ptr2char(p) : (int)*(p))))
4311 mb_ptr_back(line, p)p -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(line, p - 1) + 1) : 1;
4312 if (p == line && vim_isfilec(PTR2CHAR(p)(has_mbyte ? mb_ptr2char(p) : (int)*(p))))
4313 startcol = 0;
4314 else
4315 startcol = (int)(p - line) + 1;
4316 }
4317
4318 compl_col += startcol;
4319 compl_length = (int)curs_col - startcol;
4320 compl_pattern = addstar(line + compl_col, compl_length,
4321 EXPAND_FILES);
4322 if (compl_pattern == NULL((void*)0))
4323 return FAIL0;
4324 } else if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_CMDLINE11) {
4325 compl_pattern = vim_strnsave(line, curs_col);
4326 set_cmd_context(&compl_xp, compl_pattern,
4327 (int)STRLEN(compl_pattern)strlen((char *)(compl_pattern)), curs_col);
4328 if (compl_xp.xp_context == EXPAND_UNSUCCESSFUL
4329 || compl_xp.xp_context == EXPAND_NOTHING)
4330 /* No completion possible, use an empty pattern to get a
4331 * "pattern not found" message. */
4332 compl_col = curs_col;
4333 else
4334 compl_col = (int)(compl_xp.xp_pattern - compl_pattern);
4335 compl_length = curs_col - compl_col;
4336 } else if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_FUNCTION12 || ctrl_x_mode ==
4337 CTRL_X_OMNI13) {
4338 /*
4339 * Call user defined function 'completefunc' with "a:findstart"
4340 * set to 1 to obtain the length of text to use for completion.
4341 */
4342 char_u *args[2];
4343 int col;
4344 char_u *funcname;
4345 pos_T pos;
4346 win_T *curwin_save;
4347 buf_T *curbuf_save;
4348
4349 /* Call 'completefunc' or 'omnifunc' and get pattern length as a
4350 * string */
4351 funcname = ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_FUNCTION12
4352 ? curbuf->b_p_cfu : curbuf->b_p_ofu;
4353 if (*funcname == NUL'\000') {
4354 EMSG2(_(e_notset), ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_FUNCTIONemsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_notset))), (char_u *)(ctrl_x_mode
== 12 ? "completefunc" : "omnifunc"))
4355 ? "completefunc" : "omnifunc")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_notset))), (char_u *)(ctrl_x_mode
== 12 ? "completefunc" : "omnifunc"));
4356 return FAIL0;
4357 }
4358
4359 args[0] = (char_u *)"1";
4360 args[1] = NULL((void*)0);
4361 pos = curwin->w_cursor;
4362 curwin_save = curwin;
4363 curbuf_save = curbuf;
4364 col = call_func_retnr(funcname, 2, args, FALSE0);
4365 if (curwin_save != curwin || curbuf_save != curbuf) {
4366 EMSG(_(e_complwin))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_complwin))));
4367 return FAIL0;
4368 }
4369 curwin->w_cursor = pos; /* restore the cursor position */
4370 check_cursor();
4371 if (!equalpos(curwin->w_cursor, pos)(((curwin->w_cursor).lnum == (pos).lnum) && ((curwin
->w_cursor).col == (pos).col) && ((curwin->w_cursor
).coladd == (pos).coladd))) {
4372 EMSG(_(e_compldel))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_compldel))));
4373 return FAIL0;
4374 }
4375
4376 /* Return value -2 means the user complete function wants to
4377 * cancel the complete without an error.
4378 * Return value -3 does the same as -2 and leaves CTRL-X mode.*/
4379 if (col == -2)
4380 return FAIL0;
4381 if (col == -3) {
4382 ctrl_x_mode = 0;
4383 edit_submode = NULL((void*)0);
4384 if (!shortmess(SHM_COMPLETIONMENU'c')) {
4385 msg_clr_cmdline();
4386 }
4387 return FAIL0;
4388 }
4389
4390 /*
4391 * Reset extended parameters of completion, when start new
4392 * completion.
4393 */
4394 compl_opt_refresh_always = FALSE0;
4395
4396 if (col < 0)
4397 col = curs_col;
4398 compl_col = col;
4399 if (compl_col > curs_col)
4400 compl_col = curs_col;
4401
4402 /* Setup variables for completion. Need to obtain "line" again,
4403 * it may have become invalid. */
4404 line = ml_get(curwin->w_cursor.lnum);
4405 compl_length = curs_col - compl_col;
4406 compl_pattern = vim_strnsave(line + compl_col, compl_length);
4407 } else if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_SPELL14) {
4408 if (spell_bad_len > 0)
4409 compl_col = curs_col - spell_bad_len;
4410 else
4411 compl_col = spell_word_start(startcol);
4412 if (compl_col >= (colnr_T)startcol) {
4413 compl_length = 0;
4414 compl_col = curs_col;
4415 } else {
4416 spell_expand_check_cap(compl_col);
4417 compl_length = (int)curs_col - compl_col;
4418 }
4419 /* Need to obtain "line" again, it may have become invalid. */
4420 line = ml_get(curwin->w_cursor.lnum);
4421 compl_pattern = vim_strnsave(line + compl_col, compl_length);
4422 } else {
4423 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "ins_complete()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("ins_complete()"
));
4424 return FAIL0;
4425 }
4426
4427 if (compl_cont_status & CONT_ADDING1) {
4428 edit_submode_pre = (char_u *)_(" Adding")gettext((char *)(" Adding"));
4429 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_WHOLE_LINE3) {
4430 /* Insert a new line, keep indentation but ignore 'comments' */
4431 char_u *old = curbuf->b_p_com;
4432
4433 curbuf->b_p_com = (char_u *)"";
4434 compl_startpos.lnum = curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
4435 compl_startpos.col = compl_col;
4436 ins_eol('\r');
4437 curbuf->b_p_com = old;
4438 compl_length = 0;
4439 compl_col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
4440 }
4441 } else {
4442 edit_submode_pre = NULL((void*)0);
4443 compl_startpos.col = compl_col;
4444 }
4445
4446 if (compl_cont_status & CONT_LOCAL32)
4447 edit_submode = (char_u *)_(ctrl_x_msgs[CTRL_X_LOCAL_MSG])gettext((char *)(ctrl_x_msgs[15]));
4448 else
4449 edit_submode = (char_u *)_(CTRL_X_MSG(ctrl_x_mode))gettext((char *)(ctrl_x_msgs[(ctrl_x_mode) & ~0x100]));
4450
4451 /* If any of the original typed text has been changed we need to fix
4452 * the redo buffer. */
4453 ins_compl_fixRedoBufForLeader(NULL((void*)0));
4454
4455 /* Always add completion for the original text. */
4456 free(compl_orig_text);
4457 compl_orig_text = vim_strnsave(line + compl_col, compl_length);
4458 if (ins_compl_add(compl_orig_text, -1, p_ic, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), 0,
4459 ORIGINAL_TEXT(1), FALSE0) != OK1) {
4460 free(compl_pattern);
4461 compl_pattern = NULL((void*)0);
4462 free(compl_orig_text);
4463 compl_orig_text = NULL((void*)0);
4464 return FAIL0;
4465 }
4466
4467 /* showmode might reset the internal line pointers, so it must
4468 * be called before line = ml_get(), or when this address is no
4469 * longer needed. -- Acevedo.
4470 */
4471 edit_submode_extra = (char_u *)_("-- Searching...")gettext((char *)("-- Searching..."));
4472 edit_submode_highl = HLF_COUNT;
4473 showmode();
4474 edit_submode_extra = NULL((void*)0);
4475 out_flush();
4476 }
4477
4478 compl_shown_match = compl_curr_match;
4479 compl_shows_dir = compl_direction;
4480
4481 /*
4482 * Find next match (and following matches).
4483 */
4484 save_w_wrow = curwin->w_wrow;
4485 n = ins_compl_next(TRUE1, ins_compl_key2count(c), ins_compl_use_match(c));
4486
4487 /* may undisplay the popup menu */
4488 ins_compl_upd_pum();
4489
4490 if (n > 1) /* all matches have been found */
4491 compl_matches = n;
4492 compl_curr_match = compl_shown_match;
4493 compl_direction = compl_shows_dir;
4494
4495 /* Eat the ESC that vgetc() returns after a CTRL-C to avoid leaving Insert
4496 * mode. */
4497 if (got_int && !global_busy) {
4498 (void)vgetc();
4499 got_int = FALSE0;
4500 }
4501
4502 /* we found no match if the list has only the "compl_orig_text"-entry */
4503 if (compl_first_match == compl_first_match->cp_next) {
4504 edit_submode_extra = (compl_cont_status & CONT_ADDING1)
4505 && compl_length > 1
4506 ? (char_u *)_(e_hitend)gettext((char *)(e_hitend)) : (char_u *)_(e_patnotf)gettext((char *)(e_patnotf));
4507 edit_submode_highl = HLF_E;
4508 /* remove N_ADDS flag, so next ^X<> won't try to go to ADDING mode,
4509 * because we couldn't expand anything at first place, but if we used
4510 * ^P, ^N, ^X^I or ^X^D we might want to add-expand a single-char-word
4511 * (such as M in M'exico) if not tried already. -- Acevedo */
4512 if ( compl_length > 1
4513 || (compl_cont_status & CONT_ADDING1)
4514 || (ctrl_x_mode != 0
4515 && ctrl_x_mode != CTRL_X_PATH_PATTERNS(6 + 0x100)
4516 && ctrl_x_mode != CTRL_X_PATH_DEFINES(7 + 0x100)))
4517 compl_cont_status &= ~CONT_N_ADDS4;
4518 }
4519
4520 if (compl_curr_match->cp_flags & CONT_S_IPOS8)
4521 compl_cont_status |= CONT_S_IPOS8;
4522 else
4523 compl_cont_status &= ~CONT_S_IPOS8;
4524
4525 if (edit_submode_extra == NULL((void*)0)) {
4526 if (compl_curr_match->cp_flags & ORIGINAL_TEXT(1)) {
4527 edit_submode_extra = (char_u *)_("Back at original")gettext((char *)("Back at original"));
4528 edit_submode_highl = HLF_W;
4529 } else if (compl_cont_status & CONT_S_IPOS8) {
4530 edit_submode_extra = (char_u *)_("Word from other line")gettext((char *)("Word from other line"));
4531 edit_submode_highl = HLF_COUNT;
4532 } else if (compl_curr_match->cp_next == compl_curr_match->cp_prev) {
4533 edit_submode_extra = (char_u *)_("The only match")gettext((char *)("The only match"));
4534 edit_submode_highl = HLF_COUNT;
4535 } else {
4536 /* Update completion sequence number when needed. */
4537 if (compl_curr_match->cp_number == -1) {
4538 int number = 0;
4539 compl_T *match;
4540
4541 if (compl_direction == FORWARD1) {
4542 /* search backwards for the first valid (!= -1) number.
4543 * This should normally succeed already at the first loop
4544 * cycle, so it's fast! */
4545 for (match = compl_curr_match->cp_prev; match != NULL((void*)0)
4546 && match != compl_first_match;
4547 match = match->cp_prev)
4548 if (match->cp_number != -1) {
4549 number = match->cp_number;
4550 break;
4551 }
4552 if (match != NULL((void*)0))
4553 /* go up and assign all numbers which are not assigned
4554 * yet */
4555 for (match = match->cp_next;
4556 match != NULL((void*)0) && match->cp_number == -1;
4557 match = match->cp_next)
4558 match->cp_number = ++number;
4559 } else { /* BACKWARD */
4560 /* search forwards (upwards) for the first valid (!= -1)
4561 * number. This should normally succeed already at the
4562 * first loop cycle, so it's fast! */
4563 for (match = compl_curr_match->cp_next; match != NULL((void*)0)
4564 && match != compl_first_match;
4565 match = match->cp_next)
4566 if (match->cp_number != -1) {
4567 number = match->cp_number;
4568 break;
4569 }
4570 if (match != NULL((void*)0))
4571 /* go down and assign all numbers which are not
4572 * assigned yet */
4573 for (match = match->cp_prev; match
4574 && match->cp_number == -1;
4575 match = match->cp_prev)
4576 match->cp_number = ++number;
4577 }
4578 }
4579
4580 /* The match should always have a sequence number now, this is
4581 * just a safety check. */
4582 if (compl_curr_match->cp_number != -1) {
4583 /* Space for 10 text chars. + 2x10-digit no.s = 31.
4584 * Translations may need more than twice that. */
4585 static char_u match_ref[81];
4586
4587 if (compl_matches > 0)
4588 vim_snprintf((char *)match_ref, sizeof(match_ref),
4589 _("match %d of %d")gettext((char *)("match %d of %d")),
4590 compl_curr_match->cp_number, compl_matches);
4591 else
4592 vim_snprintf((char *)match_ref, sizeof(match_ref),
4593 _("match %d")gettext((char *)("match %d")),
4594 compl_curr_match->cp_number);
4595 edit_submode_extra = match_ref;
4596 edit_submode_highl = HLF_R;
4597 if (dollar_vcol >= 0)
4598 curs_columns(FALSE0);
4599 }
4600 }
4601 }
4602
4603 /* Show a message about what (completion) mode we're in. */
4604 showmode();
4605 if (!shortmess(SHM_COMPLETIONMENU'c')) {
4606 if (edit_submode_extra != NULL((void*)0)) {
4607 if (!p_smd) {
4608 msg_attr(edit_submode_extra,
4609 edit_submode_highl < HLF_COUNT
4610 ? hl_attr(edit_submode_highl)highlight_attr[(int)(edit_submode_highl)] : 0);
4611 }
4612 } else {
4613 msg_clr_cmdline(); // necessary for "noshowmode"
4614 }
4615 }
4616
4617 /* Show the popup menu, unless we got interrupted. */
4618 if (!compl_interrupted) {
4619 /* RedrawingDisabled may be set when invoked through complete(). */
4620 n = RedrawingDisabled;
4621 RedrawingDisabled = 0;
4622
4623 /* If the cursor moved we need to remove the pum first. */
4624 setcursor();
4625 if (save_w_wrow != curwin->w_wrow)
4626 ins_compl_del_pum();
4627
4628 ins_compl_show_pum();
4629 setcursor();
4630 RedrawingDisabled = n;
4631 }
4632 compl_was_interrupted = compl_interrupted;
4633 compl_interrupted = FALSE0;
4634
4635 return OK1;
4636}
4637
4638/*
4639 * Looks in the first "len" chars. of "src" for search-metachars.
4640 * If dest is not NULL the chars. are copied there quoting (with
4641 * a backslash) the metachars, and dest would be NUL terminated.
4642 * Returns the length (needed) of dest
4643 */
4644static unsigned quote_meta(char_u *dest, char_u *src, int len)
4645{
4646 unsigned m = (unsigned)len + 1; /* one extra for the NUL */
4647
4648 for (; --len >= 0; src++) {
4649 switch (*src) {
4650 case '.':
4651 case '*':
4652 case '[':
4653 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_DICTIONARY(9 + 0x100)
4654 || ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_THESAURUS(10 + 0x100))
4655 break;
4656 case '~':
4657 if (!p_magic) /* quote these only if magic is set */
4658 break;
4659 case '\\':
4660 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_DICTIONARY(9 + 0x100)
4661 || ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_THESAURUS(10 + 0x100))
4662 break;
4663 case '^': /* currently it's not needed. */
4664 case '$':
4665 m++;
4666 if (dest != NULL((void*)0))
4667 *dest++ = '\\';
4668 break;
4669 }
4670 if (dest != NULL((void*)0))
4671 *dest++ = *src;
4672 /* Copy remaining bytes of a multibyte character. */
4673 if (has_mbyte) {
4674 int i, mb_len;
4675
4676 mb_len = (*mb_ptr2len)(src) - 1;
4677 if (mb_len > 0 && len >= mb_len)
4678 for (i = 0; i < mb_len; ++i) {
4679 --len;
4680 ++src;
4681 if (dest != NULL((void*)0))
4682 *dest++ = *src;
4683 }
4684 }
4685 }
4686 if (dest != NULL((void*)0))
4687 *dest = NUL'\000';
4688
4689 return m;
4690}
4691
4692/*
4693 * Next character is interpreted literally.
4694 * A one, two or three digit decimal number is interpreted as its byte value.
4695 * If one or two digits are entered, the next character is given to vungetc().
4696 * For Unicode a character > 255 may be returned.
4697 */
4698int get_literal(void)
4699{
4700 int cc;
4701 int nc;
4702 int i;
4703 int hex = FALSE0;
4704 int octal = FALSE0;
4705 int unicode = 0;
4706
4707 if (got_int)
4708 return Ctrl_C3;
4709
4710#ifdef USE_ON_FLY_SCROLL
4711 dont_scroll = TRUE1; /* disallow scrolling here */
4712#endif
4713 ++no_mapping; /* don't map the next key hits */
4714 cc = 0;
4715 i = 0;
4716 for (;; ) {
4717 nc = plain_vgetc();
4718 if (!(State & CMDLINE0x08)
4719 && MB_BYTE2LEN_CHECK(nc)(((nc) < 0 || (nc) > 255) ? 1 : mb_bytelen_tab[nc]) == 1
4720 )
4721 add_to_showcmd(nc);
4722 if (nc == 'x' || nc == 'X')
4723 hex = TRUE1;
4724 else if (nc == 'o' || nc == 'O')
4725 octal = TRUE1;
4726 else if (nc == 'u' || nc == 'U')
4727 unicode = nc;
4728 else {
4729 if (hex
4730 || unicode != 0
4731 ) {
4732 if (!vim_isxdigit(nc))
4733 break;
4734 cc = cc * 16 + hex2nr(nc);
4735 } else if (octal) {
4736 if (nc < '0' || nc > '7')
4737 break;
4738 cc = cc * 8 + nc - '0';
4739 } else {
4740 if (!VIM_ISDIGIT(nc)((unsigned)(nc) - '0' < 10))
4741 break;
4742 cc = cc * 10 + nc - '0';
4743 }
4744
4745 ++i;
4746 }
4747
4748 if (cc > 255
4749 && unicode == 0
4750 )
4751 cc = 255; /* limit range to 0-255 */
4752 nc = 0;
4753
4754 if (hex) { /* hex: up to two chars */
4755 if (i >= 2)
4756 break;
4757 } else if (unicode) { /* Unicode: up to four or eight chars */
4758 if ((unicode == 'u' && i >= 4) || (unicode == 'U' && i >= 8))
4759 break;
4760 } else if (i >= 3) /* decimal or octal: up to three chars */
4761 break;
4762 }
4763 if (i == 0) { /* no number entered */
4764 if (nc == K_ZERO(-((255) + ((int)(('X')) << 8)))) { /* NUL is stored as NL */
4765 cc = '\n';
4766 nc = 0;
4767 } else {
4768 cc = nc;
4769 nc = 0;
4770 }
4771 }
4772
4773 if (cc == 0) /* NUL is stored as NL */
4774 cc = '\n';
4775 if (enc_dbcs && (cc & 0xff) == 0)
4776 cc = '?'; /* don't accept an illegal DBCS char, the NUL in the
4777 second byte will cause trouble! */
4778
4779 --no_mapping;
4780 if (nc)
4781 vungetc(nc);
4782 got_int = FALSE0; /* CTRL-C typed after CTRL-V is not an interrupt */
4783 return cc;
4784}
4785
4786/*
4787 * Insert character, taking care of special keys and mod_mask
4788 */
4789static void
4790insert_special (
4791 int c,
4792 int allow_modmask,
4793 int ctrlv /* c was typed after CTRL-V */
4794)
4795{
4796 char_u *p;
4797 int len;
4798
4799 /*
4800 * Special function key, translate into "<Key>". Up to the last '>' is
4801 * inserted with ins_str(), so as not to replace characters in replace
4802 * mode.
4803 * Only use mod_mask for special keys, to avoid things like <S-Space>,
4804 * unless 'allow_modmask' is TRUE.
4805 */
4806 if (IS_SPECIAL(c)((c) < 0) || (mod_mask && allow_modmask)) {
4807 p = get_special_key_name(c, mod_mask);
4808 len = (int)STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p));
4809 c = p[len - 1];
4810 if (len > 2) {
4811 if (stop_arrow() == FAIL0)
4812 return;
4813 p[len - 1] = NUL'\000';
4814 ins_str(p);
4815 AppendToRedobuffLit(p, -1);
4816 ctrlv = FALSE0;
4817 }
4818 }
4819 if (stop_arrow() == OK1)
4820 insertchar(c, ctrlv ? INSCHAR_CTRLV4 : 0, -1);
4821}
4822
4823/*
4824 * Special characters in this context are those that need processing other
4825 * than the simple insertion that can be performed here. This includes ESC
4826 * which terminates the insert, and CR/NL which need special processing to
4827 * open up a new line. This routine tries to optimize insertions performed by
4828 * the "redo", "undo" or "put" commands, so it needs to know when it should
4829 * stop and defer processing to the "normal" mechanism.
