4830 * '0' and '^' are special, because they can be followed by CTRL-D.
4831 */
4832# define ISSPECIAL(c)((c) < ' ' || (c) >= 0x7f || (c) == '0' || (c) == '^') ((c) < ' ' || (c) >= DEL0x7f || (c) == '0' || (c) == '^')
4833
4834# define WHITECHAR(cc)(((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t') && (!enc_utf8 || !utf_iscomposing
( utf_ptr2char(get_cursor_pos_ptr() + 1)))) (vim_iswhite(cc)((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t') && \
4835 (!enc_utf8 || \
4836 !utf_iscomposing( \
4837 utf_ptr2char(get_cursor_pos_ptr() + 1))))
4838
4839/*
4840 * "flags": INSCHAR_FORMAT - force formatting
4841 * INSCHAR_CTRLV - char typed just after CTRL-V
4842 * INSCHAR_NO_FEX - don't use 'formatexpr'
4843 *
4844 * NOTE: passes the flags value straight through to internal_format() which,
4845 * beside INSCHAR_FORMAT (above), is also looking for these:
4846 * INSCHAR_DO_COM - format comments
4847 * INSCHAR_COM_LIST - format comments with num list or 2nd line indent
4848 */
4849void
4850insertchar (
4851 int c, /* character to insert or NUL */
4852 int flags, /* INSCHAR_FORMAT, etc. */
4853 int second_indent /* indent for second line if >= 0 */
4854)
4855{
4856 int textwidth;
4857 char_u *p;
4858 int fo_ins_blank;
4859
4860 textwidth = comp_textwidth(flags & INSCHAR_FORMAT1);
4861 fo_ins_blank = has_format_option(FO_INS_BLANK'b');
4862
4863 /*
4864 * Try to break the line in two or more pieces when:
4865 * - Always do this if we have been called to do formatting only.
4866 * - Always do this when 'formatoptions' has the 'a' flag and the line
4867 * ends in white space.
4868 * - Otherwise:
4869 * - Don't do this if inserting a blank
4870 * - Don't do this if an existing character is being replaced, unless
4871 * we're in VREPLACE mode.
4872 * - Do this if the cursor is not on the line where insert started
4873 * or - 'formatoptions' doesn't have 'l' or the line was not too long
4874 * before the insert.
4875 * - 'formatoptions' doesn't have 'b' or a blank was inserted at or
4876 * before 'textwidth'
4877 */
4878 if (textwidth > 0
4879 && ((flags & INSCHAR_FORMAT1)
4880 || (!vim_iswhite(c)((c) == ' ' || (c) == '\t')
4881 && !((State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40)
4882 && !(State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
4883 && *get_cursor_pos_ptr() != NUL'\000')
4884 && (curwin->w_cursor.lnum != Insstart.lnum
4885 || ((!has_format_option(FO_INS_LONG'l')
4886 || Insstart_textlen <= (colnr_T)textwidth)
4887 && (!fo_ins_blank
4888 || Insstart_blank_vcol <= (colnr_T)textwidth
4889 )))))) {
4890 /* Format with 'formatexpr' when it's set. Use internal formatting
4891 * when 'formatexpr' isn't set or it returns non-zero. */
4892 int do_internal = TRUE1;
4893
4894 if (*curbuf->b_p_fex != NUL'\000' && (flags & INSCHAR_NO_FEX8) == 0) {
4895 do_internal = (fex_format(curwin->w_cursor.lnum, 1L, c) != 0);
4896 /* It may be required to save for undo again, e.g. when setline()
4897 * was called. */
4898 ins_need_undo = TRUE1;
4899 }
4900 if (do_internal)
4901 internal_format(textwidth, second_indent, flags, c == NUL'\000', c);
4902 }
4903
4904 if (c == NUL'\000') /* only formatting was wanted */
4905 return;
4906
4907 /* Check whether this character should end a comment. */
4908 if (did_ai && (int)c == end_comment_pending) {
4909 char_u *line;
4910 char_u lead_end[COM_MAX_LEN50]; /* end-comment string */
4911 int middle_len, end_len;
4912 int i;
4913
4914 /*
4915 * Need to remove existing (middle) comment leader and insert end
4916 * comment leader. First, check what comment leader we can find.
4917 */
4918 i = get_leader_len(line = get_cursor_line_ptr(), &p, FALSE0, TRUE1);
4919 if (i > 0 && vim_strchr(p, COM_MIDDLE'm') != NULL((void*)0)) { /* Just checking */
4920 /* Skip middle-comment string */
4921 while (*p && p[-1] != ':') /* find end of middle flags */
4922 ++p;
4923 middle_len = copy_option_part(&p, lead_end, COM_MAX_LEN50, ",");
4924 /* Don't count trailing white space for middle_len */
4925 while (middle_len > 0 && vim_iswhite(lead_end[middle_len - 1])((lead_end[middle_len - 1]) == ' ' || (lead_end[middle_len - 1
]) == '\t'))
4926 --middle_len;
4927
4928 /* Find the end-comment string */
4929 while (*p && p[-1] != ':') /* find end of end flags */
4930 ++p;
4931 end_len = copy_option_part(&p, lead_end, COM_MAX_LEN50, ",");
4932
4933 /* Skip white space before the cursor */
4934 i = curwin->w_cursor.col;
4935 while (--i >= 0 && vim_iswhite(line[i])((line[i]) == ' ' || (line[i]) == '\t'))
4936 ;
4937 i++;
4938
4939 /* Skip to before the middle leader */
4940 i -= middle_len;
4941
4942 /* Check some expected things before we go on */
4943 if (i >= 0 && lead_end[end_len - 1] == end_comment_pending) {
4944 /* Backspace over all the stuff we want to replace */
4945 backspace_until_column(i);
4946
4947 /*
4948 * Insert the end-comment string, except for the last
4949 * character, which will get inserted as normal later.
4950 */
4951 ins_bytes_len(lead_end, end_len - 1);
4952 }
4953 }
4954 }
4955 end_comment_pending = NUL'\000';
4956
4957 did_ai = FALSE0;
4958 did_si = FALSE0;
4959 can_si = FALSE0;
4960 can_si_back = FALSE0;
4961
4962 /*
4963 * If there's any pending input, grab up to INPUT_BUFLEN at once.
4964 * This speeds up normal text input considerably.
4965 * Don't do this when 'cindent' or 'indentexpr' is set, because we might
4966 * need to re-indent at a ':', or any other character (but not what
4967 * 'paste' is set)..
4968 * Don't do this when there an InsertCharPre autocommand is defined,
4969 * because we need to fire the event for every character.
4970 */
4971#ifdef USE_ON_FLY_SCROLL
4972 dont_scroll = FALSE0; /* allow scrolling here */
4973#endif
4974
4975 if ( !ISSPECIAL(c)((c) < ' ' || (c) >= 0x7f || (c) == '0' || (c) == '^')
4976 && (!has_mbyte || (*mb_char2len)(c) == 1)
4977 && vpeekc() != NUL'\000'
4978 && !(State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40)
4979 && !cindent_on()
4980 && !p_ri
4981 && !has_insertcharpre()
4982 ) {
4983#define INPUT_BUFLEN100 100
4984 char_u buf[INPUT_BUFLEN100 + 1];
4985 int i;
4986 colnr_T virtcol = 0;
4987
4988 buf[0] = c;
4989 i = 1;
4990 if (textwidth > 0)
4991 virtcol = get_nolist_virtcol();
4992 /*
4993 * Stop the string when:
4994 * - no more chars available
4995 * - finding a special character (command key)
4996 * - buffer is full
4997 * - running into the 'textwidth' boundary
4998 * - need to check for abbreviation: A non-word char after a word-char
4999 */
5000 while ( (c = vpeekc()) != NUL'\000'
5001 && !ISSPECIAL(c)((c) < ' ' || (c) >= 0x7f || (c) == '0' || (c) == '^')
5002 && (!has_mbyte || MB_BYTE2LEN_CHECK(c)(((c) < 0 || (c) > 255) ? 1 : mb_bytelen_tab[c]) == 1)
5003 && i < INPUT_BUFLEN100
5004 && (textwidth == 0
5005 || (virtcol += byte2cells(buf[i - 1])) < (colnr_T)textwidth)
5006 && !(!no_abbr && !vim_iswordc(c) && vim_iswordc(buf[i - 1]))) {
5007 c = vgetc();
5008 if (p_hkmap && KeyTyped)
5009 c = hkmap(c); /* Hebrew mode mapping */
5010 if (p_fkmap && KeyTyped)
5011 c = fkmap(c); /* Farsi mode mapping */
5012 buf[i++] = c;
5013 }
5014
5015 do_digraph(-1); /* clear digraphs */
5016 do_digraph(buf[i-1]); /* may be the start of a digraph */
5017 buf[i] = NUL'\000';
5018 ins_str(buf);
5019 if (flags & INSCHAR_CTRLV4) {
5020 redo_literal(*buf);
5021 i = 1;
5022 } else
5023 i = 0;
5024 if (buf[i] != NUL'\000')
5025 AppendToRedobuffLit(buf + i, -1);
5026 } else {
5027 int cc;
5028
5029 if (has_mbyte && (cc = (*mb_char2len)(c)) > 1) {
5030 char_u buf[MB_MAXBYTES21 + 1];
5031
5032 (*mb_char2bytes)(c, buf);
5033 buf[cc] = NUL'\000';
5034 ins_char_bytes(buf, cc);
5035 AppendCharToRedobuff(c);
5036 } else {
5037 ins_char(c);
5038 if (flags & INSCHAR_CTRLV4)
5039 redo_literal(c);
5040 else
5041 AppendCharToRedobuff(c);
5042 }
5043 }
5044}
5045
5046/*
5047 * Format text at the current insert position.
5048 *
5049 * If the INSCHAR_COM_LIST flag is present, then the value of second_indent
5050 * will be the comment leader length sent to open_line().
5051 */
5052static void
5053internal_format (
5054 int textwidth,
5055 int second_indent,
5056 int flags,
5057 int format_only,
5058 int c /* character to be inserted (can be NUL) */
5059)
5060{
5061 int cc;
5062 int save_char = NUL'\000';
5063 int haveto_redraw = FALSE0;
5064 int fo_ins_blank = has_format_option(FO_INS_BLANK'b');
5065 int fo_multibyte = has_format_option(FO_MBYTE_BREAK'm');
5066 int fo_white_par = has_format_option(FO_WHITE_PAR'w');
5067 int first_line = TRUE1;
5068 colnr_T leader_len;
5069 int no_leader = FALSE0;
5070 int do_comments = (flags & INSCHAR_DO_COM2);
5071
5072 /*
5073 * When 'ai' is off we don't want a space under the cursor to be
5074 * deleted. Replace it with an 'x' temporarily.
5075 */
5076 if (!curbuf->b_p_ai
5077 && !(State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
5078 ) {
5079 cc = gchar_cursor();
5080 if (vim_iswhite(cc)((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t')) {
5081 save_char = cc;
5082 pchar_cursor('x');
5083 }
5084 }
5085
5086 /*
5087 * Repeat breaking lines, until the current line is not too long.
5088 */
5089 while (!got_int) {
5090 int startcol; /* Cursor column at entry */
5091 int wantcol; /* column at textwidth border */
5092 int foundcol; /* column for start of spaces */
5093 int end_foundcol = 0; /* column for start of word */
5094 colnr_T len;
5095 colnr_T virtcol;
5096 int orig_col = 0;
5097 char_u *saved_text = NULL((void*)0);
5098 colnr_T col;
5099 colnr_T end_col;
5100
5101 virtcol = get_nolist_virtcol()
5102 + char2cells(c != NUL'\000' ? c : gchar_cursor());
5103 if (virtcol <= (colnr_T)textwidth)
5104 break;
5105
5106 if (no_leader)
5107 do_comments = FALSE0;
5108 else if (!(flags & INSCHAR_FORMAT1)
5109 && has_format_option(FO_WRAP_COMS'c'))
5110 do_comments = TRUE1;
5111
5112 /* Don't break until after the comment leader */
5113 if (do_comments)
5114 leader_len = get_leader_len(get_cursor_line_ptr(), NULL((void*)0), FALSE0, TRUE1);
5115 else
5116 leader_len = 0;
5117
5118 /* If the line doesn't start with a comment leader, then don't
5119 * start one in a following broken line. Avoids that a %word
5120 * moved to the start of the next line causes all following lines
5121 * to start with %. */
5122 if (leader_len == 0)
5123 no_leader = TRUE1;
5124 if (!(flags & INSCHAR_FORMAT1)
5125 && leader_len == 0
5126 && !has_format_option(FO_WRAP't'))
5127
5128 break;
5129 if ((startcol = curwin->w_cursor.col) == 0)
5130 break;
5131
5132 /* find column of textwidth border */
5133 coladvance((colnr_T)textwidth);
5134 wantcol = curwin->w_cursor.col;
5135
5136 curwin->w_cursor.col = startcol;
5137 foundcol = 0;
5138
5139 /*
5140 * Find position to break at.
5141 * Stop at first entered white when 'formatoptions' has 'v'
5142 */
5143 while ((!fo_ins_blank && !has_format_option(FO_INS_VI'v'))
5144 || (flags & INSCHAR_FORMAT1)
5145 || curwin->w_cursor.lnum != Insstart.lnum
5146 || curwin->w_cursor.col >= Insstart.col) {
5147 if (curwin->w_cursor.col == startcol && c != NUL'\000')
5148 cc = c;
5149 else
5150 cc = gchar_cursor();
5151 if (WHITECHAR(cc)(((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t') && (!enc_utf8 || !utf_iscomposing
( utf_ptr2char(get_cursor_pos_ptr() + 1))))) {
5152 /* remember position of blank just before text */
5153 end_col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
5154
5155 /* find start of sequence of blanks */
5156 while (curwin->w_cursor.col > 0 && WHITECHAR(cc)(((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t') && (!enc_utf8 || !utf_iscomposing
( utf_ptr2char(get_cursor_pos_ptr() + 1))))) {
5157 dec_cursor();
5158 cc = gchar_cursor();
5159 }
5160 if (curwin->w_cursor.col == 0 && WHITECHAR(cc)(((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t') && (!enc_utf8 || !utf_iscomposing
( utf_ptr2char(get_cursor_pos_ptr() + 1)))))
5161 break; /* only spaces in front of text */
5162 /* Don't break until after the comment leader */
5163 if (curwin->w_cursor.col < leader_len)
5164 break;
5165 if (has_format_option(FO_ONE_LETTER'1')) {
5166 /* do not break after one-letter words */
5167 if (curwin->w_cursor.col == 0)
5168 break; /* one-letter word at begin */
5169 /* do not break "#a b" when 'tw' is 2 */
5170 if (curwin->w_cursor.col <= leader_len)
5171 break;
5172 col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
5173 dec_cursor();
5174 cc = gchar_cursor();
5175
5176 if (WHITECHAR(cc)(((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t') && (!enc_utf8 || !utf_iscomposing
( utf_ptr2char(get_cursor_pos_ptr() + 1)))))
5177 continue; /* one-letter, continue */
5178 curwin->w_cursor.col = col;
5179 }
5180
5181 inc_cursor();
5182
5183 end_foundcol = end_col + 1;
5184 foundcol = curwin->w_cursor.col;
5185 if (curwin->w_cursor.col <= (colnr_T)wantcol)
5186 break;
5187 } else if (cc >= 0x100 && fo_multibyte) {
5188 /* Break after or before a multi-byte character. */
5189 if (curwin->w_cursor.col != startcol) {
5190 /* Don't break until after the comment leader */
5191 if (curwin->w_cursor.col < leader_len)
5192 break;
5193 col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
5194 inc_cursor();
5195 /* Don't change end_foundcol if already set. */
5196 if (foundcol != curwin->w_cursor.col) {
5197 foundcol = curwin->w_cursor.col;
5198 end_foundcol = foundcol;
5199 if (curwin->w_cursor.col <= (colnr_T)wantcol)
5200 break;
5201 }
5202 curwin->w_cursor.col = col;
5203 }
5204
5205 if (curwin->w_cursor.col == 0)
5206 break;
5207
5208 col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
5209
5210 dec_cursor();
5211 cc = gchar_cursor();
5212
5213 if (WHITECHAR(cc)(((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t') && (!enc_utf8 || !utf_iscomposing
( utf_ptr2char(get_cursor_pos_ptr() + 1)))))
5214 continue; /* break with space */
5215 /* Don't break until after the comment leader */
5216 if (curwin->w_cursor.col < leader_len)
5217 break;
5218
5219 curwin->w_cursor.col = col;
5220
5221 foundcol = curwin->w_cursor.col;
5222 end_foundcol = foundcol;
5223 if (curwin->w_cursor.col <= (colnr_T)wantcol)
5224 break;
5225 }
5226 if (curwin->w_cursor.col == 0)
5227 break;
5228 dec_cursor();
5229 }
5230
5231 if (foundcol == 0) { /* no spaces, cannot break line */
5232 curwin->w_cursor.col = startcol;
5233 break;
5234 }
5235
5236 /* Going to break the line, remove any "$" now. */
5237 undisplay_dollar();
5238
5239 /*
5240 * Offset between cursor position and line break is used by replace
5241 * stack functions. VREPLACE does not use this, and backspaces
5242 * over the text instead.
5243 */
5244 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
5245 orig_col = startcol; /* Will start backspacing from here */
5246 else
5247 replace_offset = startcol - end_foundcol;
5248
5249 /*
5250 * adjust startcol for spaces that will be deleted and
5251 * characters that will remain on top line
5252 */
5253 curwin->w_cursor.col = foundcol;
5254 while ((cc = gchar_cursor(), WHITECHAR(cc)(((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t') && (!enc_utf8 || !utf_iscomposing
( utf_ptr2char(get_cursor_pos_ptr() + 1)))))
5255 && (!fo_white_par || curwin->w_cursor.col < startcol))
5256 inc_cursor();
5257 startcol -= curwin->w_cursor.col;
5258 if (startcol < 0)
5259 startcol = 0;
5260
5261 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80) {
5262 /*
5263 * In VREPLACE mode, we will backspace over the text to be
5264 * wrapped, so save a copy now to put on the next line.
5265 */
5266 saved_text = vim_strsave(get_cursor_pos_ptr());
5267 curwin->w_cursor.col = orig_col;
5268 saved_text[startcol] = NUL'\000';
5269
5270 /* Backspace over characters that will move to the next line */
5271 if (!fo_white_par)
5272 backspace_until_column(foundcol);
5273 } else {
5274 /* put cursor after pos. to break line */
5275 if (!fo_white_par)
5276 curwin->w_cursor.col = foundcol;
5277 }
5278
5279 /*
5280 * Split the line just before the margin.
5281 * Only insert/delete lines, but don't really redraw the window.
5282 */
5283 open_line(FORWARD1, OPENLINE_DELSPACES1 + OPENLINE_MARKFIX8
5284 + (fo_white_par ? OPENLINE_KEEPTRAIL4 : 0)
5285 + (do_comments ? OPENLINE_DO_COM2 : 0)
5286 + ((flags & INSCHAR_COM_LIST16) ? OPENLINE_COM_LIST16 : 0)
5287 , ((flags & INSCHAR_COM_LIST16) ? second_indent : old_indent));
5288 if (!(flags & INSCHAR_COM_LIST16))
5289 old_indent = 0;
5290
5291 replace_offset = 0;
5292 if (first_line) {
5293 if (!(flags & INSCHAR_COM_LIST16)) {
5294 /*
5295 * This section is for auto-wrap of numeric lists. When not
5296 * in insert mode (i.e. format_lines()), the INSCHAR_COM_LIST
5297 * flag will be set and open_line() will handle it (as seen
5298 * above). The code here (and in get_number_indent()) will
5299 * recognize comments if needed...
5300 */
5301 if (second_indent < 0 && has_format_option(FO_Q_NUMBER'n'))
5302 second_indent =
5303 get_number_indent(curwin->w_cursor.lnum - 1);
5304 if (second_indent >= 0) {
5305 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
5306 change_indent(INDENT_SET1, second_indent,
5307 FALSE0, NUL'\000', TRUE1);
5308 else if (leader_len > 0 && second_indent - leader_len > 0) {
5309 int i;
5310 int padding = second_indent - leader_len;
5311
5312 /* We started at the first_line of a numbered list
5313 * that has a comment. the open_line() function has
5314 * inserted the proper comment leader and positioned
5315 * the cursor at the end of the split line. Now we
5316 * add the additional whitespace needed after the
5317 * comment leader for the numbered list. */
5318 for (i = 0; i < padding; i++)
5319 ins_str((char_u *)" ");
5320 changed_bytes(curwin->w_cursor.lnum, leader_len);
5321 } else {
5322 (void)set_indent(second_indent, SIN_CHANGED1);
5323 }
5324 }
5325 }
5326 first_line = FALSE0;
5327 }
5328
5329 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80) {
5330 /*
5331 * In VREPLACE mode we have backspaced over the text to be
5332 * moved, now we re-insert it into the new line.
5333 */
5334 ins_bytes(saved_text);
5335 free(saved_text);
5336 } else {
5337 /*
5338 * Check if cursor is not past the NUL off the line, cindent
5339 * may have added or removed indent.
5340 */
5341 curwin->w_cursor.col += startcol;
5342 len = (colnr_T)STRLEN(get_cursor_line_ptr())strlen((char *)(get_cursor_line_ptr()));
5343 if (curwin->w_cursor.col > len)
5344 curwin->w_cursor.col = len;
5345 }
5346
5347 haveto_redraw = TRUE1;
5348 can_cindent = TRUE1;
5349 /* moved the cursor, don't autoindent or cindent now */
5350 did_ai = FALSE0;
5351 did_si = FALSE0;
5352 can_si = FALSE0;
5353 can_si_back = FALSE0;
5354 line_breakcheck();
5355 }
5356
5357 if (save_char != NUL'\000') /* put back space after cursor */
5358 pchar_cursor(save_char);
5359
5360 if (!format_only && haveto_redraw) {
5361 update_topline();
5362 redraw_curbuf_later(VALID10);
5363 }
5364}
5365
5366/*
5367 * Called after inserting or deleting text: When 'formatoptions' includes the
5368 * 'a' flag format from the current line until the end of the paragraph.
5369 * Keep the cursor at the same position relative to the text.
5370 * The caller must have saved the cursor line for undo, following ones will be
5371 * saved here.
5372 */
5373void
5374auto_format (
5375 int trailblank, /* when TRUE also format with trailing blank */
5376 int prev_line /* may start in previous line */
5377)
5378{
5379 pos_T pos;
5380 colnr_T len;
5381 char_u *old;
5382 char_u *new, *pnew;
5383 int wasatend;
5384 int cc;
5385
5386 if (!has_format_option(FO_AUTO'a'))
5387 return;
5388
5389 pos = curwin->w_cursor;
5390 old = get_cursor_line_ptr();
5391
5392 /* may remove added space */
5393 check_auto_format(FALSE0);
5394
5395 /* Don't format in Insert mode when the cursor is on a trailing blank, the
5396 * user might insert normal text next. Also skip formatting when "1" is
5397 * in 'formatoptions' and there is a single character before the cursor.
5398 * Otherwise the line would be broken and when typing another non-white
5399 * next they are not joined back together. */
5400 wasatend = (pos.col == (colnr_T)STRLEN(old)strlen((char *)(old)));
5401 if (*old != NUL'\000' && !trailblank && wasatend) {
5402 dec_cursor();
5403 cc = gchar_cursor();
5404 if (!WHITECHAR(cc)(((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t') && (!enc_utf8 || !utf_iscomposing
( utf_ptr2char(get_cursor_pos_ptr() + 1)))) && curwin->w_cursor.col > 0
5405 && has_format_option(FO_ONE_LETTER'1'))
5406 dec_cursor();
5407 cc = gchar_cursor();
5408 if (WHITECHAR(cc)(((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t') && (!enc_utf8 || !utf_iscomposing
( utf_ptr2char(get_cursor_pos_ptr() + 1))))) {
5409 curwin->w_cursor = pos;
5410 return;
5411 }
5412 curwin->w_cursor = pos;
5413 }
5414
5415 /* With the 'c' flag in 'formatoptions' and 't' missing: only format
5416 * comments. */
5417 if (has_format_option(FO_WRAP_COMS'c') && !has_format_option(FO_WRAP't')
5418 && get_leader_len(old, NULL((void*)0), FALSE0, TRUE1) == 0)
5419 return;
5420
5421 /*
5422 * May start formatting in a previous line, so that after "x" a word is
5423 * moved to the previous line if it fits there now. Only when this is not
5424 * the start of a paragraph.
5425 */
5426 if (prev_line && !paragraph_start(curwin->w_cursor.lnum)) {
5427 --curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
5428 if (u_save_cursor() == FAIL0)
5429 return;
5430 }
5431
5432 /*
5433 * Do the formatting and restore the cursor position. "saved_cursor" will
5434 * be adjusted for the text formatting.
5435 */
5436 saved_cursor = pos;
5437 format_lines((linenr_T)-1, FALSE0);
5438 curwin->w_cursor = saved_cursor;
5439 saved_cursor.lnum = 0;
5440
5441 if (curwin->w_cursor.lnum > curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count) {
5442 /* "cannot happen" */
5443 curwin->w_cursor.lnum = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
5444 coladvance((colnr_T)MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL));
5445 } else
5446 check_cursor_col();
5447
5448 /* Insert mode: If the cursor is now after the end of the line while it
5449 * previously wasn't, the line was broken. Because of the rule above we
5450 * need to add a space when 'w' is in 'formatoptions' to keep a paragraph
5451 * formatted. */
5452 if (!wasatend && has_format_option(FO_WHITE_PAR'w')) {
5453 new = get_cursor_line_ptr();
5454 len = (colnr_T)STRLEN(new)strlen((char *)(new));
5455 if (curwin->w_cursor.col == len) {
5456 pnew = vim_strnsave(new, len + 2);
5457 pnew[len] = ' ';
5458 pnew[len + 1] = NUL'\000';
5459 ml_replace(curwin->w_cursor.lnum, pnew, FALSE0);
5460 /* remove the space later */
5461 did_add_space = TRUE1;
5462 } else
5463 /* may remove added space */
5464 check_auto_format(FALSE0);
5465 }
5466
5467 check_cursor();
5468}
5469
5470/*
5471 * When an extra space was added to continue a paragraph for auto-formatting,
5472 * delete it now. The space must be under the cursor, just after the insert
5473 * position.
5474 */
5475static void
5476check_auto_format (
5477 int end_insert /* TRUE when ending Insert mode */
5478)
5479{
5480 int c = ' ';
5481 int cc;
5482
5483 if (did_add_space) {
5484 cc = gchar_cursor();
5485 if (!WHITECHAR(cc)(((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t') && (!enc_utf8 || !utf_iscomposing
( utf_ptr2char(get_cursor_pos_ptr() + 1)))))
5486 /* Somehow the space was removed already. */
5487 did_add_space = FALSE0;
5488 else {
5489 if (!end_insert) {
5490 inc_cursor();
5491 c = gchar_cursor();
5492 dec_cursor();
5493 }
5494 if (c != NUL'\000') {
5495 /* The space is no longer at the end of the line, delete it. */
5496 del_char(FALSE0);
5497 did_add_space = FALSE0;
5498 }
5499 }
5500 }
5501}
5502
5503/*
5504 * Find out textwidth to be used for formatting:
5505 * if 'textwidth' option is set, use it
5506 * else if 'wrapmargin' option is set, use curwin->w_width - 'wrapmargin'
5507 * if invalid value, use 0.
5508 * Set default to window width (maximum 79) for "gq" operator.
5509 */
5510int
5511comp_textwidth (
5512 int ff /* force formatting (for "gq" command) */
5513)
5514{
5515 int textwidth;
5516
5517 textwidth = curbuf->b_p_tw;
5518 if (textwidth == 0 && curbuf->b_p_wm) {
5519 /* The width is the window width minus 'wrapmargin' minus all the
5520 * things that add to the margin. */
5521 textwidth = curwin->w_width - curbuf->b_p_wm;
5522 if (cmdwin_type != 0)
5523 textwidth -= 1;
5524 textwidth -= curwin->w_p_fdcw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdc;
5525
5526 if (curwin->w_buffer->b_signlist != NULL((void*)0)) {
5527 textwidth -= 1;
5528 }
5529
5530 if (curwin->w_p_nuw_onebuf_opt.wo_nu || curwin->w_p_rnuw_onebuf_opt.wo_rnu)
5531 textwidth -= 8;
5532 }
5533 if (textwidth < 0)
5534 textwidth = 0;
5535 if (ff && textwidth == 0) {
5536 textwidth = curwin->w_width - 1;
5537 if (textwidth > 79)
5538 textwidth = 79;
5539 }
5540 return textwidth;
5541}
5542
5543/*
5544 * Put a character in the redo buffer, for when just after a CTRL-V.
5545 */
5546static void redo_literal(int c)
5547{
5548 char_u buf[10];
5549
5550 /* Only digits need special treatment. Translate them into a string of
5551 * three digits. */
5552 if (VIM_ISDIGIT(c)((unsigned)(c) - '0' < 10)) {
5553 vim_snprintf((char *)buf, sizeof(buf), "%03d", c);
5554 AppendToRedobuff(buf);
5555 } else
5556 AppendCharToRedobuff(c);
5557}
5558
5559/*
5560 * start_arrow() is called when an arrow key is used in insert mode.
5561 * For undo/redo it resembles hitting the <ESC> key.
5562 */
5563static void
5564start_arrow (
5565 pos_T *end_insert_pos /* can be NULL */
5566)
5567{
5568 if (!arrow_used) { /* something has been inserted */
5569 AppendToRedobuff(ESC_STR(char_u *)"\033");
5570 stop_insert(end_insert_pos, FALSE0, FALSE0);
5571 arrow_used = TRUE1; /* this means we stopped the current insert */
5572 }
5573 check_spell_redraw();
5574}
5575
5576/*
5577 * If we skipped highlighting word at cursor, do it now.
5578 * It may be skipped again, thus reset spell_redraw_lnum first.
5579 */
5580static void check_spell_redraw(void)
5581{
5582 if (spell_redraw_lnum != 0) {
5583 linenr_T lnum = spell_redraw_lnum;
5584
5585 spell_redraw_lnum = 0;
5586 redrawWinline(lnum, FALSE0);
5587 }
5588}
5589
5590/*
5591 * Called when starting CTRL_X_SPELL mode: Move backwards to a previous badly
5592 * spelled word, if there is one.
5593 */
5594static void spell_back_to_badword(void)
5595{
5596 pos_T tpos = curwin->w_cursor;
5597
5598 spell_bad_len = spell_move_to(curwin, BACKWARD(-1), TRUE1, TRUE1, NULL((void*)0));
5599 if (curwin->w_cursor.col != tpos.col)
5600 start_arrow(&tpos);
5601}
5602
5603/*
5604 * stop_arrow() is called before a change is made in insert mode.
5605 * If an arrow key has been used, start a new insertion.
5606 * Returns FAIL if undo is impossible, shouldn't insert then.
5607 */
5608int stop_arrow(void)
5609{
5610 if (arrow_used) {
5611 if (u_save_cursor() == OK1) {
5612 arrow_used = FALSE0;
5613 ins_need_undo = FALSE0;
5614 }
5615 Insstart = curwin->w_cursor; /* new insertion starts here */
5616 Insstart_textlen = (colnr_T)linetabsize(get_cursor_line_ptr());
5617 ai_col = 0;
5618 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80) {
5619 orig_line_count = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
5620 vr_lines_changed = 1;
5621 }
5622 ResetRedobuff();
5623 AppendToRedobuff((char_u *)"1i"); /* pretend we start an insertion */
5624 new_insert_skip = 2;
5625 } else if (ins_need_undo) {
5626 if (u_save_cursor() == OK1)
5627 ins_need_undo = FALSE0;
5628 }
5629
5630 /* Always open fold at the cursor line when inserting something. */
5631 foldOpenCursor();
5632
5633 return arrow_used || ins_need_undo ? FAIL0 : OK1;
5634}
5635
5636/*
5637 * Do a few things to stop inserting.
5638 * "end_insert_pos" is where insert ended. It is NULL when we already jumped
5639 * to another window/buffer.
5640 */
5641static void
5642stop_insert (
5643 pos_T *end_insert_pos,
5644 int esc, /* called by ins_esc() */
5645 int nomove /* <c-\><c-o>, don't move cursor */
5646)
5647{
5648 int cc;
5649 char_u *ptr;
5650
5651 stop_redo_ins();
5652 replace_flush(); /* abandon replace stack */
5653
5654 /*
5655 * Save the inserted text for later redo with ^@ and CTRL-A.
5656 * Don't do it when "restart_edit" was set and nothing was inserted,
5657 * otherwise CTRL-O w and then <Left> will clear "last_insert".
5658 */
5659 ptr = get_inserted();
5660 if (did_restart_edit == 0 || (ptr != NULL((void*)0)
5661 && (int)STRLEN(ptr)strlen((char *)(ptr)) > new_insert_skip)) {
5662 free(last_insert);
5663 last_insert = ptr;
5664 last_insert_skip = new_insert_skip;
5665 } else
5666 free(ptr);
5667
5668 if (!arrow_used && end_insert_pos != NULL((void*)0)) {
5669 /* Auto-format now. It may seem strange to do this when stopping an
5670 * insertion (or moving the cursor), but it's required when appending
5671 * a line and having it end in a space. But only do it when something
5672 * was actually inserted, otherwise undo won't work. */
5673 if (!ins_need_undo && has_format_option(FO_AUTO'a')) {
5674 pos_T tpos = curwin->w_cursor;
5675
5676 /* When the cursor is at the end of the line after a space the
5677 * formatting will move it to the following word. Avoid that by
5678 * moving the cursor onto the space. */
5679 cc = 'x';
5680 if (curwin->w_cursor.col > 0 && gchar_cursor() == NUL'\000') {
5681 dec_cursor();
5682 cc = gchar_cursor();
5683 if (!vim_iswhite(cc)((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t'))
5684 curwin->w_cursor = tpos;
5685 }
5686
5687 auto_format(TRUE1, FALSE0);
5688
5689 if (vim_iswhite(cc)((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t')) {
5690 if (gchar_cursor() != NUL'\000')
5691 inc_cursor();
5692 /* If the cursor is still at the same character, also keep
5693 * the "coladd". */
5694 if (gchar_cursor() == NUL'\000'
5695 && curwin->w_cursor.lnum == tpos.lnum
5696 && curwin->w_cursor.col == tpos.col)
5697 curwin->w_cursor.coladd = tpos.coladd;
5698 }
5699 }
5700
5701 /* If a space was inserted for auto-formatting, remove it now. */
5702 check_auto_format(TRUE1);
5703
5704 /* If we just did an auto-indent, remove the white space from the end
5705 * of the line, and put the cursor back.
5706 * Do this when ESC was used or moving the cursor up/down.
5707 * Check for the old position still being valid, just in case the text
5708 * got changed unexpectedly. */
5709 if (!nomove && did_ai && (esc || (vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_INDENT'I') == NULL((void*)0)
5710 && curwin->w_cursor.lnum !=
5711 end_insert_pos->lnum))
5712 && end_insert_pos->lnum <= curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count) {
5713 pos_T tpos = curwin->w_cursor;
5714
5715 curwin->w_cursor = *end_insert_pos;
5716 check_cursor_col(); /* make sure it is not past the line */
5717 for (;; ) {
5718 if (gchar_cursor() == NUL'\000' && curwin->w_cursor.col > 0)
5719 --curwin->w_cursor.col;
5720 cc = gchar_cursor();
5721 if (!vim_iswhite(cc)((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t'))
5722 break;
5723 if (del_char(TRUE1) == FAIL0)
5724 break; /* should not happen */
5725 }
5726 if (curwin->w_cursor.lnum != tpos.lnum)
5727 curwin->w_cursor = tpos;
5728 else if (cc != NUL'\000')
5729 ++curwin->w_cursor.col; /* put cursor back on the NUL */
5730
5731 /* <C-S-Right> may have started Visual mode, adjust the position for
5732 * deleted characters. */
5733 if (VIsual_active && VIsual.lnum == curwin->w_cursor.lnum) {
5734 int len = (int)STRLEN(get_cursor_line_ptr())strlen((char *)(get_cursor_line_ptr()));
5735
5736 if (VIsual.col > len) {
5737 VIsual.col = len;
5738 VIsual.coladd = 0;
5739 }
5740 }
5741 }
5742 }
5743 did_ai = FALSE0;
5744 did_si = FALSE0;
5745 can_si = FALSE0;
5746 can_si_back = FALSE0;
5747
5748 /* Set '[ and '] to the inserted text. When end_insert_pos is NULL we are
5749 * now in a different buffer. */
5750 if (end_insert_pos != NULL((void*)0)) {
5751 curbuf->b_op_start = Insstart;
5752 curbuf->b_op_start_orig = Insstart_orig;
5753 curbuf->b_op_end = *end_insert_pos;
5754 }
5755}
5756
5757/*
5758 * Set the last inserted text to a single character.
5759 * Used for the replace command.
5760 */
5761void set_last_insert(int c)
5762{
5763 char_u *s;
5764
5765 free(last_insert);
5766 last_insert = xmalloc(MB_MAXBYTES21 * 3 + 5);
5767 s = last_insert;
5768 /* Use the CTRL-V only when entering a special char */
5769 if (c < ' ' || c == DEL0x7f)
5770 *s++ = Ctrl_V22;
5771 s = add_char2buf(c, s);
5772 *s++ = ESC'\033';
5773 *s++ = NUL'\000';
5774 last_insert_skip = 0;
5775}
5776
5777#if defined(EXITFREE) || defined(PROTO)
5778void free_last_insert(void)
5779{
5780 free(last_insert);
5781 last_insert = NULL((void*)0);
5782 free(compl_orig_text);
5783 compl_orig_text = NULL((void*)0);
5784}
5785
5786#endif
5787
5788/*
5789 * Add character "c" to buffer "s". Escape the special meaning of K_SPECIAL
5790 * and CSI. Handle multi-byte characters.
5791 * Returns a pointer to after the added bytes.
5792 */
5793char_u *add_char2buf(int c, char_u *s)
5794{
5795 char_u temp[MB_MAXBYTES21 + 1];
5796 int i;
5797 int len;
5798
5799 len = (*mb_char2bytes)(c, temp);
5800 for (i = 0; i < len; ++i) {
5801 c = temp[i];
5802 /* Need to escape K_SPECIAL and CSI like in the typeahead buffer. */
5803 if (c == K_SPECIAL(0x80)) {
5804 *s++ = K_SPECIAL(0x80);
5805 *s++ = KS_SPECIAL254;
5806 *s++ = KE_FILLER('X');
5807 } else
5808 *s++ = c;
5809 }
5810 return s;
5811}
5812
5813/*
5814 * move cursor to start of line
5815 * if flags & BL_WHITE move to first non-white
5816 * if flags & BL_SOL move to first non-white if startofline is set,
5817 * otherwise keep "curswant" column
5818 * if flags & BL_FIX don't leave the cursor on a NUL.
5819 */
5820void beginline(int flags)
5821{
5822 if ((flags & BL_SOL2) && !p_sol)
5823 coladvance(curwin->w_curswant);
5824 else {
5825 curwin->w_cursor.col = 0;
5826 curwin->w_cursor.coladd = 0;
5827
5828 if (flags & (BL_WHITE1 | BL_SOL2)) {
5829 char_u *ptr;
5830
5831 for (ptr = get_cursor_line_ptr(); vim_iswhite(*ptr)((*ptr) == ' ' || (*ptr) == '\t')
5832 && !((flags & BL_FIX4) && ptr[1] == NUL'\000'); ++ptr)
5833 ++curwin->w_cursor.col;
5834 }
5835 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
5836 }
5837}
5838
5839/*
5840 * oneright oneleft cursor_down cursor_up
5841 *
5842 * Move one char {right,left,down,up}.
5843 * Doesn't move onto the NUL past the end of the line, unless it is allowed.
5844 * Return OK when successful, FAIL when we hit a line of file boundary.
5845 */
5846
5847int oneright(void)
5848{
5849 char_u *ptr;
5850 int l;
5851
5852 if (virtual_active()) {
5853 pos_T prevpos = curwin->w_cursor;
5854
5855 /* Adjust for multi-wide char (excluding TAB) */
5856 ptr = get_cursor_pos_ptr();
5857 coladvance(getviscol() + ((*ptr != TAB'\011' && vim_isprintc(
5858 (*mb_ptr2char)(ptr)
5859 ))
5860 ? ptr2cells(ptr) : 1));
5861 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
5862 /* Return OK if the cursor moved, FAIL otherwise (at window edge). */
5863 return (prevpos.col != curwin->w_cursor.col
5864 || prevpos.coladd != curwin->w_cursor.coladd) ? OK1 : FAIL0;
5865 }
5866
5867 ptr = get_cursor_pos_ptr();
5868 if (*ptr == NUL'\000')
5869 return FAIL0; /* already at the very end */
5870
5871 if (has_mbyte)
5872 l = (*mb_ptr2len)(ptr);
5873 else
5874 l = 1;
5875
5876 /* move "l" bytes right, but don't end up on the NUL, unless 'virtualedit'
5877 * contains "onemore". */
5878 if (ptr[l] == NUL'\000'
5879 && (ve_flags & VE_ONEMORE8) == 0
5880 )
5881 return FAIL0;
5882 curwin->w_cursor.col += l;
5883
5884 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
5885 return OK1;
5886}
5887
5888int oneleft(void)
5889{
5890 if (virtual_active()) {
5891 int width;
5892 int v = getviscol();
5893
5894 if (v == 0)
5895 return FAIL0;
5896
5897 /* We might get stuck on 'showbreak', skip over it. */
5898 width = 1;
5899 for (;; ) {
5900 coladvance(v - width);
5901 /* getviscol() is slow, skip it when 'showbreak' is empty and
5902 * there are no multi-byte characters */
5903 if ((*p_sbr == NUL'\000'
5904 && !has_mbyte
5905 ) || getviscol() < v)
5906 break;
5907 ++width;
5908 }
5909
5910 if (curwin->w_cursor.coladd == 1) {
5911 char_u *ptr;
5912
5913 /* Adjust for multi-wide char (not a TAB) */
5914 ptr = get_cursor_pos_ptr();
5915 if (*ptr != TAB'\011' && vim_isprintc(
5916 (*mb_ptr2char)(ptr)
5917 ) && ptr2cells(ptr) > 1)
5918 curwin->w_cursor.coladd = 0;
5919 }
5920
5921 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
5922 return OK1;
5923 }
5924
5925 if (curwin->w_cursor.col == 0)
5926 return FAIL0;
5927
5928 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
5929 --curwin->w_cursor.col;
5930
5931 /* if the character on the left of the current cursor is a multi-byte
5932 * character, move to its first byte */
5933 if (has_mbyte)
5934 mb_adjust_cursor();
5935 return OK1;
5936}
5937
5938int
5939cursor_up (
5940 long n,
5941 int upd_topline /* When TRUE: update topline */
5942)
5943{
5944 linenr_T lnum;
5945
5946 if (n > 0) {
5947 lnum = curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
5948 /* This fails if the cursor is already in the first line or the count
5949 * is larger than the line number and '-' is in 'cpoptions' */
5950 if (lnum <= 1 || (n >= lnum && vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_MINUS'-') != NULL((void*)0)))
5951 return FAIL0;
5952 if (n >= lnum)
5953 lnum = 1;
5954 else if (hasAnyFolding(curwin)) {
5955 /*
5956 * Count each sequence of folded lines as one logical line.
5957 */
5958 /* go to the start of the current fold */
5959 (void)hasFolding(lnum, &lnum, NULL((void*)0));
5960
5961 while (n--) {
5962 /* move up one line */
5963 --lnum;
5964 if (lnum <= 1)
5965 break;
5966 /* If we entered a fold, move to the beginning, unless in
5967 * Insert mode or when 'foldopen' contains "all": it will open
5968 * in a moment. */
5969 if (n > 0 || !((State & INSERT0x10) || (fdo_flags & FDO_ALL0x001)))
5970 (void)hasFolding(lnum, &lnum, NULL((void*)0));
5971 }
5972 if (lnum < 1)
5973 lnum = 1;
5974 } else
5975 lnum -= n;
5976 curwin->w_cursor.lnum = lnum;
5977 }
5978
5979 /* try to advance to the column we want to be at */
5980 coladvance(curwin->w_curswant);
5981
5982 if (upd_topline)
5983 update_topline(); /* make sure curwin->w_topline is valid */
5984
5985 return OK1;
5986}
5987
5988/*
5989 * Cursor down a number of logical lines.
5990 */
5991int
5992cursor_down (
5993 long n,
5994 int upd_topline /* When TRUE: update topline */
5995)
5996{
5997 linenr_T lnum;
5998
5999 if (n > 0) {
6000 lnum = curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
6001 /* Move to last line of fold, will fail if it's the end-of-file. */
6002 (void)hasFolding(lnum, NULL((void*)0), &lnum);
6003 /* This fails if the cursor is already in the last line or would move
6004 * beyond the last line and '-' is in 'cpoptions' */
6005 if (lnum >= curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count
6006 || (lnum + n > curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count
6007 && vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_MINUS'-') != NULL((void*)0)))
6008 return FAIL0;
6009 if (lnum + n >= curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
6010 lnum = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
6011 else if (hasAnyFolding(curwin)) {
6012 linenr_T last;
6013
6014 /* count each sequence of folded lines as one logical line */
6015 while (n--) {
6016 if (hasFolding(lnum, NULL((void*)0), &last))
6017 lnum = last + 1;
6018 else
6019 ++lnum;
6020 if (lnum >= curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
6021 break;
6022 }
6023 if (lnum > curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
6024 lnum = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
6025 } else
6026 lnum += n;
6027 curwin->w_cursor.lnum = lnum;
6028 }
6029
6030 /* try to advance to the column we want to be at */
6031 coladvance(curwin->w_curswant);
6032
6033 if (upd_topline)
6034 update_topline(); /* make sure curwin->w_topline is valid */
6035
6036 return OK1;
6037}
6038
6039/*
6040 * Stuff the last inserted text in the read buffer.
6041 * Last_insert actually is a copy of the redo buffer, so we
6042 * first have to remove the command.
6043 */
6044int
6045stuff_inserted (
6046 int c, /* Command character to be inserted */
6047 long count, /* Repeat this many times */
6048 int no_esc /* Don't add an ESC at the end */
6049)
6050{
6051 char_u *esc_ptr;
6052 char_u *ptr;
6053 char_u *last_ptr;
6054 char_u last = NUL'\000';
6055
6056 ptr = get_last_insert();
6057 if (ptr == NULL((void*)0)) {
6058 EMSG(_(e_noinstext))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_noinstext))));
6059 return FAIL0;
6060 }
6061
6062 /* may want to stuff the command character, to start Insert mode */
6063 if (c != NUL'\000')
6064 stuffcharReadbuff(c);
6065 if ((esc_ptr = (char_u *)vim_strrchr(ptr, ESC'\033')) != NULL((void*)0))
6066 *esc_ptr = NUL'\000'; /* remove the ESC */
6067
6068 /* when the last char is either "0" or "^" it will be quoted if no ESC
6069 * comes after it OR if it will inserted more than once and "ptr"
6070 * starts with ^D. -- Acevedo
6071 */
6072 last_ptr = (esc_ptr ? esc_ptr : ptr + STRLEN(ptr)strlen((char *)(ptr))) - 1;
6073 if (last_ptr >= ptr && (*last_ptr == '0' || *last_ptr == '^')
6074 && (no_esc || (*ptr == Ctrl_D4 && count > 1))) {
6075 last = *last_ptr;
6076 *last_ptr = NUL'\000';
6077 }
6078
6079 do {
6080 stuffReadbuff(ptr);
6081 /* a trailing "0" is inserted as "<C-V>048", "^" as "<C-V>^" */
6082 if (last)
6083 stuffReadbuff((char_u *)(last == '0'
6084 ? "\026\060\064\070"
6085 : "\026^"));
6086 } while (--count > 0);
6087
6088 if (last)
6089 *last_ptr = last;
6090
6091 if (esc_ptr != NULL((void*)0))
6092 *esc_ptr = ESC'\033'; /* put the ESC back */
6093
6094 /* may want to stuff a trailing ESC, to get out of Insert mode */
6095 if (!no_esc)
6096 stuffcharReadbuff(ESC'\033');
6097
6098 return OK1;
6099}
6100
6101char_u *get_last_insert(void)
6102{
6103 if (last_insert == NULL((void*)0))
6104 return NULL((void*)0);
6105 return last_insert + last_insert_skip;
6106}
6107
6108/*
6109 * Get last inserted string, and remove trailing <Esc>.
6110 * Returns pointer to allocated memory (must be freed) or NULL.
6111 */
6112char_u *get_last_insert_save(void)
6113{
6114 char_u *s;
6115 int len;
6116
6117 if (last_insert == NULL((void*)0))
6118 return NULL((void*)0);
6119 s = vim_strsave(last_insert + last_insert_skip);
6120 len = (int)STRLEN(s)strlen((char *)(s));
6121 if (len > 0 && s[len - 1] == ESC'\033') /* remove trailing ESC */
6122 s[len - 1] = NUL'\000';
6123
6124 return s;
6125}
6126
6127/*
6128 * Check the word in front of the cursor for an abbreviation.
6129 * Called when the non-id character "c" has been entered.
6130 * When an abbreviation is recognized it is removed from the text and
6131 * the replacement string is inserted in typebuf.tb_buf[], followed by "c".
6132 */
6133static int echeck_abbr(int c)
6134{
6135 /* Don't check for abbreviation in paste mode, when disabled and just
6136 * after moving around with cursor keys. */
6137 if (p_paste || no_abbr || arrow_used)
6138 return FALSE0;
6139
6140 return check_abbr(c, get_cursor_line_ptr(), curwin->w_cursor.col,
6141 curwin->w_cursor.lnum == Insstart.lnum ? Insstart.col : 0);
6142}
6143
6144/*
6145 * replace-stack functions
6146 *
6147 * When replacing characters, the replaced characters are remembered for each
6148 * new character. This is used to re-insert the old text when backspacing.
6149 *
6150 * There is a NUL headed list of characters for each character that is
6151 * currently in the file after the insertion point. When BS is used, one NUL
6152 * headed list is put back for the deleted character.
6153 *
6154 * For a newline, there are two NUL headed lists. One contains the characters
6155 * that the NL replaced. The extra one stores the characters after the cursor
6156 * that were deleted (always white space).
6157 */
6158
6159static char_u *replace_stack = NULL((void*)0);
6160static ssize_t replace_stack_nr = 0; /* next entry in replace stack */
6161static ssize_t replace_stack_len = 0; /* max. number of entries */
6162
6163/// Push character that is replaced onto the the replace stack.
6164///
6165/// replace_offset is normally 0, in which case replace_push will add a new
6166/// character at the end of the stack. If replace_offset is not 0, that many
6167/// characters will be left on the stack above the newly inserted character.
6168///
6169/// @param c character that is replaced (NUL is none)
6170void replace_push(int c)
6171{
6172 if (replace_stack_nr < replace_offset) { // nothing to do
6173 return;
6174 }
6175
6176 if (replace_stack_len <= replace_stack_nr) {
6177 replace_stack_len += 50;
6178 replace_stack = xrealloc(replace_stack, replace_stack_len);
6179 }
6180 char_u *p = replace_stack + replace_stack_nr - replace_offset;
6181 if (replace_offset) {
6182 memmove(p + 1, p, replace_offset);
6183 }
6184 *p = (char_u)c;
6185 ++replace_stack_nr;
6186}
6187
6188/*
6189 * Push a character onto the replace stack. Handles a multi-byte character in
6190 * reverse byte order, so that the first byte is popped off first.
6191 * Return the number of bytes done (includes composing characters).
6192 */
6193int replace_push_mb(char_u *p)
6194{
6195 int l = (*mb_ptr2len)(p);
6196 int j;
6197
6198 for (j = l - 1; j >= 0; --j)
6199 replace_push(p[j]);
6200 return l;
6201}
6202
6203/// Pop one item from the replace stack.
6204///
6205/// @return -1 if stack is empty, replaced character or NUL otherwise
6206static int replace_pop(void)
6207{
6208 return (replace_stack_nr == 0) ? -1 : (int)replace_stack[--replace_stack_nr];
6209}
6210
6211/*
6212 * Join the top two items on the replace stack. This removes to "off"'th NUL
6213 * encountered.
6214 */
6215static void
6216replace_join (
6217 int off /* offset for which NUL to remove */
6218)
6219{
6220 int i;
6221
6222 for (i = replace_stack_nr; --i >= 0; )
6223 if (replace_stack[i] == NUL'\000' && off-- <= 0) {
6224 --replace_stack_nr;
6225 memmove(replace_stack + i, replace_stack + i + 1,
6226 (size_t)(replace_stack_nr - i));
6227 return;
6228 }
6229}
6230
6231/*
6232 * Pop bytes from the replace stack until a NUL is found, and insert them
6233 * before the cursor. Can only be used in REPLACE or VREPLACE mode.
6234 */
6235static void replace_pop_ins(void)
6236{
6237 int cc;
6238 int oldState = State;
6239
6240 State = NORMAL0x01; /* don't want REPLACE here */
6241 while ((cc = replace_pop()) > 0) {
45
←
Loop condition is true. Entering loop body
→
6242 mb_replace_pop_ins(cc);
46
←
Calling 'mb_replace_pop_ins'
→
6243 dec_cursor();
6244 }
6245 State = oldState;
6246}
6247
6248/*

6250 * indicates a multi-byte char, pop the other bytes too.
6251 */
6252static void mb_replace_pop_ins(int cc)
6253{
6254 int n;
6255 char_u buf[MB_MAXBYTES21 + 1];
6256 int i;
6257 int c;
6258
6259 if (has_mbyte && (n = MB_BYTE2LEN(cc)mb_bytelen_tab[cc]) > 1) {
6260 buf[0] = cc;
6261 for (i = 1; i < n; ++i)
6262 buf[i] = replace_pop();
6263 ins_bytes_len(buf, n);
6264 } else
6265 ins_char(cc);
6266
6267 if (enc_utf8)

6276 break;
