6291}
6292
6293/*
6294 * make the replace stack empty
6295 * (called when exiting replace mode)
6296 */
6297static void replace_flush(void)
6298{
6299 free(replace_stack);
6300 replace_stack = NULL((void*)0);
6301 replace_stack_len = 0;
6302 replace_stack_nr = 0;
6303}
6304
6305/*
6306 * Handle doing a BS for one character.
6307 * cc < 0: replace stack empty, just move cursor
6308 * cc == 0: character was inserted, delete it
6309 * cc > 0: character was replaced, put cc (first byte of original char) back
6310 * and check for more characters to be put back
6311 * When "limit_col" is >= 0, don't delete before this column. Matters when
6312 * using composing characters, use del_char_after_col() instead of del_char().
6313 */
6314static void replace_do_bs(int limit_col)
6315{
6316 int cc;
6317 int orig_len = 0;
6318 int ins_len;
6319 int orig_vcols = 0;
6320 colnr_T start_vcol;
6321 char_u *p;
6322 int i;
6323 int vcol;
6324
6325 cc = replace_pop();
6326 if (cc > 0) {
38
←
Assuming 'cc' is > 0
→
39
←
Taking true branch
→
6327 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80) {
40
←
Taking false branch
→
6328 /* Get the number of screen cells used by the character we are
6329 * going to delete. */
6330 getvcol(curwin, &curwin->w_cursor, NULL((void*)0), &start_vcol, NULL((void*)0));
6331 orig_vcols = chartabsize(get_cursor_pos_ptr(), start_vcol);
6332 }
6333 if (has_mbyte) {
41
←
Assuming 'has_mbyte' is 0
→
42
←
Taking false branch
→
6334 (void)del_char_after_col(limit_col);
6335 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
6336 orig_len = (int)STRLEN(get_cursor_pos_ptr())strlen((char *)(get_cursor_pos_ptr()));
6337 replace_push(cc);
6338 } else {
6339 pchar_cursor(cc);
6340 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
43
←
Taking false branch
→
6341 orig_len = (int)STRLEN(get_cursor_pos_ptr())strlen((char *)(get_cursor_pos_ptr())) - 1;
6342 }
6343 replace_pop_ins();
44
←
Calling 'replace_pop_ins'
→
6344
6345 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80) {
6346 /* Get the number of screen cells used by the inserted characters */
6347 p = get_cursor_pos_ptr();
6348 ins_len = (int)STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p)) - orig_len;
6349 vcol = start_vcol;
6350 for (i = 0; i < ins_len; ++i) {
6351 vcol += chartabsize(p + i, vcol);
6352 i += (*mb_ptr2len)(p) - 1;
6353 }
6354 vcol -= start_vcol;
6355
6356 /* Delete spaces that were inserted after the cursor to keep the
6357 * text aligned. */
6358 curwin->w_cursor.col += ins_len;
6359 while (vcol > orig_vcols && gchar_cursor() == ' ') {
6360 del_char(FALSE0);
6361 ++orig_vcols;
6362 }
6363 curwin->w_cursor.col -= ins_len;
6364 }
6365
6366 /* mark the buffer as changed and prepare for displaying */
6367 changed_bytes(curwin->w_cursor.lnum, curwin->w_cursor.col);
6368 } else if (cc == 0)
6369 (void)del_char_after_col(limit_col);
6370}
6371
6372/*
6373 * Return TRUE if C-indenting is on.
6374 */
6375static int cindent_on(void) {
6376 return !p_paste && (curbuf->b_p_cin
6377 || *curbuf->b_p_inde != NUL'\000'
6378 );
6379}
6380
6381/*
6382 * Re-indent the current line, based on the current contents of it and the
6383 * surrounding lines. Fixing the cursor position seems really easy -- I'm very
6384 * confused what all the part that handles Control-T is doing that I'm not.
6385 * "get_the_indent" should be get_c_indent, get_expr_indent or get_lisp_indent.
6386 */
6387void fixthisline(IndentGetter get_the_indent)
6388{
6389 change_indent(INDENT_SET1, get_the_indent(), FALSE0, 0, TRUE1);
6390 if (linewhite(curwin->w_cursor.lnum))
6391 did_ai = TRUE1; /* delete the indent if the line stays empty */
6392}
6393
6394void fix_indent(void) {
6395 if (p_paste)
6396 return;
6397 if (curbuf->b_p_lisp && curbuf->b_p_ai)
6398 fixthisline(get_lisp_indent);
6399 else if (cindent_on())
6400 do_c_expr_indent();
6401}
6402
6403/*
6404 * return TRUE if 'cinkeys' contains the key "keytyped",
6405 * when == '*': Only if key is preceded with '*' (indent before insert)
6406 * when == '!': Only if key is preceded with '!' (don't insert)
6407 * when == ' ': Only if key is not preceded with '*'(indent afterwards)
6408 *
6409 * "keytyped" can have a few special values:
6410 * KEY_OPEN_FORW
6411 * KEY_OPEN_BACK
6412 * KEY_COMPLETE just finished completion.
6413 *
6414 * If line_is_empty is TRUE accept keys with '0' before them.
6415 */
6416int in_cinkeys(int keytyped, int when, int line_is_empty)
6417{
6418 char_u *look;
6419 int try_match;
6420 int try_match_word;
6421 char_u *p;
6422 char_u *line;
6423 int icase;
6424 int i;
6425
6426 if (keytyped == NUL'\000')
6427 /* Can happen with CTRL-Y and CTRL-E on a short line. */
6428 return FALSE0;
6429
6430 if (*curbuf->b_p_inde != NUL'\000')
6431 look = curbuf->b_p_indk; /* 'indentexpr' set: use 'indentkeys' */
6432 else
6433 look = curbuf->b_p_cink; /* 'indentexpr' empty: use 'cinkeys' */
6434 while (*look) {
6435 /*
6436 * Find out if we want to try a match with this key, depending on
6437 * 'when' and a '*' or '!' before the key.
6438 */
6439 switch (when) {
6440 case '*': try_match = (*look == '*'); break;
6441 case '!': try_match = (*look == '!'); break;
6442 default: try_match = (*look != '*'); break;
6443 }
6444 if (*look == '*' || *look == '!')
6445 ++look;
6446
6447 /*
6448 * If there is a '0', only accept a match if the line is empty.
6449 * But may still match when typing last char of a word.
6450 */
6451 if (*look == '0') {
6452 try_match_word = try_match;
6453 if (!line_is_empty)
6454 try_match = FALSE0;
6455 ++look;
6456 } else
6457 try_match_word = FALSE0;
6458
6459 /*
6460 * does it look like a control character?
6461 */
6462 if (*look == '^'
6463 && look[1] >= '?' && look[1] <= '_'
6464 ) {
6465 if (try_match && keytyped == Ctrl_chr(look[1])((((look[1]) < 'a' || (look[1]) > 'z') ? (look[1]) : (look
[1]) - ('a' - 'A')) ^ 0x40))
6466 return TRUE1;
6467 look += 2;
6468 }
6469 /*
6470 * 'o' means "o" command, open forward.
6471 * 'O' means "O" command, open backward.
6472 */
6473 else if (*look == 'o') {
6474 if (try_match && keytyped == KEY_OPEN_FORW0x101)
6475 return TRUE1;
6476 ++look;
6477 } else if (*look == 'O') {
6478 if (try_match && keytyped == KEY_OPEN_BACK0x102)
6479 return TRUE1;
6480 ++look;
6481 }
6482 /*
6483 * 'e' means to check for "else" at start of line and just before the
6484 * cursor.
6485 */
6486 else if (*look == 'e') {
6487 if (try_match && keytyped == 'e' && curwin->w_cursor.col >= 4) {
6488 p = get_cursor_line_ptr();
6489 if (skipwhite(p) == p + curwin->w_cursor.col - 4 &&
6490 STRNCMP(p + curwin->w_cursor.col - 4, "else", 4)strncmp((char *)(p + curwin->w_cursor.col - 4), (char *)("else"
), (size_t)(4)) == 0)
6491 return TRUE1;
6492 }
6493 ++look;
6494 }
6495 /*
6496 * ':' only causes an indent if it is at the end of a label or case
6497 * statement, or when it was before typing the ':' (to fix
6498 * class::method for C++).
6499 */
6500 else if (*look == ':') {
6501 if (try_match && keytyped == ':') {
6502 p = get_cursor_line_ptr();
6503 if (cin_iscase(p, FALSE0) || cin_isscopedecl(p) || cin_islabel())
6504 return TRUE1;
6505 /* Need to get the line again after cin_islabel(). */
6506 p = get_cursor_line_ptr();
6507 if (curwin->w_cursor.col > 2
6508 && p[curwin->w_cursor.col - 1] == ':'
6509 && p[curwin->w_cursor.col - 2] == ':') {
6510 p[curwin->w_cursor.col - 1] = ' ';
6511 i = (cin_iscase(p, FALSE0) || cin_isscopedecl(p)
6512 || cin_islabel());
6513 p = get_cursor_line_ptr();
6514 p[curwin->w_cursor.col - 1] = ':';
6515 if (i)
6516 return TRUE1;
6517 }
6518 }
6519 ++look;
6520 }
6521 /*
6522 * Is it a key in <>, maybe?
6523 */
6524 else if (*look == '<') {
6525 if (try_match) {
6526 /*
6527 * make up some named keys <o>, <O>, <e>, <0>, <>>, <<>, <*>,
6528 * <:> and <!> so that people can re-indent on o, O, e, 0, <,
6529 * >, *, : and ! keys if they really really want to.
6530 */
6531 if (vim_strchr((char_u *)"<>!*oOe0:", look[1]) != NULL((void*)0)
6532 && keytyped == look[1])
6533 return TRUE1;
6534
6535 if (keytyped == get_special_key_code(look + 1))
6536 return TRUE1;
6537 }
6538 while (*look && *look != '>')
6539 look++;
6540 while (*look == '>')
6541 look++;
6542 }
6543 /*
6544 * Is it a word: "=word"?
6545 */
6546 else if (*look == '=' && look[1] != ',' && look[1] != NUL'\000') {
6547 ++look;
6548 if (*look == '~') {
6549 icase = TRUE1;
6550 ++look;
6551 } else
6552 icase = FALSE0;
6553 p = vim_strchr(look, ',');
6554 if (p == NULL((void*)0))
6555 p = look + STRLEN(look)strlen((char *)(look));
6556 if ((try_match || try_match_word)
6557 && curwin->w_cursor.col >= (colnr_T)(p - look)) {
6558 int match = FALSE0;
6559
6560 if (keytyped == KEY_COMPLETE0x103) {
6561 char_u *s;
6562
6563 /* Just completed a word, check if it starts with "look".
6564 * search back for the start of a word. */
6565 line = get_cursor_line_ptr();
6566 if (has_mbyte) {
6567 char_u *n;
6568
6569 for (s = line + curwin->w_cursor.col; s > line; s = n) {
6570 n = mb_prevptr(line, s);
6571 if (!vim_iswordp(n))
6572 break;
6573 }
6574 } else
6575 for (s = line + curwin->w_cursor.col; s > line; --s)
6576 if (!vim_iswordc(s[-1]))
6577 break;
6578 if (s + (p - look) <= line + curwin->w_cursor.col
6579 && (icase
6580 ? MB_STRNICMP(s, look, p - look)mb_strnicmp((char_u *)(s), (char_u *)(look), (int)(p - look))
6581 : STRNCMP(s, look, p - look)strncmp((char *)(s), (char *)(look), (size_t)(p - look))) == 0)
6582 match = TRUE1;
6583 } else
6584 /* TODO: multi-byte */
6585 if (keytyped == (int)p[-1] || (icase && keytyped < 256
6586 && TOLOWER_LOCtolower(keytyped) ==
6587 TOLOWER_LOCtolower((int)p[-1]))) {
6588 line = get_cursor_pos_ptr();
6589 if ((curwin->w_cursor.col == (colnr_T)(p - look)
6590 || !vim_iswordc(line[-(p - look) - 1]))
6591 && (icase
6592 ? MB_STRNICMP(line - (p - look), look, p - look)mb_strnicmp((char_u *)(line - (p - look)), (char_u *)(look), (
int)(p - look))
6593 : STRNCMP(line - (p - look), look, p - look)strncmp((char *)(line - (p - look)), (char *)(look), (size_t)
(p - look)))
6594 == 0)
6595 match = TRUE1;
6596 }
6597 if (match && try_match_word && !try_match) {
6598 /* "0=word": Check if there are only blanks before the
6599 * word. */
6600 line = get_cursor_line_ptr();
6601 if ((int)(skipwhite(line) - line) !=
6602 (int)(curwin->w_cursor.col - (p - look)))
6603 match = FALSE0;
6604 }
6605 if (match)
6606 return TRUE1;
6607 }
6608 look = p;
6609 }
6610 /*
6611 * ok, it's a boring generic character.
6612 */
6613 else {
6614 if (try_match && *look == keytyped)
6615 return TRUE1;
6616 ++look;
6617 }
6618
6619 /*
6620 * Skip over ", ".
6621 */
6622 look = skip_to_option_part(look);
6623 }
6624 return FALSE0;
6625}
6626
6627/*
6628 * Map Hebrew keyboard when in hkmap mode.
6629 */
6630int hkmap(int c)
6631{
6632 if (p_hkmapp) { /* phonetic mapping, by Ilya Dogolazky */
6633 enum {hALEF=0, BET, GIMEL, DALET, HEI, VAV, ZAIN, HET, TET, IUD,
6634 KAFsofit, hKAF, LAMED, MEMsofit, MEM, NUNsofit, NUN, SAMEH, AIN,
6635 PEIsofit, PEI, ZADIsofit, ZADI, KOF, RESH, hSHIN, TAV};
6636 static char_u map[26] =
6637 {(char_u)hALEF /*a*/, (char_u)BET /*b*/, (char_u)hKAF /*c*/,
6638 (char_u)DALET /*d*/, (char_u)-1 /*e*/, (char_u)PEIsofit /*f*/,
6639 (char_u)GIMEL /*g*/, (char_u)HEI /*h*/, (char_u)IUD /*i*/,
6640 (char_u)HET /*j*/, (char_u)KOF /*k*/, (char_u)LAMED /*l*/,
6641 (char_u)MEM /*m*/, (char_u)NUN /*n*/, (char_u)SAMEH /*o*/,
6642 (char_u)PEI /*p*/, (char_u)-1 /*q*/, (char_u)RESH /*r*/,
6643 (char_u)ZAIN /*s*/, (char_u)TAV /*t*/, (char_u)TET /*u*/,
6644 (char_u)VAV /*v*/, (char_u)hSHIN /*w*/, (char_u)-1 /*x*/,
6645 (char_u)AIN /*y*/, (char_u)ZADI /*z*/};
6646
6647 if (c == 'N' || c == 'M' || c == 'P' || c == 'C' || c == 'Z')
6648 return (int)(map[CharOrd(c)((c) < 'a' ? (c) - 'A' : (c) - 'a')] - 1 + p_aleph);
6649 /* '-1'='sofit' */
6650 else if (c == 'x')
6651 return 'X';
6652 else if (c == 'q')
6653 return '\''; /* {geresh}={'} */
6654 else if (c == 246)
6655 return ' '; /* \"o --> ' ' for a german keyboard */
6656 else if (c == 228)
6657 return ' '; /* \"a --> ' ' -- / -- */
6658 else if (c == 252)
6659 return ' '; /* \"u --> ' ' -- / -- */
6660 /* NOTE: islower() does not do the right thing for us on Linux so we
6661 * do this the same was as 5.7 and previous, so it works correctly on
6662 * all systems. Specifically, the e.g. Delete and Arrow keys are
6663 * munged and won't work if e.g. searching for Hebrew text.
6664 */
6665 else if (c >= 'a' && c <= 'z')
6666 return (int)(map[CharOrdLow(c)((c) - 'a')] + p_aleph);
6667 else
6668 return c;
6669 } else {
6670 switch (c) {
6671 case '`': return ';';
6672 case '/': return '.';
6673 case '\'': return ',';
6674 case 'q': return '/';
6675 case 'w': return '\'';
6676
6677 /* Hebrew letters - set offset from 'a' */
6678 case ',': c = '{'; break;
6679 case '.': c = 'v'; break;
6680 case ';': c = 't'; break;
6681 default: {
6682 static char str[] = "zqbcxlsjphmkwonu ydafe rig";
6683
6684 if (c < 'a' || c > 'z')
6685 return c;
6686 c = str[CharOrdLow(c)((c) - 'a')];
6687 break;
6688 }
6689 }
6690
6691 return (int)(CharOrdLow(c)((c) - 'a') + p_aleph);
6692 }
6693}
6694
6695static void ins_reg(void)
6696{
6697 int need_redraw = FALSE0;
6698 int regname;
6699 int literally = 0;
6700 int vis_active = VIsual_active;
6701
6702 /*
6703 * If we are going to wait for a character, show a '"'.
6704 */
6705 pc_status = PC_STATUS_UNSET0;
6706 if (redrawing() && !char_avail()) {
6707 /* may need to redraw when no more chars available now */
6708 ins_redraw(FALSE0);
6709
6710 edit_putchar('"', TRUE1);
6711 add_to_showcmd_c(Ctrl_R18);
6712 }
6713
6714#ifdef USE_ON_FLY_SCROLL
6715 dont_scroll = TRUE1; /* disallow scrolling here */
6716#endif
6717
6718 /*
6719 * Don't map the register name. This also prevents the mode message to be
6720 * deleted when ESC is hit.
6721 */
6722 ++no_mapping;
6723 regname = plain_vgetc();
6724 LANGMAP_ADJUST(regname, TRUE)do { if (*p_langmap && (1) && !KeyStuffed &&
(regname) >= 0) { if ((regname) < 256) regname = langmap_mapchar
[regname]; else regname = langmap_adjust_mb(regname); } } while
(0);
6725 if (regname == Ctrl_R18 || regname == Ctrl_O15 || regname == Ctrl_P16) {
6726 /* Get a third key for literal register insertion */
6727 literally = regname;
6728 add_to_showcmd_c(literally);
6729 regname = plain_vgetc();
6730 LANGMAP_ADJUST(regname, TRUE)do { if (*p_langmap && (1) && !KeyStuffed &&
(regname) >= 0) { if ((regname) < 256) regname = langmap_mapchar
[regname]; else regname = langmap_adjust_mb(regname); } } while
(0);
6731 }
6732 --no_mapping;
6733
6734 /* Don't call u_sync() while typing the expression or giving an error
6735 * message for it. Only call it explicitly. */
6736 ++no_u_sync;
6737 if (regname == '=') {
6738# ifdef USE_IM_CONTROL
6739 int im_on = im_get_status();
6740# endif
6741 /* Sync undo when evaluating the expression calls setline() or
6742 * append(), so that it can be undone separately. */
6743 u_sync_once = 2;
6744
6745 regname = get_expr_register();
6746# ifdef USE_IM_CONTROL
6747 /* Restore the Input Method. */
6748 if (im_on)
6749 im_set_active(TRUE1);
6750# endif
6751 }
6752 if (regname == NUL'\000' || !valid_yank_reg(regname, FALSE0)) {
6753 vim_beep();
6754 need_redraw = TRUE1; /* remove the '"' */
6755 } else {
6756 if (literally == Ctrl_O15 || literally == Ctrl_P16) {
6757 /* Append the command to the redo buffer. */
6758 AppendCharToRedobuff(Ctrl_R18);
6759 AppendCharToRedobuff(literally);
6760 AppendCharToRedobuff(regname);
6761
6762 do_put(regname, BACKWARD(-1), 1L,
6763 (literally == Ctrl_P16 ? PUT_FIXINDENT1 : 0) | PUT_CURSEND2);
6764 } else if (insert_reg(regname, literally) == FAIL0) {
6765 vim_beep();
6766 need_redraw = TRUE1; /* remove the '"' */
6767 } else if (stop_insert_mode)
6768 /* When the '=' register was used and a function was invoked that
6769 * did ":stopinsert" then stuff_empty() returns FALSE but we won't
6770 * insert anything, need to remove the '"' */
6771 need_redraw = TRUE1;
6772
6773 }
6774 --no_u_sync;
6775 if (u_sync_once == 1)
6776 ins_need_undo = TRUE1;
6777 u_sync_once = 0;
6778 clear_showcmd();
6779
6780 /* If the inserted register is empty, we need to remove the '"' */
6781 if (need_redraw || stuff_empty())
6782 edit_unputchar();
6783
6784 /* Disallow starting Visual mode here, would get a weird mode. */
6785 if (!vis_active && VIsual_active)
6786 end_visual_mode();
6787}
6788
6789/*
6790 * CTRL-G commands in Insert mode.
6791 */
6792static void ins_ctrl_g(void)
6793{
6794 int c;
6795
6796 /* Right after CTRL-X the cursor will be after the ruler. */
6797 setcursor();
6798
6799 /*
6800 * Don't map the second key. This also prevents the mode message to be
6801 * deleted when ESC is hit.
6802 */
6803 ++no_mapping;
6804 c = plain_vgetc();
6805 --no_mapping;
6806 switch (c) {
6807 /* CTRL-G k and CTRL-G <Up>: cursor up to Insstart.col */
6808 case K_UP(-(('k') + ((int)('u') << 8))):
6809 case Ctrl_K11:
6810 case 'k': ins_up(TRUE1);
6811 break;
6812
6813 /* CTRL-G j and CTRL-G <Down>: cursor down to Insstart.col */
6814 case K_DOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('d') << 8))):
6815 case Ctrl_J10:
6816 case 'j': ins_down(TRUE1);
6817 break;
6818
6819 /* CTRL-G u: start new undoable edit */
6820 case 'u': u_sync(TRUE1);
6821 ins_need_undo = TRUE1;
6822
6823 /* Need to reset Insstart, esp. because a BS that joins
6824 * a line to the previous one must save for undo. */
6825 update_Insstart_orig = false0;
6826 Insstart = curwin->w_cursor;
6827 break;
6828
6829 /* Unknown CTRL-G command, reserved for future expansion. */
6830 default: vim_beep();
6831 }
6832}
6833
6834/*
6835 * CTRL-^ in Insert mode.
6836 */
6837static void ins_ctrl_hat(void)
6838{
6839 if (map_to_exists_mode((char_u *)"", LANGMAP0x20, FALSE0)) {
6840 /* ":lmap" mappings exists, Toggle use of ":lmap" mappings. */
6841 if (State & LANGMAP0x20) {
6842 curbuf->b_p_iminsert = B_IMODE_NONE0;
6843 State &= ~LANGMAP0x20;
6844 } else {
6845 curbuf->b_p_iminsert = B_IMODE_LMAP1;
6846 State |= LANGMAP0x20;
6847#ifdef USE_IM_CONTROL
6848 im_set_active(FALSE0);
6849#endif
6850 }
6851 }
6852#ifdef USE_IM_CONTROL
6853 else {
6854 /* There are no ":lmap" mappings, toggle IM */
6855 if (im_get_status()) {
6856 curbuf->b_p_iminsert = B_IMODE_NONE0;
6857 im_set_active(FALSE0);
6858 } else {
6859 curbuf->b_p_iminsert = B_IMODE_IM;
6860 State &= ~LANGMAP0x20;
6861 im_set_active(TRUE1);
6862 }
6863 }
6864#endif
6865 set_iminsert_global();
6866 showmode();
6867 /* Show/unshow value of 'keymap' in status lines. */
6868 status_redraw_curbuf();
6869}
6870
6871/*
6872 * Handle ESC in insert mode.
6873 * Returns TRUE when leaving insert mode, FALSE when going to repeat the
6874 * insert.
6875 */
6876static int
6877ins_esc (
6878 long *count,
6879 int cmdchar,
6880 int nomove /* don't move cursor */
6881)
6882{
6883 int temp;
6884 static int disabled_redraw = FALSE0;
6885
6886 check_spell_redraw();
6887
6888 temp = curwin->w_cursor.col;
6889 if (disabled_redraw) {
6890 --RedrawingDisabled;
6891 disabled_redraw = FALSE0;
6892 }
6893 if (!arrow_used) {
6894 /*
6895 * Don't append the ESC for "r<CR>" and "grx".
6896 * When 'insertmode' is set only CTRL-L stops Insert mode. Needed for
6897 * when "count" is non-zero.
6898 */
6899 if (cmdchar != 'r' && cmdchar != 'v')
6900 AppendToRedobuff(p_im ? (char_u *)"\014" : ESC_STR(char_u *)"\033");
6901
6902 /*
6903 * Repeating insert may take a long time. Check for
6904 * interrupt now and then.
6905 */
6906 if (*count > 0) {
6907 line_breakcheck();
6908 if (got_int)
6909 *count = 0;
6910 }
6911
6912 if (--*count > 0) { /* repeat what was typed */
6913 /* Vi repeats the insert without replacing characters. */
6914 if (vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_REPLCNT'X') != NULL((void*)0))
6915 State &= ~REPLACE_FLAG0x40;
6916
6917 (void)start_redo_ins();
6918 if (cmdchar == 'r' || cmdchar == 'v')
6919 stuffReadbuff(ESC_STR(char_u *)"\033"); /* no ESC in redo buffer */
6920 ++RedrawingDisabled;
6921 disabled_redraw = TRUE1;
6922 return FALSE0; /* repeat the insert */
6923 }
6924 stop_insert(&curwin->w_cursor, TRUE1, nomove);
6925 undisplay_dollar();
6926 }
6927
6928 /* When an autoindent was removed, curswant stays after the
6929 * indent */
6930 if (restart_edit == NUL'\000' && (colnr_T)temp == curwin->w_cursor.col)
6931 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
6932
6933 /* Remember the last Insert position in the '^ mark. */
6934 if (!cmdmod.keepjumps)
6935 curbuf->b_last_insert = curwin->w_cursor;
6936
6937 /*
6938 * The cursor should end up on the last inserted character.
6939 * Don't do it for CTRL-O, unless past the end of the line.
6940 */
6941 if (!nomove
6942 && (curwin->w_cursor.col != 0
6943 || curwin->w_cursor.coladd > 0
6944 )
6945 && (restart_edit == NUL'\000'
6946 || (gchar_cursor() == NUL'\000'
6947 && !VIsual_active
6948 ))
6949 && !revins_on
6950 ) {
6951 if (curwin->w_cursor.coladd > 0 || ve_flags == VE_ALL4) {
6952 oneleft();
6953 if (restart_edit != NUL'\000')
6954 ++curwin->w_cursor.coladd;
6955 } else {
6956 --curwin->w_cursor.col;
6957 /* Correct cursor for multi-byte character. */
6958 if (has_mbyte)
6959 mb_adjust_cursor();
6960 }
6961 }
6962
6963#ifdef USE_IM_CONTROL
6964 /* Disable IM to allow typing English directly for Normal mode commands.
6965 * When ":lmap" is enabled don't change 'iminsert' (IM can be enabled as
6966 * well). */
6967 if (!(State & LANGMAP0x20))
6968 im_save_status(&curbuf->b_p_iminsert);
6969 im_set_active(FALSE0);
6970#endif
6971
6972 State = NORMAL0x01;
6973 /* need to position cursor again (e.g. when on a TAB ) */
6974 changed_cline_bef_curs();
6975
6976 setmouse();
6977 ui_cursor_shape(); /* may show different cursor shape */
6978
6979 /*
6980 * When recording or for CTRL-O, need to display the new mode.
6981 * Otherwise remove the mode message.
6982 */
6983 if (Recording || restart_edit != NUL'\000')
6984 showmode();
6985 else if (p_smd)
6986 MSG("")msg((char_u *)(""));
6987
6988 return TRUE1; /* exit Insert mode */
6989}
6990
6991/*
6992 * Toggle language: hkmap and revins_on.
6993 * Move to end of reverse inserted text.
6994 */
6995static void ins_ctrl_(void)
6996{
6997 if (revins_on && revins_chars && revins_scol >= 0) {
6998 while (gchar_cursor() != NUL'\000' && revins_chars--)
6999 ++curwin->w_cursor.col;
7000 }
7001 p_ri = !p_ri;
7002 revins_on = (State == INSERT0x10 && p_ri);
7003 if (revins_on) {
7004 revins_scol = curwin->w_cursor.col;
7005 revins_legal++;
7006 revins_chars = 0;
7007 undisplay_dollar();
7008 } else
7009 revins_scol = -1;
7010 if (p_altkeymap) {
7011 /*
7012 * to be consistent also for redo command, using '.'
7013 * set arrow_used to true and stop it - causing to redo
7014 * characters entered in one mode (normal/reverse insert).
7015 */
7016 arrow_used = TRUE1;
7017 (void)stop_arrow();
7018 p_fkmap = curwin->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl ^ p_ri;
7019 if (p_fkmap && p_ri)
7020 State = INSERT0x10;
7021 } else
7022 p_hkmap = curwin->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl ^ p_ri; /* be consistent! */
7023 showmode();
7024}
7025
7026/*
7027 * If 'keymodel' contains "startsel", may start selection.
7028 * Returns TRUE when a CTRL-O and other keys stuffed.
7029 */
7030static int ins_start_select(int c)
7031{
7032 if (km_startsel)
7033 switch (c) {
7034 case K_KHOME(-(('K') + ((int)('1') << 8))):
7035 case K_KEND(-(('K') + ((int)('4') << 8))):
7036 case K_PAGEUP(-(('k') + ((int)('P') << 8))):
7037 case K_KPAGEUP(-(('K') + ((int)('3') << 8))):
7038 case K_PAGEDOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('N') << 8))):
7039 case K_KPAGEDOWN(-(('K') + ((int)('5') << 8))):
7040 if (!(mod_mask & MOD_MASK_SHIFT0x02))
7041 break;
7042 /* FALLTHROUGH */
7043 case K_S_LEFT(-(('#') + ((int)('4') << 8))):
7044 case K_S_RIGHT(-(('%') + ((int)('i') << 8))):
7045 case K_S_UP(-((253) + ((int)(KE_S_UP) << 8))):
7046 case K_S_DOWN(-((253) + ((int)(KE_S_DOWN) << 8))):
7047 case K_S_END(-(('*') + ((int)('7') << 8))):
7048 case K_S_HOME(-(('#') + ((int)('2') << 8))):
7049 /* Start selection right away, the cursor can move with
7050 * CTRL-O when beyond the end of the line. */
7051 start_selection();
7052
7053 /* Execute the key in (insert) Select mode. */
7054 stuffcharReadbuff(Ctrl_O15);
7055 if (mod_mask) {
7056 char_u buf[4];
7057
7058 buf[0] = K_SPECIAL(0x80);
7059 buf[1] = KS_MODIFIER252;
7060 buf[2] = mod_mask;
7061 buf[3] = NUL'\000';
7062 stuffReadbuff(buf);
7063 }
7064 stuffcharReadbuff(c);
7065 return TRUE1;
7066 }
7067 return FALSE0;
7068}
7069
7070/*
7071 * <Insert> key in Insert mode: toggle insert/replace mode.
7072 */
7073static void ins_insert(int replaceState)
7074{
7075 if (p_fkmap && p_ri) {
7076 beep_flush();
7077 EMSG(farsi_text_3)emsg((char_u *)(farsi_text_3)); /* encoded in Farsi */
7078 return;
7079 }
7080
7081 set_vim_var_string(VV_INSERTMODE,
7082 (char_u *)((State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40) ? "i" :
7083 replaceState == VREPLACE(0x40 + 0x80 + 0x10) ? "v" :
7084 "r"), 1);
7085 apply_autocmds(EVENT_INSERTCHANGE, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FALSE0, curbuf);
7086 if (State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40)
7087 State = INSERT0x10 | (State & LANGMAP0x20);
7088 else
7089 State = replaceState | (State & LANGMAP0x20);
7090 AppendCharToRedobuff(K_INS(-(('k') + ((int)('I') << 8))));
7091 showmode();
7092 ui_cursor_shape(); /* may show different cursor shape */
7093}
7094
7095/*
7096 * Pressed CTRL-O in Insert mode.
7097 */
7098static void ins_ctrl_o(void)
7099{
7100 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
7101 restart_edit = 'V';
7102 else if (State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40)
7103 restart_edit = 'R';
7104 else
7105 restart_edit = 'I';
7106 if (virtual_active())
7107 ins_at_eol = FALSE0; /* cursor always keeps its column */
7108 else
7109 ins_at_eol = (gchar_cursor() == NUL'\000');
7110}
7111
7112/*
7113 * If the cursor is on an indent, ^T/^D insert/delete one
7114 * shiftwidth. Otherwise ^T/^D behave like a "<<" or ">>".
7115 * Always round the indent to 'shiftwidth', this is compatible
7116 * with vi. But vi only supports ^T and ^D after an
7117 * autoindent, we support it everywhere.
7118 */
7119static void ins_shift(int c, int lastc)
7120{
7121 if (stop_arrow() == FAIL0)
7122 return;
7123 AppendCharToRedobuff(c);
7124
7125 /*
7126 * 0^D and ^^D: remove all indent.
7127 */
7128 if (c == Ctrl_D4 && (lastc == '0' || lastc == '^')
7129 && curwin->w_cursor.col > 0) {
7130 --curwin->w_cursor.col;
7131 (void)del_char(FALSE0); /* delete the '^' or '0' */
7132 /* In Replace mode, restore the characters that '^' or '0' replaced. */
7133 if (State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40)
7134 replace_pop_ins();
7135 if (lastc == '^')
7136 old_indent = get_indent(); /* remember curr. indent */
7137 change_indent(INDENT_SET1, 0, TRUE1, 0, TRUE1);
7138 } else
7139 change_indent(c == Ctrl_D4 ? INDENT_DEC3 : INDENT_INC2, 0, TRUE1, 0, TRUE1);
7140
7141 if (did_ai && *skipwhite(get_cursor_line_ptr()) != NUL'\000')
7142 did_ai = FALSE0;
7143 did_si = FALSE0;
7144 can_si = FALSE0;
7145 can_si_back = FALSE0;
7146 can_cindent = FALSE0; /* no cindenting after ^D or ^T */
7147}
7148
7149static void ins_del(void)
7150{
7151 int temp;
7152
7153 if (stop_arrow() == FAIL0)
7154 return;
7155 if (gchar_cursor() == NUL'\000') { /* delete newline */
7156 temp = curwin->w_cursor.col;
7157 if (!can_bs(BS_EOL'o') // only if "eol" included
7158 || do_join(2, FALSE0, TRUE1, FALSE0, false0) == FAIL0) {
7159 vim_beep();
7160 } else {
7161 curwin->w_cursor.col = temp;
7162 }
7163 } else if (del_char(FALSE0) == FAIL0) /* delete char under cursor */
7164 vim_beep();
7165 did_ai = FALSE0;
7166 did_si = FALSE0;
7167 can_si = FALSE0;
7168 can_si_back = FALSE0;
7169 AppendCharToRedobuff(K_DEL(-(('k') + ((int)('D') << 8))));
7170}
7171
7172
7173/*
7174 * Delete one character for ins_bs().
7175 */
7176static void ins_bs_one(colnr_T *vcolp)
7177{
7178 dec_cursor();
7179 getvcol(curwin, &curwin->w_cursor, vcolp, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
7180 if (State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40) {
7181 /* Don't delete characters before the insert point when in
7182 * Replace mode */
7183 if (curwin->w_cursor.lnum != Insstart.lnum
7184 || curwin->w_cursor.col >= Insstart.col)
7185 replace_do_bs(-1);
7186 } else
7187 (void)del_char(FALSE0);
7188}
7189
7190/*
7191 * Handle Backspace, delete-word and delete-line in Insert mode.
7192 * Return TRUE when backspace was actually used.
7193 */
7194static int ins_bs(int c, int mode, int *inserted_space_p)
7195{
7196 linenr_T lnum;
7197 int cc;
7198 int temp = 0; /* init for GCC */
7199 colnr_T save_col;
7200 colnr_T mincol;
7201 int did_backspace = FALSE0;
7202 int in_indent;
7203 int oldState;
7204 int cpc[MAX_MCO6]; /* composing characters */
7205
7206 /*
7207 * can't delete anything in an empty file
7208 * can't backup past first character in buffer
7209 * can't backup past starting point unless 'backspace' > 1
7210 * can backup to a previous line if 'backspace' == 0
7211 */
7212 if ( bufempty()(curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count == 1 && *ml_get((linenr_T
)1) == '\000')
7213 || (
7214 !revins_on &&
7215 ((curwin->w_cursor.lnum == 1 && curwin->w_cursor.col == 0)
7216 || (!can_bs(BS_START's')
7217 && (arrow_used
7218 || (curwin->w_cursor.lnum == Insstart_orig.lnum
7219 && curwin->w_cursor.col <= Insstart_orig.col)))
7220 || (!can_bs(BS_INDENT'i') && !arrow_used && ai_col > 0
7221 && curwin->w_cursor.col <= ai_col)
7222 || (!can_bs(BS_EOL'o') && curwin->w_cursor.col == 0)))) {
7223 vim_beep();
7224 return FALSE0;
7225 }
7226
7227 if (stop_arrow() == FAIL0)
7228 return FALSE0;
7229 in_indent = inindent(0);
7230 if (in_indent)
7231 can_cindent = FALSE0;
7232 end_comment_pending = NUL'\000'; /* After BS, don't auto-end comment */
7233 if (revins_on) /* put cursor after last inserted char */
7234 inc_cursor();
7235
7236 /* Virtualedit:
7237 * BACKSPACE_CHAR eats a virtual space
7238 * BACKSPACE_WORD eats all coladd
7239 * BACKSPACE_LINE eats all coladd and keeps going
7240 */
7241 if (curwin->w_cursor.coladd > 0) {
7242 if (mode == BACKSPACE_CHAR1) {
7243 --curwin->w_cursor.coladd;
7244 return TRUE1;
7245 }
7246 if (mode == BACKSPACE_WORD2) {
7247 curwin->w_cursor.coladd = 0;
7248 return TRUE1;
7249 }
7250 curwin->w_cursor.coladd = 0;
7251 }
7252
7253 /*
7254 * delete newline!
7255 */
7256 if (curwin->w_cursor.col == 0) {
7257 lnum = Insstart_orig.lnum;
7258 if (curwin->w_cursor.lnum == lnum || revins_on) {
7259 if (u_save((linenr_T)(curwin->w_cursor.lnum - 2),
7260 (linenr_T)(curwin->w_cursor.lnum + 1)) == FAIL0) {
7261 return FALSE0;
7262 }
7263 --Insstart_orig.lnum;
7264 Insstart_orig.col = MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL);
7265 }
7266 /*
7267 * In replace mode:
7268 * cc < 0: NL was inserted, delete it
7269 * cc >= 0: NL was replaced, put original characters back
7270 */
7271 cc = -1;
7272 if (State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40)
7273 cc = replace_pop(); /* returns -1 if NL was inserted */
7274 /*
7275 * In replace mode, in the line we started replacing, we only move the
7276 * cursor.
7277 */
7278 if ((State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40) && curwin->w_cursor.lnum <= lnum) {
7279 dec_cursor();
7280 } else {
7281 if (!(State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
7282 || curwin->w_cursor.lnum > orig_line_count) {
7283 temp = gchar_cursor(); /* remember current char */
7284 --curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
7285
7286 /* When "aw" is in 'formatoptions' we must delete the space at
7287 * the end of the line, otherwise the line will be broken
7288 * again when auto-formatting. */
7289 if (has_format_option(FO_AUTO'a')
7290 && has_format_option(FO_WHITE_PAR'w')) {
7291 char_u *ptr = ml_get_buf(curbuf, curwin->w_cursor.lnum,
7292 TRUE1);
7293 int len;
7294
7295 len = (int)STRLEN(ptr)strlen((char *)(ptr));
7296 if (len > 0 && ptr[len - 1] == ' ')
7297 ptr[len - 1] = NUL'\000';
7298 }
7299
7300 do_join(2, FALSE0, FALSE0, FALSE0, false0);
7301 if (temp == NUL'\000' && gchar_cursor() != NUL'\000')
7302 inc_cursor();
7303 } else
7304 dec_cursor();
7305
7306 /*
7307 * In REPLACE mode we have to put back the text that was replaced
7308 * by the NL. On the replace stack is first a NUL-terminated
7309 * sequence of characters that were deleted and then the
7310 * characters that NL replaced.
7311 */
7312 if (State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40) {
7313 /*
7314 * Do the next ins_char() in NORMAL state, to
7315 * prevent ins_char() from replacing characters and
7316 * avoiding showmatch().
7317 */
7318 oldState = State;
7319 State = NORMAL0x01;
7320 /*
7321 * restore characters (blanks) deleted after cursor
7322 */
7323 while (cc > 0) {
7324 save_col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
7325 mb_replace_pop_ins(cc);
7326 curwin->w_cursor.col = save_col;
7327 cc = replace_pop();
7328 }
7329 /* restore the characters that NL replaced */
7330 replace_pop_ins();
7331 State = oldState;
7332 }
7333 }
7334 did_ai = FALSE0;
7335 } else {
7336 /*
7337 * Delete character(s) before the cursor.
7338 */
7339 if (revins_on) /* put cursor on last inserted char */
7340 dec_cursor();
7341 mincol = 0;
7342 /* keep indent */
7343 if (mode == BACKSPACE_LINE4
7344 && (curbuf->b_p_ai
7345 || cindent_on()
7346 )
7347 && !revins_on
7348 ) {
7349 save_col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
7350 beginline(BL_WHITE1);
7351 if (curwin->w_cursor.col < save_col)
7352 mincol = curwin->w_cursor.col;
7353 curwin->w_cursor.col = save_col;
7354 }
7355
7356 /*
7357 * Handle deleting one 'shiftwidth' or 'softtabstop'.
7358 */
7359 if ( mode == BACKSPACE_CHAR1
7360 && ((p_sta && in_indent)
7361 || (get_sts_value() != 0
7362 && curwin->w_cursor.col > 0
7363 && (*(get_cursor_pos_ptr() - 1) == TAB'\011'
7364 || (*(get_cursor_pos_ptr() - 1) == ' '
7365 && (!*inserted_space_p
7366 || arrow_used)))))) {
7367 int ts;
7368 colnr_T vcol;
7369 colnr_T want_vcol;
7370 colnr_T start_vcol;
7371
7372 *inserted_space_p = FALSE0;
7373 if (p_sta && in_indent)
7374 ts = (int)get_sw_value(curbuf);
7375 else
7376 ts = (int)get_sts_value();
7377 /* Compute the virtual column where we want to be. Since
7378 * 'showbreak' may get in the way, need to get the last column of
7379 * the previous character. */
7380 getvcol(curwin, &curwin->w_cursor, &vcol, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
7381 start_vcol = vcol;
7382 dec_cursor();
7383 getvcol(curwin, &curwin->w_cursor, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), &want_vcol);
7384 inc_cursor();
7385 want_vcol = (want_vcol / ts) * ts;
7386
7387 /* delete characters until we are at or before want_vcol */
7388 while (vcol > want_vcol
7389 && (cc = *(get_cursor_pos_ptr() - 1), vim_iswhite(cc)((cc) == ' ' || (cc) == '\t')))
7390 ins_bs_one(&vcol);
7391
7392 /* insert extra spaces until we are at want_vcol */
7393 while (vcol < want_vcol) {
7394 /* Remember the first char we inserted */
7395 if (curwin->w_cursor.lnum == Insstart_orig.lnum
7396 && curwin->w_cursor.col < Insstart_orig.col) {
7397 Insstart_orig.col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
7398 }
7399
7400 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
7401 ins_char(' ');
7402 else {
7403 ins_str((char_u *)" ");
7404 if ((State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40))
7405 replace_push(NUL'\000');
7406 }
7407 getvcol(curwin, &curwin->w_cursor, &vcol, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
7408 }
7409
7410 /* If we are now back where we started delete one character. Can
7411 * happen when using 'sts' and 'linebreak'. */
7412 if (vcol >= start_vcol)
7413 ins_bs_one(&vcol);
7414 }
7415 /*
7416 * Delete upto starting point, start of line or previous word.
7417 */
7418 else do {
7419 if (!revins_on) /* put cursor on char to be deleted */
7420 dec_cursor();
7421
7422 /* start of word? */
7423 if (mode == BACKSPACE_WORD2 && !vim_isspace(gchar_cursor())) {
7424 mode = BACKSPACE_WORD_NOT_SPACE3;
7425 temp = vim_iswordc(gchar_cursor());
7426 }
7427 /* end of word? */
7428 else if (mode == BACKSPACE_WORD_NOT_SPACE3
7429 && (vim_isspace(cc = gchar_cursor())
7430 || vim_iswordc(cc) != temp)) {
7431 if (!revins_on)
7432 inc_cursor();
7433 else if (State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40)
7434 dec_cursor();
7435 break;
7436 }
7437 if (State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40)
7438 replace_do_bs(-1);
7439 else {
7440 if (enc_utf8 && p_deco)
7441 (void)utfc_ptr2char(get_cursor_pos_ptr(), cpc);
7442 (void)del_char(FALSE0);
7443 /*
7444 * If there are combining characters and 'delcombine' is set
7445 * move the cursor back. Don't back up before the base
7446 * character.
7447 */
7448 if (enc_utf8 && p_deco && cpc[0] != NUL'\000')
7449 inc_cursor();
7450 if (revins_chars) {
7451 revins_chars--;
7452 revins_legal++;
7453 }
7454 if (revins_on && gchar_cursor() == NUL'\000')
7455 break;
7456 }
7457 /* Just a single backspace?: */
7458 if (mode == BACKSPACE_CHAR1)
7459 break;
7460 } while (
7461 revins_on ||
7462 (curwin->w_cursor.col > mincol
7463 && (curwin->w_cursor.lnum != Insstart_orig.lnum
7464 || curwin->w_cursor.col != Insstart_orig.col)));
7465 did_backspace = TRUE1;
7466 }
7467 did_si = FALSE0;
7468 can_si = FALSE0;
7469 can_si_back = FALSE0;
7470 if (curwin->w_cursor.col <= 1)
7471 did_ai = FALSE0;
7472 /*
7473 * It's a little strange to put backspaces into the redo
7474 * buffer, but it makes auto-indent a lot easier to deal
7475 * with.
7476 */
7477 AppendCharToRedobuff(c);
7478
7479 /* If deleted before the insertion point, adjust it */
7480 if (curwin->w_cursor.lnum == Insstart_orig.lnum
7481 && curwin->w_cursor.col < Insstart_orig.col) {
7482 Insstart_orig.col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
7483 }
7484
7485 /* vi behaviour: the cursor moves backward but the character that
7486 * was there remains visible
7487 * Vim behaviour: the cursor moves backward and the character that
7488 * was there is erased from the screen.
7489 * We can emulate the vi behaviour by pretending there is a dollar
7490 * displayed even when there isn't.
7491 * --pkv Sun Jan 19 01:56:40 EST 2003 */
7492 if (vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_BACKSPACE'v') != NULL((void*)0) && dollar_vcol == -1)
7493 dollar_vcol = curwin->w_virtcol;
7494
7495 /* When deleting a char the cursor line must never be in a closed fold.
7496 * E.g., when 'foldmethod' is indent and deleting the first non-white
7497 * char before a Tab. */
7498 if (did_backspace)
7499 foldOpenCursor();
7500
7501 return did_backspace;
7502}
7503
7504static void ins_mouse(int c)
7505{
7506 pos_T tpos;
7507 win_T *old_curwin = curwin;
7508
7509 if (!mouse_has(MOUSE_INSERT'i'))
7510 return;
7511
7512 undisplay_dollar();
7513 tpos = curwin->w_cursor;
7514 if (do_mouse(NULL((void*)0), c, BACKWARD(-1), 1L, 0)) {
7515 win_T *new_curwin = curwin;
7516
7517 if (curwin != old_curwin && win_valid(old_curwin)) {
7518 /* Mouse took us to another window. We need to go back to the
7519 * previous one to stop insert there properly. */
7520 curwin = old_curwin;
7521 curbuf = curwin->w_buffer;
7522 }
7523 start_arrow(curwin == old_curwin ? &tpos : NULL((void*)0));
7524 if (curwin != new_curwin && win_valid(new_curwin)) {
7525 curwin = new_curwin;
7526 curbuf = curwin->w_buffer;
7527 }
7528 can_cindent = TRUE1;
7529 }
7530
7531 /* redraw status lines (in case another window became active) */
7532 redraw_statuslines();
7533}
7534
7535static void ins_mousescroll(int dir)
7536{
7537 pos_T tpos;
7538 win_T *old_curwin = curwin;
7539 int did_scroll = FALSE0;
7540
7541 tpos = curwin->w_cursor;
7542
7543 if (mouse_row >= 0 && mouse_col >= 0) {
7544 int row, col;
7545
7546 row = mouse_row;
7547 col = mouse_col;
7548
7549 /* find the window at the pointer coordinates */
7550 curwin = mouse_find_win(&row, &col);
7551 curbuf = curwin->w_buffer;
7552 }
7553 if (curwin == old_curwin)
7554 undisplay_dollar();
7555
7556 /* Don't scroll the window in which completion is being done. */
7557 if (!pum_visible()
7558 || curwin != old_curwin
7559 ) {
7560 if (dir == MSCR_DOWN0 || dir == MSCR_UP1) {
7561 if (mod_mask & (MOD_MASK_SHIFT0x02 | MOD_MASK_CTRL0x04))
7562 scroll_redraw(dir,
7563 (long)(curwin->w_botline - curwin->w_topline));
7564 else
7565 scroll_redraw(dir, 3L);
7566 }
7567 did_scroll = TRUE1;
7568 }
7569
7570 curwin->w_redr_status = TRUE1;
7571
7572 curwin = old_curwin;
7573 curbuf = curwin->w_buffer;
7574
7575 /* The popup menu may overlay the window, need to redraw it.
7576 * TODO: Would be more efficient to only redraw the windows that are
7577 * overlapped by the popup menu. */
7578 if (pum_visible() && did_scroll) {
7579 redraw_all_later(NOT_VALID40);
7580 ins_compl_show_pum();
7581 }
7582
7583 if (!equalpos(curwin->w_cursor, tpos)(((curwin->w_cursor).lnum == (tpos).lnum) && ((curwin
->w_cursor).col == (tpos).col) && ((curwin->w_cursor
).coladd == (tpos).coladd))) {
7584 start_arrow(&tpos);
7585 can_cindent = TRUE1;
7586 }
7587}
7588
7589
7590
7591static void ins_left(void)
7592{
7593 pos_T tpos;
7594
7595 if ((fdo_flags & FDO_HOR0x004) && KeyTyped)
7596 foldOpenCursor();
7597 undisplay_dollar();
7598 tpos = curwin->w_cursor;
7599 if (oneleft() == OK1) {
7600 start_arrow(&tpos);
7601 /* If exit reversed string, position is fixed */
7602 if (revins_scol != -1 && (int)curwin->w_cursor.col >= revins_scol)
7603 revins_legal++;
7604 revins_chars++;
7605 }
7606 /*
7607 * if 'whichwrap' set for cursor in insert mode may go to
7608 * previous line
7609 */
7610 else if (vim_strchr(p_ww, '[') != NULL((void*)0) && curwin->w_cursor.lnum > 1) {
7611 start_arrow(&tpos);
7612 --(curwin->w_cursor.lnum);
7613 coladvance((colnr_T)MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL));
7614 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1; /* so we stay at the end */
7615 } else
7616 vim_beep();
7617}
7618
7619static void ins_home(int c)
7620{
7621 pos_T tpos;
7622
7623 if ((fdo_flags & FDO_HOR0x004) && KeyTyped)
7624 foldOpenCursor();
7625 undisplay_dollar();
7626 tpos = curwin->w_cursor;
7627 if (c == K_C_HOME(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_HOME) << 8))))
7628 curwin->w_cursor.lnum = 1;
7629 curwin->w_cursor.col = 0;
7630 curwin->w_cursor.coladd = 0;
7631 curwin->w_curswant = 0;
7632 start_arrow(&tpos);
7633}
7634
7635static void ins_end(int c)
7636{
7637 pos_T tpos;
7638
7639 if ((fdo_flags & FDO_HOR0x004) && KeyTyped)
7640 foldOpenCursor();
7641 undisplay_dollar();
7642 tpos = curwin->w_cursor;
7643 if (c == K_C_END(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_END) << 8))))
7644 curwin->w_cursor.lnum = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
7645 coladvance((colnr_T)MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL));
7646 curwin->w_curswant = MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL);
7647
7648 start_arrow(&tpos);
7649}
7650
7651static void ins_s_left(void)
7652{
7653 if ((fdo_flags & FDO_HOR0x004) && KeyTyped)
7654 foldOpenCursor();
7655 undisplay_dollar();
7656 if (curwin->w_cursor.lnum > 1 || curwin->w_cursor.col > 0) {
7657 start_arrow(&curwin->w_cursor);
7658 (void)bck_word(1L, FALSE0, FALSE0);
7659 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
7660 } else
7661 vim_beep();
7662}
7663
7664static void ins_right(void)
7665{
7666 if ((fdo_flags & FDO_HOR0x004) && KeyTyped)
7667 foldOpenCursor();
7668 undisplay_dollar();
7669 if (gchar_cursor() != NUL'\000'
7670 || virtual_active()
7671 ) {
7672 start_arrow(&curwin->w_cursor);
7673 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
7674 if (virtual_active())
7675 oneright();
7676 else {
7677 if (has_mbyte)
7678 curwin->w_cursor.col += (*mb_ptr2len)(get_cursor_pos_ptr());
7679 else
7680 ++curwin->w_cursor.col;
7681 }
7682
7683 revins_legal++;
7684 if (revins_chars)
7685 revins_chars--;
7686 }
7687 /* if 'whichwrap' set for cursor in insert mode, may move the
7688 * cursor to the next line */
7689 else if (vim_strchr(p_ww, ']') != NULL((void*)0)
7690 && curwin->w_cursor.lnum < curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count) {
7691 start_arrow(&curwin->w_cursor);
7692 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
7693 ++curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
7694 curwin->w_cursor.col = 0;
7695 } else
7696 vim_beep();
7697}
7698
7699static void ins_s_right(void)
7700{
7701 if ((fdo_flags & FDO_HOR0x004) && KeyTyped)
7702 foldOpenCursor();
7703 undisplay_dollar();
7704 if (curwin->w_cursor.lnum < curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count
7705 || gchar_cursor() != NUL'\000') {
7706 start_arrow(&curwin->w_cursor);
7707 (void)fwd_word(1L, FALSE0, 0);
7708 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
7709 } else
7710 vim_beep();
7711}
7712
7713static void
7714ins_up (
7715 int startcol /* when TRUE move to Insstart.col */
7716)
7717{
7718 pos_T tpos;
7719 linenr_T old_topline = curwin->w_topline;
7720 int old_topfill = curwin->w_topfill;
7721
7722 undisplay_dollar();
7723 tpos = curwin->w_cursor;
7724 if (cursor_up(1L, TRUE1) == OK1) {
7725 if (startcol)
7726 coladvance(getvcol_nolist(&Insstart));
7727 if (old_topline != curwin->w_topline
7728 || old_topfill != curwin->w_topfill
7729 )
7730 redraw_later(VALID10);
7731 start_arrow(&tpos);
7732 can_cindent = TRUE1;
7733 } else
7734 vim_beep();
7735}
7736
7737static void ins_pageup(void)
7738{
7739 pos_T tpos;
7740
7741 undisplay_dollar();
7742
7743 if (mod_mask & MOD_MASK_CTRL0x04) {
7744 /* <C-PageUp>: tab page back */
7745 if (first_tabpage->tp_next != NULL((void*)0)) {
7746 start_arrow(&curwin->w_cursor);
7747 goto_tabpage(-1);
7748 }
7749 return;
7750 }
7751
7752 tpos = curwin->w_cursor;
7753 if (onepage(BACKWARD(-1), 1L) == OK1) {
7754 start_arrow(&tpos);
7755 can_cindent = TRUE1;
7756 } else
7757 vim_beep();
7758}
7759
7760static void
7761ins_down (
7762 int startcol /* when TRUE move to Insstart.col */
7763)
7764{
7765 pos_T tpos;
7766 linenr_T old_topline = curwin->w_topline;
7767 int old_topfill = curwin->w_topfill;
7768
7769 undisplay_dollar();
7770 tpos = curwin->w_cursor;
7771 if (cursor_down(1L, TRUE1) == OK1) {
7772 if (startcol)
7773 coladvance(getvcol_nolist(&Insstart));
7774 if (old_topline != curwin->w_topline
7775 || old_topfill != curwin->w_topfill
7776 )
7777 redraw_later(VALID10);
7778 start_arrow(&tpos);
7779 can_cindent = TRUE1;
7780 } else
7781 vim_beep();
7782}
7783
7784static void ins_pagedown(void)
7785{
7786 pos_T tpos;
7787
7788 undisplay_dollar();
7789
7790 if (mod_mask & MOD_MASK_CTRL0x04) {
7791 /* <C-PageDown>: tab page forward */
7792 if (first_tabpage->tp_next != NULL((void*)0)) {
7793 start_arrow(&curwin->w_cursor);
7794 goto_tabpage(0);
7795 }
7796 return;
7797 }
7798
7799 tpos = curwin->w_cursor;
7800 if (onepage(FORWARD1, 1L) == OK1) {
7801 start_arrow(&tpos);
7802 can_cindent = TRUE1;
7803 } else
7804 vim_beep();
7805}
7806
7807/*
7808 * Handle TAB in Insert or Replace mode.
7809 * Return TRUE when the TAB needs to be inserted like a normal character.
7810 */
7811static int ins_tab(void)
7812{
7813 int ind;
7814 int i;
7815 int temp;
7816
7817 if (Insstart_blank_vcol == MAXCOL(0x7fffffffL) && curwin->w_cursor.lnum == Insstart.lnum)
1
Assuming 'Insstart_blank_vcol' is not equal to 2147483647
→
7818 Insstart_blank_vcol = get_nolist_virtcol();
7819 if (echeck_abbr(TAB'\011' + ABBR_OFF0x100))
2
←
Taking false branch
→
7820 return FALSE0;
7821
7822 ind = inindent(0);
7823 if (ind)
3
←
Assuming 'ind' is 0
→
4
←
Taking false branch
→
7824 can_cindent = FALSE0;
7825
7826 /*
7827 * When nothing special, insert TAB like a normal character
7828 */
7829 if (!curbuf->b_p_et
7830 && !(p_sta && ind && curbuf->b_p_ts != get_sw_value(curbuf))
7831 && get_sts_value() == 0)
7832 return TRUE1;
7833
7834 if (stop_arrow() == FAIL0)
5
←
Taking false branch
→
7835 return TRUE1;
7836
7837 did_ai = FALSE0;
7838 did_si = FALSE0;
7839 can_si = FALSE0;
7840 can_si_back = FALSE0;
7841 AppendToRedobuff((char_u *)"\t");
7842
7843 if (p_sta && ind) /* insert tab in indent, use 'shiftwidth' */
7844 temp = (int)get_sw_value(curbuf);
7845 else if (curbuf->b_p_sts != 0) /* use 'softtabstop' when set */
6
←
Taking false branch
→
7846 temp = (int)get_sts_value();
7847 else /* otherwise use 'tabstop' */
7848 temp = (int)curbuf->b_p_ts;
7849 temp -= get_nolist_virtcol() % temp;
7850
7851 /*
7852 * Insert the first space with ins_char(). It will delete one char in
7853 * replace mode. Insert the rest with ins_str(); it will not delete any
7854 * chars. For VREPLACE mode, we use ins_char() for all characters.
7855 */
7856 ins_char(' ');
7857 while (--temp > 0) {
7
←
Loop condition is false. Execution continues on line 7870
→

7859 ins_char(' ');
7860 else {
7861 ins_str((char_u *)" ");
7862 if (State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40) /* no char replaced */
7863 replace_push(NUL'\000');
7864 }
7865 }
7866
7867 /*
7868 * When 'expandtab' not set: Replace spaces by TABs where possible.
7869 */
7870 if (!curbuf->b_p_et && (get_sts_value() || (p_sta && ind))) {
7871 char_u *ptr;
7872 char_u *saved_line = NULL((void*)0); /* init for GCC */
7873 pos_T pos;
7874 pos_T fpos;
7875 pos_T *cursor;
7876 colnr_T want_vcol, vcol;
7877 int change_col = -1;
7878 int save_list = curwin->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list;
7879
7880 /*
7881 * Get the current line. For VREPLACE mode, don't make real changes
7882 * yet, just work on a copy of the line.
7883 */
7884 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80) {
8
←
Taking false branch
→
7885 pos = curwin->w_cursor;
7886 cursor = &pos;
7887 saved_line = vim_strsave(get_cursor_line_ptr());
7888 ptr = saved_line + pos.col;
7889 } else {
7890 ptr = get_cursor_pos_ptr();
7891 cursor = &curwin->w_cursor;
7892 }
7893
7894 /* When 'L' is not in 'cpoptions' a tab always takes up 'ts' spaces. */
7895 if (vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_LISTWM'L') == NULL((void*)0))
9
←
Taking false branch
→
7896 curwin->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list = FALSE0;
7897
7898 /* Find first white before the cursor */
7899 fpos = curwin->w_cursor;
7900 while (fpos.col > 0 && vim_iswhite(ptr[-1])((ptr[-1]) == ' ' || (ptr[-1]) == '\t')) {
7901 --fpos.col;
7902 --ptr;
7903 }
7904
7905 /* In Replace mode, don't change characters before the insert point. */
7906 if ((State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40)
7907 && fpos.lnum == Insstart.lnum
7908 && fpos.col < Insstart.col) {
7909 ptr += Insstart.col - fpos.col;
7910 fpos.col = Insstart.col;
7911 }
7912
7913 /* compute virtual column numbers of first white and cursor */
7914 getvcol(curwin, &fpos, &vcol, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
7915 getvcol(curwin, cursor, &want_vcol, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
7916
7917 /* Use as many TABs as possible. Beware of 'showbreak' and
7918 * 'linebreak' adding extra virtual columns. */
7919 while (vim_iswhite(*ptr)((*ptr) == ' ' || (*ptr) == '\t')) {
10
←
Loop condition is true. Entering loop body
→
18
←
Loop condition is false. Execution continues on line 7937
→
7920 i = lbr_chartabsize((char_u *)"\t", vcol);
7921 if (vcol + i > want_vcol)
11
←
Taking false branch
→
13
←
Taking false branch
→
15
←
Taking false branch
→
7922 break;
7923 if (*ptr != TAB'\011') {
12
←
Taking false branch
→
14
←
Taking false branch
→
16
←
Taking true branch
→
7924 *ptr = TAB'\011';
7925 if (change_col < 0) {
17
←
Taking true branch
→
7926 change_col = fpos.col; /* Column of first change */
7927 /* May have to adjust Insstart */
7928 if (fpos.lnum == Insstart.lnum && fpos.col < Insstart.col)
7929 Insstart.col = fpos.col;
7930 }
7931 }
7932 ++fpos.col;
7933 ++ptr;
7934 vcol += i;
7935 }
7936
7937 if (change_col >= 0) {
19
←
Assuming 'change_col' is >= 0
→
20
←
Taking true branch
→
7938 int repl_off = 0;
7939
7940 /* Skip over the spaces we need. */
7941 while (vcol < want_vcol && *ptr == ' ') {
7942 vcol += lbr_chartabsize(ptr, vcol);
7943 ++ptr;
7944 ++repl_off;
7945 }
7946 if (vcol > want_vcol) {
21
←
Taking false branch
→
7947 /* Must have a char with 'showbreak' just before it. */
7948 --ptr;
7949 --repl_off;
7950 }
7951 fpos.col += repl_off;
7952
7953 /* Delete following spaces. */
7954 i = cursor->col - fpos.col;
7955 if (i > 0) {
22
←
Assuming 'i' is <= 0
→
23
←
Taking false branch
→
7956 STRMOVE(ptr, ptr + i)memmove((ptr), (ptr + i), strlen((char *)(ptr + i)) + 1);
7957 /* correct replace stack. */
7958 if ((State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40)
7959 && !(State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
7960 )
7961 for (temp = i; --temp >= 0; )
7962 replace_join(repl_off);
7963 }
7964 cursor->col -= i;
7965
7966 /*
7967 * In VREPLACE mode, we haven't changed anything yet. Do it now by
7968 * backspacing over the changed spacing and then inserting the new
7969 * spacing.
7970 */
7971 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80) {
24
←
Taking true branch
→
7972 /* Backspace from real cursor to change_col */
7973 backspace_until_column(change_col);
25
←
Calling 'backspace_until_column'
→
7974
7975 /* Insert each char in saved_line from changed_col to
7976 * ptr-cursor */
7977 ins_bytes_len(saved_line + change_col,
7978 cursor->col - change_col);
7979 }
7980 }
7981
7982 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
7983 free(saved_line);
7984 curwin->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list = save_list;
7985 }
7986
7987 return FALSE0;
7988}
7989
7990/*
7991 * Handle CR or NL in insert mode.
7992 * Return TRUE when it can't undo.
7993 */
7994static int ins_eol(int c)
7995{
7996 int i;
7997
7998 if (echeck_abbr(c + ABBR_OFF0x100))
7999 return FALSE0;
8000 if (stop_arrow() == FAIL0)
8001 return TRUE1;
8002 undisplay_dollar();
8003
8004 /*
8005 * Strange Vi behaviour: In Replace mode, typing a NL will not delete the
8006 * character under the cursor. Only push a NUL on the replace stack,
8007 * nothing to put back when the NL is deleted.
8008 */
8009 if ((State & REPLACE_FLAG0x40)
8010 && !(State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
8011 )
8012 replace_push(NUL'\000');
8013
8014 /*
8015 * In VREPLACE mode, a NL replaces the rest of the line, and starts
8016 * replacing the next line, so we push all of the characters left on the
8017 * line onto the replace stack. This is not done here though, it is done
8018 * in open_line().
8019 */
8020
8021 /* Put cursor on NUL if on the last char and coladd is 1 (happens after
8022 * CTRL-O). */
8023 if (virtual_active() && curwin->w_cursor.coladd > 0)
8024 coladvance(getviscol());
8025
8026 if (p_altkeymap && p_fkmap)
8027 fkmap(NL'\012');
8028 /* NL in reverse insert will always start in the end of
8029 * current line. */
8030 if (revins_on)
8031 curwin->w_cursor.col += (colnr_T)STRLEN(get_cursor_pos_ptr())strlen((char *)(get_cursor_pos_ptr()));
8032
8033 AppendToRedobuff(NL_STR(char_u *)"\012");
8034 i = open_line(FORWARD1,
8035 has_format_option(FO_RET_COMS'r') ? OPENLINE_DO_COM2 :
8036 0, old_indent);
8037 old_indent = 0;
8038 can_cindent = TRUE1;
8039 /* When inserting a line the cursor line must never be in a closed fold. */
8040 foldOpenCursor();
8041
8042 return !i;
8043}
8044
8045/*
8046 * Handle digraph in insert mode.
8047 * Returns character still to be inserted, or NUL when nothing remaining to be
8048 * done.
8049 */
8050static int ins_digraph(void)
8051{
8052 int c;
8053 int cc;
8054 int did_putchar = FALSE0;
8055
8056 pc_status = PC_STATUS_UNSET0;
8057 if (redrawing() && !char_avail()) {
8058 /* may need to redraw when no more chars available now */
8059 ins_redraw(FALSE0);
8060
8061 edit_putchar('?', TRUE1);
8062 did_putchar = TRUE1;
8063 add_to_showcmd_c(Ctrl_K11);
8064 }
8065
8066#ifdef USE_ON_FLY_SCROLL
8067 dont_scroll = TRUE1; /* disallow scrolling here */
8068#endif
8069
8070 /* don't map the digraph chars. This also prevents the
8071 * mode message to be deleted when ESC is hit */
8072 ++no_mapping;
8073 ++allow_keys;
8074 c = plain_vgetc();
8075 --no_mapping;
8076 --allow_keys;
8077 if (did_putchar)
8078 /* when the line fits in 'columns' the '?' is at the start of the next
8079 * line and will not be removed by the redraw */
8080 edit_unputchar();
8081
8082 if (IS_SPECIAL(c)((c) < 0) || mod_mask) { /* special key */
8083 clear_showcmd();
8084 insert_special(c, TRUE1, FALSE0);
8085 return NUL'\000';
8086 }
8087 if (c != ESC'\033') {
8088 did_putchar = FALSE0;
8089 if (redrawing() && !char_avail()) {
8090 /* may need to redraw when no more chars available now */
8091 ins_redraw(FALSE0);
8092
8093 if (char2cells(c) == 1) {
8094 ins_redraw(FALSE0);
8095 edit_putchar(c, TRUE1);
8096 did_putchar = TRUE1;
8097 }
8098 add_to_showcmd_c(c);
8099 }
8100 ++no_mapping;
8101 ++allow_keys;
8102 cc = plain_vgetc();
8103 --no_mapping;
8104 --allow_keys;
8105 if (did_putchar)
8106 /* when the line fits in 'columns' the '?' is at the start of the
8107 * next line and will not be removed by a redraw */
8108 edit_unputchar();
8109 if (cc != ESC'\033') {
8110 AppendToRedobuff((char_u *)CTRL_V_STR"\026");
8111 c = getdigraph(c, cc, TRUE1);
8112 clear_showcmd();
8113 return c;
8114 }
8115 }
8116 clear_showcmd();
8117 return NUL'\000';
8118}
8119
8120/*
8121 * Handle CTRL-E and CTRL-Y in Insert mode: copy char from other line.
8122 * Returns the char to be inserted, or NUL if none found.
8123 */
8124int ins_copychar(linenr_T lnum)
8125{
8126 int c;
8127 int temp;
8128 char_u *ptr, *prev_ptr;
8129
8130 if (lnum < 1 || lnum > curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count) {
8131 vim_beep();
8132 return NUL'\000';
8133 }
8134
8135 /* try to advance to the cursor column */
8136 temp = 0;
8137 ptr = ml_get(lnum);
8138 prev_ptr = ptr;
8139 validate_virtcol();
8140 while ((colnr_T)temp < curwin->w_virtcol && *ptr != NUL'\000') {
8141 prev_ptr = ptr;
8142 temp += lbr_chartabsize_adv(&ptr, (colnr_T)temp);
8143 }
8144 if ((colnr_T)temp > curwin->w_virtcol)
8145 ptr = prev_ptr;
8146
8147 c = (*mb_ptr2char)(ptr);
8148 if (c == NUL'\000')
8149 vim_beep();
8150 return c;
8151}
8152
8153/*
8154 * CTRL-Y or CTRL-E typed in Insert mode.
8155 */
8156static int ins_ctrl_ey(int tc)
8157{
8158 int c = tc;
8159
8160 if (ctrl_x_mode == CTRL_X_SCROLL2) {
8161 if (c == Ctrl_Y25)
8162 scrolldown_clamp();
8163 else
8164 scrollup_clamp();
8165 redraw_later(VALID10);
8166 } else {
8167 c = ins_copychar(curwin->w_cursor.lnum + (c == Ctrl_Y25 ? -1 : 1));
8168 if (c != NUL'\000') {
8169 long tw_save;
8170
8171 /* The character must be taken literally, insert like it
8172 * was typed after a CTRL-V, and pretend 'textwidth'
8173 * wasn't set. Digits, 'o' and 'x' are special after a
8174 * CTRL-V, don't use it for these. */
8175 if (c < 256 && !isalnum(c)((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((c))] & (unsigned short int) _ISalnum
))
8176 AppendToRedobuff((char_u *)CTRL_V_STR"\026"); /* CTRL-V */
8177 tw_save = curbuf->b_p_tw;
8178 curbuf->b_p_tw = -1;
8179 insert_special(c, TRUE1, FALSE0);
8180 curbuf->b_p_tw = tw_save;
8181 revins_chars++;
8182 revins_legal++;
8183 c = Ctrl_V22; /* pretend CTRL-V is last character */
8184 auto_format(FALSE0, TRUE1);
8185 }
8186 }
8187 return c;
8188}
8189
8190/*
8191 * Try to do some very smart auto-indenting.
8192 * Used when inserting a "normal" character.
8193 */
8194static void ins_try_si(int c)
8195{
8196 pos_T *pos, old_pos;
8197 char_u *ptr;
8198 int i;
8199 int temp;
8200
8201 /*
8202 * do some very smart indenting when entering '{' or '}'
8203 */
8204 if (((did_si || can_si_back) && c == '{') || (can_si && c == '}')) {
8205 /*
8206 * for '}' set indent equal to indent of line containing matching '{'
8207 */
8208 if (c == '}' && (pos = findmatch(NULL((void*)0), '{')) != NULL((void*)0)) {
8209 old_pos = curwin->w_cursor;
8210 /*
8211 * If the matching '{' has a ')' immediately before it (ignoring
8212 * white-space), then line up with the start of the line
8213 * containing the matching '(' if there is one. This handles the
8214 * case where an "if (..\n..) {" statement continues over multiple
8215 * lines -- webb
8216 */
8217 ptr = ml_get(pos->lnum);
8218 i = pos->col;
8219 if (i > 0) /* skip blanks before '{' */
8220 while (--i > 0 && vim_iswhite(ptr[i])((ptr[i]) == ' ' || (ptr[i]) == '\t'))
8221 ;
8222 curwin->w_cursor.lnum = pos->lnum;
8223 curwin->w_cursor.col = i;
8224 if (ptr[i] == ')' && (pos = findmatch(NULL((void*)0), '(')) != NULL((void*)0))
8225 curwin->w_cursor = *pos;
8226 i = get_indent();
8227 curwin->w_cursor = old_pos;
8228 if (State & VREPLACE_FLAG0x80)
8229 change_indent(INDENT_SET1, i, FALSE0, NUL'\000', TRUE1);
8230 else
8231 (void)set_indent(i, SIN_CHANGED1);
8232 } else if (curwin->w_cursor.col > 0) {
8233 /*
8234 * when inserting '{' after "O" reduce indent, but not
8235 * more than indent of previous line
8236 */
8237 temp = TRUE1;
8238 if (c == '{' && can_si_back && curwin->w_cursor.lnum > 1) {
8239 old_pos = curwin->w_cursor;
8240 i = get_indent();
8241 while (curwin->w_cursor.lnum > 1) {
8242 ptr = skipwhite(ml_get(--(curwin->w_cursor.lnum)));
8243
8244 /* ignore empty lines and lines starting with '#'. */
8245 if (*ptr != '#' && *ptr != NUL'\000')
8246 break;
8247 }
8248 if (get_indent() >= i)
8249 temp = FALSE0;
8250 curwin->w_cursor = old_pos;
8251 }
8252 if (temp)
8253 shift_line(TRUE1, FALSE0, 1, TRUE1);
8254 }
8255 }
8256
8257 /*
8258 * set indent of '#' always to 0
8259 */
8260 if (curwin->w_cursor.col > 0 && can_si && c == '#') {
8261 /* remember current indent for next line */
8262 old_indent = get_indent();
8263 (void)set_indent(0, SIN_CHANGED1);
8264 }
8265
8266 /* Adjust ai_col, the char at this position can be deleted. */
8267 if (ai_col > curwin->w_cursor.col)
8268 ai_col = curwin->w_cursor.col;
8269}
8270
8271/*
8272 * Get the value that w_virtcol would have when 'list' is off.
8273 * Unless 'cpo' contains the 'L' flag.
8274 */
8275static colnr_T get_nolist_virtcol(void)
8276{
8277 if (curwin->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list && vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_LISTWM'L') == NULL((void*)0))
8278 return getvcol_nolist(&curwin->w_cursor);
8279 validate_virtcol();
8280 return curwin->w_virtcol;
8281}
8282
8283/*
8284 * Handle the InsertCharPre autocommand.
8285 * "c" is the character that was typed.
8286 * Return a pointer to allocated memory with the replacement string.
8287 * Return NULL to continue inserting "c".
8288 */
8289static char_u *do_insert_char_pre(int c)
8290{
8291 char_u buf[MB_MAXBYTES21 + 1];
8292
8293 /* Return quickly when there is nothing to do. */
8294 if (!has_insertcharpre())
8295 return NULL((void*)0);
8296
8297 if (has_mbyte)
8298 buf[(*mb_char2bytes)(c, buf)] = NUL'\000';
8299 else {
8300 buf[0] = c;
8301 buf[1] = NUL'\000';
8302 }
8303
8304 /* Lock the text to avoid weird things from happening. */
8305 ++textlock;
8306 set_vim_var_string(VV_CHAR, buf, -1); /* set v:char */
8307
8308 char_u *res = NULL((void*)0);
8309 if (apply_autocmds(EVENT_INSERTCHARPRE, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FALSE0, curbuf)) {
8310 /* Get the value of v:char. It may be empty or more than one
8311 * character. Only use it when changed, otherwise continue with the
8312 * original character to avoid breaking autoindent. */
8313 if (STRCMP(buf, get_vim_var_str(VV_CHAR))strcmp((char *)(buf), (char *)(get_vim_var_str(VV_CHAR))) != 0)
8314 res = vim_strsave(get_vim_var_str(VV_CHAR));
8315 }
8316
8317 set_vim_var_string(VV_CHAR, NULL((void*)0), -1); /* clear v:char */
8318 --textlock;
8319
8320 return res;
8321}
